Xu's Public House offers some delicious dishes in a swanky setting!  I don't eat seafood so we stayed away from their extensive seafood selection. We loved everything we ordered. The snow white pork buns were exceptional. The outside is crisp but then instantly give way to a fluffy, slightly sweet dough and savory filling. We also ordered the sheng jian boa, but they were showed up by the snow white pork buns. The Shanghai soup dumplings were excellent. The dough was thick like I like it and the filling was hearty and delicious, especially dipped in the vinegar sauce. The beef chow fun was very tasty as were the sauteed pea shoots with garlic (these were even better than Han Dynasty's because they were less garlicy). The scallion pancakes and egg tarts were also good, but not as special as the other dishes. In addition to the yummy food, the service was very attentive.
No comment
No comment

This is a really solid Chinese place. Dishes all tasted pretty good across the board. Favs: chicken with assorted veggies, the grilled fish filet, pea shoots, pinecone fish, XLB also good. Environment is chic inside. Overall great place.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came in for lunch to go and there was a hair in my chicken corn soup :(((( the ambiance is great, food came out fast, they let me sit at the bar as I waited for my to-go order and even gave me water. Unfortunately I couldn't finish my soup due to the hair. :(

I came with my bf on Sunday night for dinner after visiting the Union Square market. We ordered salt and pepper squid and it was tasty. The batter was light and crispy. We also ordered the dim sum platter aka the Three Kinds of Dumplings which comes with 2 prawn dumplings, 2 Su Mai and 2 Bamboo Fungus dumplings and their Singapore Mai Fun. Service was friendly and attentive.
No comment
No comment

I ordered Kung Pao Chicken, I have no idea what recipe that  the chef follows to make this dish. It is totally different from traditional Kung Pao Chicken that I have eaten ever in around New York City and the world. It tasted so bad. I have order same from fast food Chinese joints which is better than this one. Horrible. They have the audacity to charge three times the price other restaurants'. DON'T GO THERE, DONT SPEND YOUR MONEY THERE.

This is the place if you're looking for some fancy and unique dim sum! I came here with my family when we were visiting nyc for the weekend. We ordered about 8 dim sum dishes for the 4 of us and we were pretty full! We ordered the snow white pork buns, Shanghai soup dumplings, crab meat soup dumplings, prawn dumplings, Avocado & shrimp spring rolls, elegant swan puff pastry, salted egg custard buns, and fried pot stickers. Everything was really good! My favorites would have to be the soup dumplings and swan puff pastry! It is on the pricier side but I would definitely come back here!

Normally, I am pretty intimidated going into Chinese restaurants, expecting to use Chinese to order food, with the unfounded fear I would be judged for ordering with an American twang. The servers were very nice and attentive when we went in a large group and helped explain the menu to my non-Chinese party members so I would not have to. While I am well acquainted with many of the dishes, especially Xiao Long Bao (also known as soup dumplings) and Chinese broccoli, it was nice to eat upscale Chinese food at the heart of Union Square.

Xu's Public House was a bit disappointing. While it markets that it has a bar with specialty cocktails, they seem to only have one bartender and if the bartender is not there then no cocktails. In fairness, the manager will make you a gin and tonic or a martini but that is about. There wine list is very simple, Red or White. The dim sum now seems to be brought in from outside rather than being made in house. With that said, xiaolongbao (soup dumplings) are very good. The rest of the food is also pretty good too except that the sweet and sour pork is made from a very poor cut of pork. Seems to me that they are cutting too many corners.
No comment
Had the cucumber salad amazing had the shrimp wonton soup so good and the ginger beef was delicious and service A+

Lovely servers, big portions, wonderful for sharing, great ambience -- what more is there to say? It's a bit on the pricier side, but we had a wonderful experience. Plus, they bring out oranges at the end! I feel like you can't go wrong with any of the dishes (we really enjoyed the garlic chicken, salt and pepper pork, and scallion pancakes. The egg tarts were fantastic too). I will also say, the value for money is great. As you can see below, the portion sizes are quite nice. Overall, wonderful experience. I'll be back!!
This is a new team operating the restaurant. Different menus but uses the same name and apparently same yelp profile...

Unfortunate that this place is currently closed. It was really good. I went twice and both times everything I had was delicious. It was upscale Chinese food in Union Square. I loved all their dim sum. Their truffle wontons and shumai were delicious. I also loved the giant soup dumplings they serve. Their noodles are fresh. I love the King Crab cold noodle dish. Their salt baked lobster and cheese is really good as well. Their egg yolk buns are definitely what you have to order for dessert. I truly hope they reopen. If they do, definitely check it out!
Overall good quality, attentive service. The food is quite delicate and light. The lobster dish is delicious and good portion for two.
No comment

The food was high quality and came out quickly. The pine one fish was definitely a favorite and very shareable! A bit pricey, but for the quality, it is definitely understandable. We sat near the door so it was cold with everyone walking in and out, but the place was otherwise great! Took a bit to get seated, so I would recommend a reservation.

Clean restaurant and cute ambiance. The service was great even tho the food/drinks took forever to come out. Some dishes looked well decorated while the taste is on the traditional side. The fired eggplant that was recommended as appetizer/veggie dish doesn't look good for picture yet quite tasty.
No comment
No comment
Good restaurant to go, very nice food with good service. Especially second floor , nice place for private party.
Chinese Asian Fusion Restaurant in Union Square. Jus plain nothing special Chinese fast food please. Just not food that I expected.
No comment
Delicious food and quick, friendly service. The kids loved it. Can't wait to return!!
Nice environment great authentic food (we had dim sum) all in convenient location near Union Sq!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Stopped by on the way back from the yankee game with a friend for the "soft-opening" under the new ownership. What a great stop. Beyond the exceptional service the food was delicious. High quality Manhattan Asian cuisine. Would stop by again and recommend to a friend.
Best chinese restraunt in town. Have to come to try, as a Chinese, high recommended the Gulu pork, and dimsum delicious and yummy!

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: I called today inquiring about a private event pricing and a man who picked up was very rude. I asked for the price for 70 people which he responded to $35/person; but according to him it is impossible to buyout the entire restaurant for 70 people. According to him, he can do 50 people. Which then I asked, is it the same price? How much will that be for 50 people? (Thinking there might be a price variance given that there are less people) which he then answered "I already told you it's 35!" And remarked something in Chinese thereafter. What comes next? He hangs up. Given that this place gives an elevated dim sum experience compared to its China town counterparts like jing fong or golden unicorn, the communication and public relations are sub par compared to the latter mentioned. I can attest to that since I am in contact with the other dim sum places and was simply appalled by the impression and representation this man made.
No comment

Very expensive for a dim sum type restaurant. The mushroom xlb was interesting but difficult to eat. I didn't really care for the truffle shrimp dumplings, though my bf was a fan. The pork buns also seemed undercooked... I'm used to a nice sweet glaze on top too, but it just tasted like uncooked dough. Overall, the food was very nicely presented, but just ok taste wise for me. A bit too pricey as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

It's really one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in NYC. It's more like a mix of Shanghainess food and Cantonese food. My bf and I ordered crab meat soup dumplings (pretty authentic), and BBQ pork buns, one of their branding dishes. I like the creativity in the BBQ buns although it meets more the taste of Americans. Tao Jiao egg tarts were full of milky flavors (but almost too much). Fish filet tasted fresh and tender. Ginseng soup was not great. But overall I'd like to recommend this place.

To be honest its more like a 3.75. I came here with a friend after seeing all the raving reviews and i was slightly disappointed. Pros are that the restaurant's decor is upscale without being suffocating and they are surprisingly creative with food presentation. The food however are not as impressive. We had ordered the Shanghai soup dumpling, the bbq buns, the shrimp dumplings and the pork bone broth noodles. They were all ok, the best being the bbq bun. This is not to say that the food wasnt good though. The food was not impressive but neither was it disappointing.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My fiancé found this place and since it's new we decided to try it.  Very nice, modern atmosphere, with a good layout.  Service was great and quick from start to finish.  The menu is authentic Shanghainese and all of the courses were delicious. The truffle wontons and blue crab with rice cakes stood out the most!  We also had an amazing tea with our dinner which was extremely refreshing.  The ribeye entree came out with a bang (see photo) and did not disappoint.  Overall a great experience.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food was good overall but overpriced, even with a Yelp coupon. The snow buns are solid tho but nothing was amazing for the price. I feel like you're just paying for the nice decor that you're eating in which isn't what I want but for some it's what they want to pay for so make your choice
No comment

I really have no complaints about this restaurant. Food is an A+, service is an A+, interior design A+ and pricing A+. Xu's Public House is a hybrid between Chinese traditional dishes such as dim sum and soup dumplings, with an American flare. So far I've been here twice (once for lunch and once for dinner) and each time, I try to order something different since their menu is bountiful. I really enjoyed their truffle dumplings, porn buns and dim sum items. When you come for dinner, they provide you with complimentary Hong Kong cakes to start! Two big tips  for this spot, if you check in on yelp, you get 10% off of your original bill and this restaurant is also  BYOB! Reservations are easy to make online as well.
No comment
No comment

Amazing contemporary Shanghainese Restuarant in Union Square. I came in with my friend around 5 Pm and they seated us upstairs that have spacious tables and amazing decor. The manager Kenny was very friendly to come greet us and tell about his restaurant and top dishes to try. We ordered the bbq pork buns, live crab noodles, mushroom Xlb, steamed sea urchin egg, peach jelly egg tarts, live crab rice cakes,  and blueberry yam pudding. Every thing was plated so well. If you want to experience a more upscale Shanghai joint, come here.
No comment
No comment

Some of the food items were over priced I believe but their food quality is pretty good. Some is worth and some is not. We ordered the soup dumplings, was 3 pieces for $9...so I had high hopes of differences but it was pretty typical to me. It was of course good but I had similar ones at cheaper price... However the cold noodles with king crab and uni was reallllly good. Though its like $42 I guess it's worth a try if you care more about the food quality. The noodle texture was perfect and the crab was fresh. Their chrysanthemum tea we ordered was good. I also like the atmosphere here!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The place is just soft opening but gave a pleasant surprise when my husband and I went there last night. Immediately you can tell from the decor and setting at Xu's, the owner's  ambition for an Asian-inspired fine dining experience. Overall, the atmosphere is amazing. For food, we ordered BBQ pork bun, fried wonton for starters and they didn't let us down, especially the BBQ pork bun, you can feel the layers of flavors gradually build in as the pork melts in your mouth. For main course we had King Crab cold noodle with sea urchin-- a taste of summer, I'd say, which reminds me of the good old days by the sea. We also had soup and sea urchin steamed egg, etc. For service, the waiters are very nice but kinda of lack experience, which shall be improved with time. Overall, 5 starts, I'd love to see more experience-oriented modern Chinese restaurants in the city.

Very nice place with decent food! Probably 'g top Chinese restaurants here. The food comes in small portion, and generally not oily/greasy. For cold appetizers, we get blueberry yam and seitan( kaofu). For food, we have special- chicken casserole, rice soup(泡饭), asparagus and mushroom, etc. Fresh ingredients that are not overwhelmed by spices or oil. There are also dim sum items: I would recommend any soup dumplings, snow mountain pork bun and egg tart. The place looks like it's a high-end pricy place. It's moderately priced with byob option if you are into this.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wonderful upscale Chinese restaurant. The food is picture worthy as well as tasty! Interior is nicely done. Manager came out and chatted with my table. Wonderful chat. Food quality is super nice as well. Certain items made from scratch, how awesome is that. Will definitely be back soon
No comment
No comment

Awesome Shanghai food. I like its upscale decor immediately when walk in. Newly opened. Great place to treat friends and have a party. The service is very attentative from waitress to manager and owner. They are all hands on and take care of customers for any little problems. All food are like an art piece. It has Chinese tradition also fused with American culture. Highly recommended!

Over advertising. mediocre taste and service. I do not feel welcomed at all. We spoke him in Chinese he responded to us in English, so I figured that he did not understand Chinese, so I started to speak English with him, but he responded to me in Chinese.... for the whole time he talked in very low voice including bringing our food. I barely heard him. The food was just OK. Nothing special. But the price was not low at all.
Food is good！ They might need more waiters or waitress to help because the sercive was a little unorganized.

Most food in this restaurant are very delicious. I really like the ways they make food and keep the original taste, especially the steak cooked with high temperature rock, so different from those steak burned and oil everywhere in other restaurant. Plus the place is nice and soon enough they will get a wine license then I can sit there have a red wine and enjoy the steak.

Can't say enough about the food. It makes me miss China. We love everything we tried, the tofu soup, see urchin tart, crab soup dumplings, foie Gras tart, Tao Jiao tart etc. The taste is delicate and well balanced. We can't wait to go back again!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Came here for lunch, dim sums were on point. The BBQ buns were our favorite. Everything was great for the price we paid, except the waitress was ice cold!
Fantastic place for dinner. Food is amazing and waiters are soooooo nice. Highly recommend it.
Beautiful decor and Exceptional dishes. Delicious with the capital D! Highly recommend people to try this modern Shanghainese place.
Very good quality of Shanghainese food, the environment is nice and the dishes are elegantly prepared. Squid ink tofu soup is very special.

Service is a bit slow and chaotic but food is not bad. We dined on Friday night it was medium packed. The hostess seems very disorganized maybe need more training. Recommend abalone and chicken, salted egg rice cake. Will go back for dim sum and congee.
No comment

Wow. Just wow.  Authentic Chinese food combined with the plating of an upscale Michelin restaurant.  We ordered the Hokkaido sea urchin pastry, squid ink shrimp dumplings, king crab cold noodles with sea urchin and black truffle stir fried lobster.  Everything was bursting with flavor .. can't wait to try everything else on their menu!
No comment

Xu's Public House at Union Square is pretty good. The stirred Wagyu beef with edible rice bowl is excellent. Soup dumplings are tasty, but a little thicker and not as soupy as Joe Shanghai's. Upscale and modern looking place without an upscale price. Great service and nice atmosphere. Would eat here again.
I love this restaurant so much! The ingredients and the taste is perfect! I totally recommend this restaurant not only for daily meals or family gathering.
The beautiful environment, the dim sum is very delicious and the presentation is beautiful , the waiters were very nice . Just same like last time when I was here,Quality is same as very good

This place is a little overpriced. Portions are small for Chinese restaurant. A medium size crab meat soup dumpling is sold at $12 without much crab meat (most filling is pork). Service is good but I'd rather have food with better value. Four of us ended up going to East Village nearby to have a more solid second meal.

Awesome food, 2 stars less because service was not up to the mark. The server got the shrimp dish but we were waiting for 20 minutes for the rice. Obviously, the shrimp got cold meanwhile. But the shrimp & crab noodles were so full of flavors. Appetizers & entree, portions were unreasonably small for one person. So, order accordingly. Ideally, this restaurant should be rated at $$$ if you relate price of the dish with the portion served.

Everything we got here was so delish. Highly recommend the Shanghai truffle wontons. They are to die for. Service is great. Atmosphere is nice and cozy. It's on the pricier side but you can taste the quality so totally worth it.

As a guy borned Guangdong and grown-up in Shanghai, this restaurant made the taste of my memory. I can't i imagine I can taste all these ingredients in such price. If you are a foodie who loves the original taste of the ingredients, you should definitely come and try.
Authentic food from Shanghai. I like the sesame balls desserts the most. Noodle entrees were a little mild on flavor. Overall good experience!

Great dine in experience for Chinese food. Very delicate and delicious dishes with very high food quality. Staffs are super friendly and helpful. Will check it out again in the near future for sure!! Highly recommend this place for high quality Chinese food!!
The environment is great, but the food really tastes mediocre... We went there right after it opens. The kitchen was too busy so they forgot one of the dishes we ordered. Gave us a 50% discount tho.

Beautiful Shanghainese&Asian fusion place hidden at union square west. I was surprised by the skylight on the 2nd floor, stunning decor and fine dining experience. Good place for a date or group gathering. we started with the avocado smoked salmon, a fresh combo of seafood and veggies. Snow mountain BBQ pork bun was amazing, best BBQ bun I have ever had. Different flavored handmade dumplings bring me the memories of what I had in Shanghai years ago, worth to try. The Morchella esculenta chrysanthemum tofu soap and Lobster risotto are very tasty too. Definitely will come back.
Great restaurant with awesome and innovative dish, owner attempted to achieve more than satisfactory experience from all eater.  Return is must.

This is a very disappointing experience. You can tell that the place is trying to be upscale but it lacks attention to details. Examples include the rest room is super dirty, the tea cup they gave to us was broken and filled with dirty cleaning water. Servers are nice but you can clearly tell that they are inexperience as I have to raise my hand for more than 30 seconds for them to notice me. Service is extremely slow. We didn't order much but we ended up spending two hours here for lunch, mostly waiting for food. This is very surprising as the restaurant doesn't seem to be that busy with plenty of empty seats. The foods are just ok, and definitely not worth it considering the wait time. The pork bun is not as good as the ones at Tom Ho Wan. The soup inside Shanghai Soup dumplings is really good but one of our friends from Shanghai said the meat is too lean. She has had better ones in flushing. We are very surprised by the four bubble yelp review. We do not recommend this place and will not come back again.
Food looks pretty but the taste is not local. Not good for Chinese to come here. But the environment is perfect which is quiet and beautiful.
No comment

In the four years I've been in New York, this is the best Chinese food I've had in the city. Beautiful decor and the dishes are Chinese with a modern twist that works really well. They just opened and it's definitely worth the visit before they get too popular.

I ordered a delivery through the RICEPO app. I ordered the ginseng chicken soup which is undrinkable. It was the bitterest thing I taste in my whole life. Since I'm Chinese and I do cook, I know it should be some of a bitterness if u add ginseng in the food, but that soup was wayyyy too much. And there were no sign of saying that this soup is a bitter soup base anywhere through their menu or elsewhere. I asked for help and see if they made a mistake in the ingredient, all I get was the answers like:"drink slow, it is bitter, it's your fault that u can't handle the bitterness". I don't even want a refund from this, but the attitude of the restaurant is just ARROGANT.

The place gives you a high-end vibe when you walk in.  The skylight on the second floor is definitely unique in NYC. However, this is all the positives about this place.  The service is better than average, but waitstaff is very obvious that they don't know much about the menu.  The biggest disappointment is the food.  Almost all the food we ordered are very underwhelming, taste bland and low quality.  I think they try too hard on the presentation, and completely overlooked the taste of the dish.  We will not go back.  There are so many better Chinese food for lower price too.

I wanted to love this place. It has two floors both beautifully decorated. Very cool and comfortable. We went there last night to celebrate two birthdays and we were a table of six. This place doesn't have a liquor license so we brought sake.  We asked the hostess for sake glasses.  She looked as if we had asked for this in a Mexican restaurant. I mean it is an Asian fusion place!  She was not able to offer a glass in lieu of the sake glass. We suggested water or wine glasses. She finally affirmed that she could bring wine glasses!  I mean you advertise you don't have a liquor license.  I would think you would be able to articulate glassware for it!  Then the waitress who honestly responded " I am not good at explaining things" when simple questions about the menu were posed   Then the execution of the dishes!  Forgotten dishes followed by inefficient delivery of the ones that were ready! Like we want two orders of shrimp dumplings and we get one.  In response to where the second one is, we get it's cooking!  At the end when entrees were being brought, 4 people got their dishes and two did not like for 1/2 hour!  We refused it at that point.  After asking to speak to manager they agreed to take the two dishes off the bill. I would think so since you never brought it!  Awful awful awful!  To top it off, the taste of the food is not great. It is meh at best. We are veteran restaurant eaters all New Yorkers.  Worse over all in a looonnnggg time!
Food is great, but needs to work on service. Also no alcohol licence yet... Well go back in a few months time...

Not sure why the host is a grumpy old dude. Not a good first impression when you walk in. Food is very average and bland. Soup dumplings were a huge disappointment. Hand picked crab meat is a nice idea, but really can't tell the difference except the small pieces of shell left in them. 红烧肉太一般，不嫩，没味儿。
I would rate it 4.5 but had to choose between whole numbers.  Refined subtle flavors, lovely presentation, and good service all contribute to a pleasant dining experience.

This is a brand new superb mainly Chinese style restaurant. We had 2 of the teas: five elements and a fruit tea both excellent. All the dishes and soups and appetizers were outstanding and all ingredients very fresh. Also the egg tarts for dessert are not seen outside of China. Highest recommendation for  food and service and modern clean decor.
such a nice place. Food is amazing!!! Please go try the food and enjoy the environment.

This brand new restaurant nearby union square is bound to be a gem once people step inside its doors and realize how incredible it is. The flavors of the food blew our minds, because the attention to detail and quality ingredients really shows. Not sure where to start because everything we had was amazing. My favorite dishes were the uni pastry (buttery uni topped onto a sweet flaky layered pastry) and Orange shrimp (crispy and huge shrimps with a tasty orange sauce). We also loved the Yangchow fried rice. It's made steamed instead of being cooked in a rice cooker which maintains the natural shape and flavors  of rice. This is just an example of how the extra time they put into the quality of the food really pays off. Other things to mention that we're top of the line - steamed egg topped w caviar, tiger prawn and lobster risotto, morchella esuelenta soup dumpling, squid ink shrimp dumplings, five elements tea. Last thing to mention of course is the beautifully designed interior and incredible service. We can't wait to be back as this spot really exceeded our expectations.
No comment
No comment

I was sad to learn that the former neighborhood staple Sugarburg was closing. I didn't know why and it seemed that it happened out of no where! Regardless, time goes on and there's a new player in this space. H&H took the former Sugarburg and created a more seamless theme throughout the space. Part casual bar, part group hang spot, part semi-high end bar this spot seems to tick all the boxes for a great hang in the area. It's a different vibe than rock a rolla and union pool but it adds variety in the neighborhood with it's cleaner feel than the other bars in the area. There's a smaller beer selection but you get your money's worth with a six dollar large pint for lager. Staff here is friendly and there's ton of seating space within the bar. I'd definitely come here if you're looking for a more elevated bar experience with your friends!

Went here this weekend with some friends. We loved the beer shot deals they have all the time and the fries were delicious. Need to come back and try more of the menu. Special shout out for their rendition on the pickle back shot, the sauerback!

I was bummed when Sugarburg closed but now H&H has taken its place and it is fantastic! Inexpensive but really good drinks and the food from Dog Day Afternoon is fabulous. The Chicago dogs are so good but most impressive is the schnitzel which is thankfully pork and perfectly thinly fried - as it is supposed to be. Great location and easy to sit down and have a conversation.
No comment

Popped in to the new no 7 on a weeknight this week and overall had a good meal, though I now know exactly what I'd do if I came back. While the cocktail list and cocktails themselves were fine, I'd grab your beer of choice or a classic cocktail and snag a seat at the bar. From there, I'd order the broccoli tacos (they pack a ton of flavor on their own but the add a few dashes of the sauce they'll bring out and it's a flavor explosion) and also a side of fries (as long as you like em McDonalds style). That's it - that's the order. If you absolutely must have a larger meal, I think the fried chicken sandwich was quite tasty. Tried the cheeseburger too but it was very minimalistic and frankly, very rare - didn't taste like much else than... meat. *shrugs*

I've been waiting for this to open for months.  So cute inside and has a real neighborhood feel.   Really good drinks, wine and beer selection. I did t eat but the menu seems limited which I think is smart since they just opened.   Looking forward to being a regular
The burger is the only thing that's good here. Very limited menu. Drinks are mediocre. The chicken sandwich was meh. And french fries just ok.
Still as good, if not better than ever. Great wine by the glass list, refreshed menu items (bologna was uniquely delicious), and killer, juicy fried chicken sandwich. Fries still in point!!

Welcome back, no. 7! This new/old spot is such a great addition to the neighborhood. We have so many good restaurants on Vanderbilt but have been sorely lacking an unfussy but elevated new American neighborhood spot. This checks all the boxes: food is great but not too pretentious or too expensive, and the cocktails are perfectly mixed. (I almost wept with joy when my watermelon mezcal drink wasn't sweet--why does everyone need to pour a pound of sugar into a watermelon cocktail?! no. 7 gets it.) We had no trouble walking in on a Saturday night but the place was doing brisk business. Super pleased to have them here and hope they're around for another 13+ years.
No comment
This is my favorite restaurant! The food and drinks are always fantastic, and the vibe is a perfect mix of relaxed and elegant. Plus, the staff is amazing!
The ambiance, the intimacy, the finer details, the food , the service..... A-MAZ-ING !!

Great place wonderful vibes and the food is really really good!!!!! The service is very welcoming! I came here for my birthday last year and back again definitely would recommend for a family gathering or date night with Bae. All you can eat is Everything! Definitely get the scorpion bowl is definitely a 10/10 and you'll be pleased with just 1. Parking garag across the street very convenient!
This restaurant has an inviting and laidback ambience. We had great servers who were polite and accommodating.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I came here on a Wednesday night with a group of 4 people. Someone had a birthday so just showed ID and got a free meal which was nice. We ordered the seafood AYCE option without lobster ($80 a person). We did two rounds and ordered most of the menu. I liked the fried sea bass with sweet chili sauce, Dungeness crab, and clams with oyster sauce the most. The food was pretty good for AYCE. Why only 3 stars? Service was severely lacking. We didn't get crackers even though we ordered crab. You have request everything including condiments. Also, we didn't receive a lot of items we ordered. We didn't receive an explanation, it just never came. It was an average experience for AYCE. If the service was better, I would come back.
No comment

Scallop was the best.  Food came quickly.  Dungeon crab was fresh.  Jumbo shrimp was very tasty.   Boshi was our server.  He was amazing.  Food came quickly.  Better than expected.   Definitely coming back here.
No comment

Came here for bestie's birthday! They definitely do not skimp on anything!!! You should starve for two days before coming here! We did the AYCE with lobster everything for the 2 of us was about $300+ but it's worth it!! Will definitely be back!
No comment

Our 1st Crab House experience was a smashing success!! I'm happy to report that all the lauded praise is well earned and deserved!!  You absolutely have to have a reservation to secure a table on the weekends as they get literally overwhelmed by all of like-minded patrons waiting to get access to the seafood barrage!!  I had a 7pm reservation, but we still waited about 20 minutes for our table.  You travel downstairs to the main dining area and once we were seated, we were given an explanation of the paper menu ordering system, and we proceeded to choose a good variety of everything they had to offer.  The 115 dollar lobster option, in my opinion, is the only way to go.  Everyone at the table has to get it if one person wants it, but it is totally worth it.  One thing to consider is that they bring out dishes extremely fast, so take that into account because our table was completely filled in less than 10 minutes!!  Also, the portions are humongous, so one person can get a dish to share with the table, not everyone having to get a particular item each.  Largely, all of the food was successful, with the lobster, of course, taking center stage!!  Whether the steamed option, the fried option, or cold claws,  they nailed the cookery every single time!!  The other items like the Dungeness and Snow crab were cooked well, but a touch on the dry side.  The other items like scallops, whole fish, flat iron steak, shrimps, and salmon we enjoyed as well.  The server we had was quite friendly, and she was engaging with us thoughtfully throughout our whole meal.  Service was pretty decent as the wait staff were quick to remove empty plates and the big steamer pots that started to dominate the space and took any additional orders as we needed them.  I recommend that you skip the starches and fried items or simply order them last.  They give you 2 hrs to go in on the buffet, so you can fill up on the premium items and get those options like noodles, rice, vegetables, or anything you missed to take home.  They price it out according to what's on the table, but they were extremely fair with the calculations, so we left with a good amount of food.  They also will sing happy birthday to the lucky patron, with your meal for free with four other full price meals!  They honor your birthday meal the day before, of and the next day, which is super generous!!  We felt rushed at the end, but when we were leaving, we saw why?  There were like 80 people   waiting to try and snag a table!!!  So in that respect we gave them a pass. This restaurant is so worth a trip here, as you will leave filled to the brim and you'll already be looking forward to planning your next visit !!  Cheers to all!!

4.5 out of 5. We showed up around 3 and we're seated almost immediately. The food comes out fresh, hot and delicious. Service was good too. Wasn't sure exactly what to expect but I was more than pleased. All of the lobster was done perfectly, my other favorite was the spicy shrimp.

I'm not sure if my expectations were too high, but I was a little disappointed by crab house. We got the $80 ayce seafood option (vs the $115 option that includes lobster). There was a good variety of seafood on the menu which I appreciated. The oysters were good, very big. I mainly came for the snow crab legs, and although good, it was too salty. I prefer cajun style seafood and the snow crabs legs tasted like they were just showered with salt here. All of the seafood has a slight Asian flavor to it which was ok. Service was also not the best, we were not given any crab crackers/tools to eat the crab with until asked, which I believe should be a given at a seafood restaurant like this. There are not many AYCE seafood restaurants in the city, and this is still a solid spot if you're looking for one!!

What a great hidden gem! Visited NYC for the first time and made reservations. Place is under ground but legit clean! you get a paper menu to mark what you want to eat each round.  The hubs mashed a few lobster tails while I hammered out the crab legs. It's a big menu with 2 tiers. Everyone at the same table mait choose the same tier. If you over order you get charged! $115 per head. Highly recommend!

Got on the waitlist online on our way to the buffet. As we arrived we got seated right away. As you walk downstairs you could smell all the good seafoods being served. At first the seafood came out really quick and was still hot. After that it was a little more difficult to get our servers attention but it also started to pick up. My favorite dishes were the scallops, oysters, calamari, and Dungeness crab. The scallops were nicely buttered and cooked on the skillet. The oysters were big and fresh. There was something about the coating of the calamari that was so good! The Dungeness crab wasn't salty like the other crabs and was perfect with butter. I was nervous that we didn't eat our money's worth but with how expensive seafood is nowadays, I'd say we ate enough.

Went out for a birthday dinner.  Made a reservation online for 4;30.  Got there and parked in a lot.  Walked in and was confirmed. There was a less than 5 minute wait. Was taken downstairs and given a booth.  I quickly realized that was a birthday spot.  Large groups were everywhere. We ordered our drinks and then selected from the menu.  They were out of lychee so I went with a Hennessy sour.  It was strong!  Then the food started to come.  We over ordered from the first sheet.  They bring 2 more sheets for additional ordering.  The food is great!  Lobster was delicious!  Mussels were too.  Steak is minimal, so we ordered it twice.  Dump bucket on the table and we bordered with another booth, separated by some sort of banister.  They should add privacy glass there.  I felt bad to throw our scraps in the bucket with someone's face on the other side of the bucket.  They didn't care because everyone is chowing down.  We had the wait staff sing happy birthday, I think ours was the 8th time we'd heard it for the night.  In any event,  fun place.  Mussels are amazing,  good sized lobsters.  Seafood has been cleaned.  Need the lemon juice sooner in the meal.

We came here for a birthday celebration and it was worth the price. The seafood is definitely quality. It wasn't too small or stale. The service is friendly and quick. The lobster had sooo much flavor! Everything did honestly. We even enjoyed the sides. Will definitely return. Oh and don't waste your money by going with people who don't eat a lot.

Crab House will take care of your seafood, crustacean desires. I recommend going with the lobster upgrade and everyone in your party must do the same. Go with people who will pay for the upgrade, for the waiter will not have some in your party ordering without the lobster upgrade. They only take reservations for parties of four or more, so go with people who are on time. Your reservation lapses in fifteen minutes. These things must be understood up front. Now that practical considerations are out of the way, let's talk about the feast you will experience. The sizzling steak is not to be overlooked and don't miss the various ways they prepare shrimp. Seriously, the lobster is what this place is all about and please have at it. I did and so did my friends visiting from out of town. They want to come back and so do I! Yes,they have veggies and other things like very good lobster mac n cheese, but do not overload on carbs and beverages. I kept the waitress on standby for more orders of lobster. I preferred the regular steamed lobster over the fried salt and pepper lobster tails and I kept'em coming. Service is friendly and the atmosphere is nicely divided among multiple dining rooms, but your focus will be on the lobster. "I'll be back!"

Service and food was amazing! Definitely had a great experience. We went on a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't crowded. The music was great as well. This place is very nice, Child friendly and the food are really good. Affordable price! We will come back! Service is excellent!

It was our second time coming to this place the food is amazing, and it was worth the money my favorite is the salt and pepper crabs..... We had  ( snow crabs, veggies, blue crabs, shrimps, and fish all you can eat for 89. And you can take some home for a small fee when I am craving seafood this is my go-to place!!

Even with extremely unpleasant weather outside on Christmas Eve, we were delighted to spend our group outing at crab house. Great seafood (dungeon crab legs the best with butter), great weather (Boshi the server was awesome and friendly), great atmosphere! Would recommend and come again!

All you can eat !! Basically you have a menu and you get to order what you want to eat , and while your eating , the menu keeps getting updated so the food just keeps on coming.... The crew is friendly and the atmosphere is welcoming , this is my second time coming , if it was closer to home I would come more often
First time here and the atmosphere is very welcoming & the food smells delicious. Already the service has been great.
Run don't walk to this place!!  Been here twice already and have experienced the most amazing seafood ever. HIGHLY recommend the cajun shrimp and the salt and pepper lobster. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!!!!!

Amazing service amazing food, highly recommended. I love all you can eat buffets and Crab House didn't disappoint. The seafood was plentiful, seasoned well, and fresh. I came alone so the wait time was over 2 hours but I'm pretty sure it's quicker with larger parties. There's a 2 hour limit from the time you are seated but after an hour I was stuffed!! I highly recommend!
No comment
Service was excellent, food came out quick and hot, more drinks options would of been nice. Overall The food was tasty and worth the price.

We came here to celebrate birthday.  There's total 5 of us, all guys.  We came here for the lobsters.  So we pay for the premium price which is $115 for the Lobster Buffet.  Sat down, waitress hand us the order form, told us whatever we want, just put a check mark.  I was like there's 5 of us, should we put down the quantities that we want?  She said will take care of that.  We check off most of the seafood, and most importantly is lobster.  15 mins later..  our food came, all sort of different type of shrimps, Fried Calamari, steak, Lobster Stuffed Cake, Scallop, one Dungeness crab..  Where's the lobster??  10 mins later.  ONE Lobster came..    ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!??!  There's 5 of us, and there's only one lobster came?  How you expect us to share one lobster while there's 5 of us.  We flag the waitress and ask her to put in at least 5 lobster for us, one for each.  20 mins later, 2 lobsters came.  What is going on?  How are you expecting 5 guys to share 2 lobsters??  Again, flag down the waitress, she apologize and said she will place an order for us again.  another 15 mins past, 2 lobster is out.  If you really don't want to serve all you can eat lobster, please do not offer that, we pay for the premium price for all you can eat lobster.  There's 5 of us, I expect to see 5 lobsters to come each time when we order.  Each time the food comes out, is like the serving for 2 people.  Remember our party is 5 dude.  Also, the steak is ridiculous, I wouldn't call that steak, is chewy beef.  Overall, not happy with it.  It ruin the birthday dinner, I don't think each of us ate two lobster all at.
This place is great! The food and service was up to par! The low lighting creates a great ambiance.

Just got here and have been waiting 15-20 minutes for water. 5 mins after that I realized that my supposedly clean plate in front of me has a piece of unattractive food substance stuck to the bottom of my plate. I am not pleased. Will update in 30 mins

I walked into the restaurant.  The took me down 3 flights of stairs.  The place smelled of seafood.  We ordered dungeon crabs and we didn't get them.  We got things we didn't even order lots of food we didn't order.  Seafood was old and over cooked.  Not worth it.

5 star alert! Can you say bang for your buck? The food, the service and the drinks will have you feeling satisfied once you step foot at Crab House. My favorite items? The garlic noodles, salt and pepper Dungeness crab, any of the shrimp dishes, the steak, the broccoli and the scallops were EVERYTHING. Not to mention they bring everything out with the quickness. We only went two rounds before feeling like we needed to be rolled out but everything was well seasoned and well cooked. With some all you can eat spots fresh tasting food can be hit or miss but they definitely rose to the occasion here. I'm usually a great food photographer but I was so hungry my pictures are trash. That's a sign of good eats - visit this place if you haven't!
No comment

Came here for my birthday and had a pleasant experience. Service was excellent from the hostess to my server. All of our dishes came out hot and everything we ordered was on available. No complaints with any of the dishes I had other then the snow crab legs. Tried several times but they were always over steamed until the flavor was gone. Other then that everything else was quite delicious. They also gave me a complimentary piece of cheesecake for my birthday. My brother and I share a birthday and they gave us one piece to share. Oh well, but it was
No comment
Love this place the food is amazing and comes out fast so worth the wait always come here for the crab legs
No comment
Good food, the service is really nice as well. Ambiance is pretty cool. Unlimited food!! Nice alcohol selection as well!
Great place love it very good atmosphere can't ask for more excellent excellent all year round second time here
The food and service is amazing. I would come again. The food comes quickly and the abundance of food is so much and it's good.

Traveling from the Bay Area for work and I was craving seafood like kicking crab style. My coworkers came across this place and thought I'd check it out. WORTH IT! You better save your appetite because you should take advantage of the AYCE! I went in on the crab legs. They were smaller than back home but that's what AYCE is for vs buying by the pound.
No comment
it really is all can you eat. the food keeps coming out and everything is super fresh. the quality of the lobster and crab is excellent.
No comment

Let's talk about this establishment here. The food was good and taste fresh and get the passion fruit tea. I'm glad this place introduced me to dungeon crab legs because it is way better than snow crabs in my opinion. The service is great and have some really nice employees. I have been to this restaurant more than once  and had the pleasure of having Courtney as a server twice and trust and believe she is a sweetheart. She recognized me from the first time and the second time was as if we knew each other for a long time. I definitely will be coming back because of the food, service and i can't forget about the music that will have you singing and dancing in your seat.

I am SO glad this place opened up in the city!! As a crab lover, I come here from time to time to get my fill of all the crabs I can eat at a reasonable price. And the quality of the food is fantastic! Always so tasty, food comes fast and hot :) The servers are nice and enthusiastic! My favorite are the snow crab and Dungeness crabs, definitely get those! The fries and shrimps are pretty great too!
No comment
food great nice clean shrimps everything taste good
If you go definitely take advantage of the lobster, dungeness crab, claws, snow crab legs. I could just go there for these items and it would be worth it.
Amazing seafood! Reminds me of home! Shrimp, rice, broccoli are so good! Will definitely be back soon. Me and Celina loved it all!

Location is great for large parties and groups with an AYCE menu featuring a wide variety of options to fulfill your greatest seafood fantasies and shellfish desires!! Staff is also very enthusiastic!
Price is pretty steep, food is okay... certain things are really good and certain things are very very average. I enjoyed... but probably wouldn't go back.
This place is fantastic. Food is good and Service is excellent. Shout out to our server Lauryn. The best server in the house！
Great all you can eat seafood joint the options were good ! The service was very great, came here for graduation celebration. We'll come back again!

I happened to be in New York on business and decided to give this place a try.. It was awesome.. We did the all you can eat  lobster option and  it did not disappoint. The lobsters were a good size and tasted fresh. The lobster mac and cheese was one of the best I've had. Service was fast and friendly. I'm placing this on the come back list
Was a fun little all you can eat experience in NYC since AYCE is scarce. Was good. Will be back some day.
Love this place. Great food and great service. The decor is super nice. Love coming here with my family
No comment

My interest was peaked at AYCE crab, and reading the reviews that "this was the best seafood they've ever had," or "hidden gem." Honestly, the crab were just okay. It wasn't as sweet and decadent as quality crab, and you can taste the difference. The food was plentiful, and the service was top-notch, but at the end of the day, if I'm paying $90+ per person after tax and tip, I'd rather take that and get surf and turf or get premium crab, rather a bunch of mediocre old tasting crabs that just don't quite do it for me. I would not return, but this can be adequate for someone who is not quite as picky, and is looking to get stuffed. They are running a birthday deal, where the birthday person gets to eat for free if you have 4 paying adults. Needless to say, there were a lot of birthday celebrations there.
Good Service, good food. All you can eat crab & lobster. Definitely coming back on my next New York trip

Went to crab house for the first time last night, all by myself! Felt like a king eating a feast! This is definitely my kind of place. Will definitely be back with friends! The food is great, the service is excellent, and the people are friendly. Great atmosphere and music. Definitely four stars!
Boshi was such a great waiter ! The food is absolutely delicious . This is our favorite date night restaurant in the city ! The music is always great , the food and the drinks !
I came with my friend and we definitely will come back again. Food are tasty and fresh. Variety menu. Worth your bucks. Highly recommended
No comment

When in NYC and you love seafood this is a place to be . Where can you find an all you can eat seafood that includes lobster . A different style of all you can eat - a preselects menu - you order everything you want on tej first round . The pic shown are our first round . Yeah yeah yeah pricey but with the seafood - it's all worth the price trust me . The lobster OMG I ate four of them so yeah worth the price . The ambience is unlike any other unlimited food - it's booth . A bit of wait to be seated if dinner time - we waited 30 mins . On our way out heard the hostess saying 2 hr wait . A MUST TRY #xtfoodtrip
Great food and service from my server named Boshi. I, will definitely come back again for more lobster treats with friends and family!
No comment
No comment
Amazing all you can eat crab legs and shrimps! Highly recommend coming with friends and family!!
Great place with quality crabs and lobster. Ambience is also perfect. Came in as a group and had a wonderful time. Will definitely come again.
No comment

The best seafood buffet ever. Come hungry!! We went on a Saturday afternoon around 3pm and did the Yelp check in since we were only 2 people. We waited about 15 min until we got a table. Once seated they explained the menu and we started checking off what we wanted. We splurged and went with the lobster menu. Everything was so fresh and delicious. It def was worth the splurge. We were beyond stuffed. Highly recommend.

All you can eat seafood... Need I say more?! We went on a Wednesday. The wait was short & the seating is comfortable. I'd say the lobster wasn't worth getting but the oysters, snow crab, fried chicken, & scallops are amazing! Definitely will come again!

I celebrated my husbands birthday on 2/1 and the staff was very accommodating, polite and hardworking. The food was absolutely delicious! I recommend going in large groups or at least 4 or more people. I would definitely go back!
Workers are really friendly and polite. Food came fast and was fresh and hot. My only issue was they sat us near a party of 12 that was soooo loud I couldn't even hear my bf.
No comment

From the second I walked in, I was so impressed. We got seated right away & Boshe was our sever. He was AMAZING! So attentive and nice! Music was a VIBE. Don't sleep on the garlic noodles, steak, chicken wings and crabs.

Omg if you like crab, lobster and shrimp this is the place to go. The staff was very attentive and helpful. The food was so fresh.  It's all you can eat and they are so generous with the portions. We will definitely be back.
Ken was our server and he was amazing! The food was soooooo good. The ambiance is amazing. Can't wait to come back!

All you can eat seafood? Yes please, fresh seafood and good, attentive service. Every time we finished a plate someone was there to take it and someone was always on standby in the case we needed to order something else. Drinks were not watered down and the food was great. Will definitely be here again.

My experience as soon as I entered the building was great ! We had a reservation at 8:30 and the hostess accommodated us and sat us day earlier than requested. There was 5 of us and we were celebrating 2 birthdays  so that was special to me. Ken our waiter was amazing and was full of energy and gave full and clear instructions! Will definitely be returning for a 3rd time !
Love this place the food was great and would highly recommend the lobster Mac and cheese and I would definitely come here again. The salmon was also my favorite! :)

Delicious and fresh crab and shrimp plus buttery scallops to die for!  Awesome service fun music and happy vibe!  Try the Dungeness crab and snow crab first!  Add you name to the wait list via Yelp and get ready to party -- drinks are not too pricey for the city and ask for Pi he's excellent waiter -- our daughter loved it and by the end was a crab peeling expert!
No comment
Fresh Lobster. Fresh Crab. Great services. It's worth to try the premium. Definitely come back again
my guest and I arrived 20 min before they closed and they were nice enough to still seat us. This place has a great ambiance and great customer service. The food was good and it came out very quick.

Arrived at the establishment at 10:10 pm and then joined the waitlist with a great chance of not being seated due to restaurant capacity. Hostess was very polite & seated us at 10:22 pm, service & the food is amazing I would definitely come again
No comment
No comment
Chill vibe. Came here for a birthday. Staffs are accommodating and quick with the order. Great selection of seafood and enjoyed the Dungeness crab and snow crab the most.
No comment
The seafood the service the entire vibe . Compared all these you can have in one place especially in Manhattan,115/person way too reasonable.ocean raised me up this is my fishing place now.
No comment
No comment
Food was really good and service was fast. Would come again. We did the crabs only for the 80 dollars
Excellent service by the best waitress Courtney!  This place is worth the wait and $$$.  Lobsters are fresh from the tank, not frozen.
I'm from LA and I must say the seafood different in NEW YORK  service was fast and the seafood was amazing. The lobster and obay shrimp are a must!
No comment
No comment
Outstanding all you can eat sea food for an excellent price considering the location. Went on a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't busy -- I was able to walk in without delay.

I'm so late with all my reviews smh..... came here last month with a group of 5 you need a least 4 people to make reservations; other than that you'll have to do a walk in and the wait could be hours. Where do I start we all love seafood so we were overly excited for this experience our server was Jamie and he was very nice and helpful! We had just about everything from the menu the blue crabs were a no for us but everything else was very good fresh seasoned and of course plentiful. The highlights for me were the fried rice, the whole fish & shrimps these flavors were just omg my friends really enjoyed the crab legs and mussels. The drinks was good the vibe and atmosphere is nice as well we will definitely be back our new girls night spot.
Unlimited seafood that is fresh and super tasty! Lobster was fresh and not chewy!-go for the birthday meal!

Wow. That doesnt even begin to describe my experience at this establishment. You need to get the raw clams - licking my lips just thinking about it. Mm mm mm. Shoutout to my best friend Boopy for paying for my meal!
This place is amazing! I love the ambiance and the flavoring!!!! The service was nice and workers were super friendly!

This is an NYC must! We've gone here 3x and each time is better than the last. The food is flavorful and the amounts they serve are great portions. They are quick and they keep the food coming. Went for my birthday and was 100% satisfied. It's pricy yes, but you get what you pay for! Will be back again and again and again..
The meals in this place are as pricey as f . .   (expletive)! A 12 oz bottle of Corona costs $9.00
Tried other food after the review and wasn't good.   Salmon and steak was good but not the next day. Customer service was still great.
12/10 would smash again. Walked in a boy, but after eating all this seafood I waddled out a man.
Great place good seafood nice enjoyable food fresh seafood the clams and crab legs were most enjoyable

Okay here is my unvarnished review as a single diner, eating at this place. I was super excited as a long time born and raised Bostonia n to actually get all the lobster I could eat! My first several courses came out in steamer tray is sort of like a Chinese restaurant. Lobster was a bit overcooked. My last order of lobster however came out steaming hot obviously very freshly cooked and was absolutely amazing I would give this restaurant five stars had all of the lobsters been the of quality that that last one was..
sooo good! soo much seafood. scallops and oysters were soo good. service was impeccable, and they sang hbd with cheesecake! will come back for sure

No comment

Ok, One time can be a fluke. But this is  TWICE I've been here in two months (See my previous review) and this place is still Da Bomb!!  Still crazy good, plentiful, hot seafood!  Still pure 70's-80's FUNK!  Still fast, courteous service!  I've gone to other NYC restaurants and dropped twice as much for mediocre food/service (May was our outstanding server on this occasion).

Overrall this place was quick and great food was average but for all u can eat the price was decent but upon ordering my second round i found this little bug in my food . No idea wtf it was but good thing i only ate one before seeing this bug crawling around in my food

Ghetto as hell. Not real lobster more like large crawfish. If 4 ppl @ the table they bring out one dish for all to share. Everybody get a list but you have to do it one by one to get your food it a little more classy than a stand up buffet sucks.
No comment

I was super excited to try this restaurant since my friend sent me a reel off of IG. Food wasn't bad and place was clean. Only thing was we drove 2 hours to come and called to let them know we were gonna be 2 minutes late from last seating and when we walked in all the other servers yelled out loud " Are you serious? Are you f-ing serious" ... long story short, Chris is awesome.

I came here when visiting an old college friend who lives nearby.  We had so much fun here.  My advice is to spend the entire day walking like we did.  So you burn calories.  We came here around 7 on a Wednesday and it was awesome.  Got the recommended Scorpion bowl for 2- WOW.  Then the lobster all you can eat for $115.  We had 2 hours.  And it did not disappoint.  Everything was hot and fresh.  Service was quick.  My new go-to when I visit.  I usually don't do buffet places but this place has changed my mind.  They even let us take home our leftovers which was greatly appreciated, not expected.  Great value everything considered, especially in this location.  Service is top-notch.  Just make sure to come hungry.  You won't be let down.
Good place, good atmosphere. The crabs were amazing and there other options for those who aren't seafood lovers.

This is one of my favorite places to eat. The deal is the best in the city for all you can eat seafood and it's easy. The service is great and very fast. They keep the food COMING and it's nice and hot ! When they all you can eat they mean that. So come with your belly empty lol. If you want lobster it is an increase understandably. The variety of drinks are so good and super strong. My only qualm is Pattie's less than 4 there's no reservations but they do have a waitlist allocated for smaller parties. However that wait can take hours depending on the day so be warned and plan your day according. Other than that I love this place and will return.
No comment

Yelp shows they close at midnight. Traveled for 30 minutes to get there. Walked in tonight at 10:28pm and we were told that last seating was at 10pm. No manager in sight. Our first experience here wasn't great so we haven't been back in almost a year. Gave them a second chance tonight and we're done. Consistently poor service.
No comment
Amazing. Wow loved that place wow loved it. The food was sooo good. All the options are incredible
One of the best buffet，I've ever eaten in NY. The lobster is very fresh and you can taste from its favour. The iron meat is great as well.

Wanted Seafood while visiting NYC and came across this place through a search on Yelp! I must say, everyone at this establishment is very kind, super s/o to our server Erica, she was great! This is the type of buffet I like and it can also get you into trouble, you check off what you want and they bring it, fresh & piping hot to your table. This is wrong on so many levels, because you don't get to walk off the first serving. Then you get a cute server like Erica, with that nice smile, bringing more of those darn order sheets to your table. You finally have to say 'No'! The food was great, all seasoned to perfection. I can't list what we ate because the order sheet is very long and that should give you an idea of what we did eat. When in NYC, give them a try because we will go back. One thing I do fully love is, whatever is left on the table, at a very reasonable price, you can take home. Helps with waste.

Do not forget to get on the waitlist beforehand on their website! This will save you a lot of waiting time. Attentive waiters, great service. The most important part is the seafood is fresh and quality. I greatly enjoyed all the items ordered from a robust selection. If you can't finish all your food, you have the option of taking food to go for a price.
So much variety of food! The waiters and waitresses were very attentive and always willing to help out, including Boshi and Jin!

We searched for a seafood restaurant and found it!  The ambiance and food was great.  We also felt that the price was right.  The service was good but not great.   We will definitely return when back in New York.
No comment

I was pleasantly surprised by this place.  Visited for my cousins birthday . Buffet style, you check off what you would like and they bring it right to your table. Set price for 2 eating options - can't go wrong. The Manager Sam was very accommodating and I appreciate his professionalism and kindness .  The Dungeness crab, fried noodles, steak- everything was delicious. I will certainly return soon. Make reservations- the place does get crowded - dress comfy- cool music -and vibes.
The food was great and the presentation was amazing, they also had very fast service. Had a great time
I love Crab House sooooo much ! The fried and butter lobster is amazing. The shrimp. The crab legs. Everything is A1.

SCAM beware they have pictures of Dungeness crab what a con all they have are the claws when we asked the waitress what was up she stated they do it to get the tourist in well we are not and live down the block and will not return or recommend.

Yep! Worth every penny! Went for the unlimited fresh lobster, I've gotten that plus more! Looking around the place, I loved witnessing the diversity among staff ranging between age, race and gender. The customer service and expeditious food service was top notch. The seafood quality was even better. Before I left I planned my return. Highly recommended if you can pull the $105p/p for contactless unlimited seafood buffet dinner with lobster included or $75 p/p without it.
Slammin, staff is great and food is amazing! 10/10 would eat here again every time I am in NY!

This is the most freshest seafood spot I have been to in a long time. The fried lobster is to die for. And the Dungeness fried crabs is amazing . This place is for people who loves to eat and to me it's cheap compare to most other seafood place. Great drinks and vibes once you have the right company.

What a fantastic meal! The food here does not taste like an All You Can Eat. Everything is made fresh to order and cooked to perfection. We got the lobster upgrade with zero regrets. It's a pricey meal but well worth it.

Love this seafood buffet joint. You can get a variety of seafood with different styles, and the quality is excellent as well. Our server Boshi was very helpful and nice as well! Will definitely return!

I joined the waitlist. I get a text instructing me to check in. I check in and I wait inside. While waiting for some time, I get another text stating- due to your no show we will move on to the next customer. I go to the receptionist and show her the text. she says she will put me back on the wait list and tells me I am next on the wait list for 2 people. Again, I wait inside. Approx. 20 minutes later I get another no show text. By this time I have already seen 2 person parties get taken in. I go back to the receptionist. The receptionist puts me back on the wait list and says again, I'm first on the wait list for two. At this point I left the restaurant and went elsewhere for dinner. I will not be going here again. I am PAYING for dinner/service. I am not waiting for a FREE dinner. I will not waste my time  and hard earned money here. One should not have to stress while paying to dine. As in, constantly making sure that they don't overlook me, or counting the number of guests after me, or standing in the very front by the receptionist, making sure they don't skip me, making sure they did not forget me, checking in to only get passed up two times and having to get placed twice on the "top of the list." It's not like I'm  waiting for a free meal or a favor. I'll pass.
No comment
Everything was great! Went for a friends bday and had the best time- Boshi was the best server!

Service was great and food was great!  Fresh made seafood.  Let's just say I had several lobsters but my favorite is the pepper one - it came out bigger than the other seasoned lobsters.  Not sure why.  Overall would go here again.
No comment

I was using the yelp app for the waitlist. I arrived at the time which the check-in time. I got the table right away without waiting. The waiting staffs are supper friendly. You can smell the seafood smell when you come in. They come with the garlic bread while away. It taste so delicious. They do have a life tank of lobsters which is legit and you won't see that at other all you can eat places. I can wait for the food to come on my table. I will update you guys while dinner going on with my lovely wife.
Amazing food. Definitely going back. Cozy place , value for money thumbs up  you won't stop once you start eating those crab legs
Fresh Seafood!  Good size portions.  All you have to check the list and it's served to in abundance.  Great flavoring and NOT seafood salty.

Such an awesome experience! We love all things seafood and this place does it right! It's hot and fresh has tons of flavor! Our server Erica was delightful and funny she made us feel right at home and explained it all in detail! Will be coming back when we visit NYC again! Restrooms were very clean which was a nice perk! It was a great place for a date but I'm sure family night here would be great as well!
Amazing price and quality!! Came for a family birthday party and everyone was completely blown away by the seafood here

I came in on a Saturday night and all I can say is wow. Just wow. The food was so fresh, I enjoyed everything my table ordered. They start you off with bread while you wait for your order, very good. Old bay shrimp arrived first and the flavor was amazing. We ordered so much but the portions are big to share and when they notice you're almost done they bring another menu to see if there's anything else you'd like to share. For $70 a person (no-lobster items), you really get your moneys worth.
Worth the visit especially for seafood lovers! Food was well portioned and fresh! Highly recommended!

Exceptional service. We came for my grandfather's 80th birthday. They gave us a private room which was nice. Every good we chose was flavorful and delicious. Seafood was fresh. I took one star off because the food we ordered was not accurate with what they gave us. Be ready to spend $90 per person with tax and tip. Overall, great experience!
Fond on Tik Tok, all you can eat seafood can you really complain about $80 per person. Food is amazing, service is prompt, and the music is a vibe. Aesthetically pleasing. 10/10 recommend.

Delicious and fresh seafood. I typically don't like all you can eat bc quality is sketchy. But here it's a go. It was only $15 for my 7 yr old son. He loves the food as well. Plenty of non-seafood options for little ones as well.
Awesome foods, we will definitely come back. We love the dungeon crabs, snow crabs and the noodles so much.
No comment
Great service. We were sat immediately and explained the menu. Food was amazing and endless
No comment
It was amazing! The seafood was so fresh, the meats were cooked to perfection and the service was great! My fiancé and i enjoyed our time here, most definitely would recommend to a friend!

It's a yes for sure! If you're a seafood lover this is the spot for you! I ordered everything seafood here! Fried shrimp, garlic shrimp, shrimp seasoned with old bay, crab legs, etc! The bill was about $170 for 2 with drinks! Love it here! They're prompt too with great portion size.
Their food is soo good and I loved their scorpion bowl! You will def leave satisfied service the server boshi is amazing!!!
Excellent service!  Food was amazing, definitely recommend the spicy shrimp and the dungeons crab.
Great place for binging on those lobsters! Personal favs are the steamed ones and the ones w/ salt & pepper

This spot definitely hit the spot. The music is soft and enjoyable while you're dining. The food comes super fast and the waitress Lauren was good. They even give you floss with the check which you'll need for sure! I recommend this place

The food is always fresh and plentiful. All  of the dishes are seasoned to protection. Best  Ice Tea and mixed drinks in the city.  Staff is always nice and very professional. Mae is one of the best front of house professionals in NYC. Thanks for a great time, can't wait to return.

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: I went here with my coworkers. The experience was great. Great seafood, fast service and very friendly staffs. will be back again.
No comment

Got seated really quickly! Service was great! Came out with complimentary garlic bread. Offer a wide range selection of seafood including some great appetizers. hard to come across all you can eat seafood from where i'm from so I had to try this when visiting the East Coast. it was definitely worth it!

This is one of our favorite places. The food is amazing we've been here five times so far - we have come with family for Father's Day, date night and birthday dinners! KD is an amazing server who goes out of his way to make our time a great one!

The food was ok. It's a all you can eat buffet. So go hungry. They charge extra to take food home
So yummy!!!!!!! We ordered so many crab legs and oysters and mussels. Everyone was extremely kind, and the food was great!

If I was to give a review based off food and service I'd probably give 5 stars being that there's no 4.5 however I will give this a 3 based on the unprofessional ratchet host that yelled at me and my party(3 friends) for walking in past the host desk even tho there was 40 people in the lobby and no host we checked in at a kiosk and recieved a text maybe 15 mins later to talk to a host our table was ready so as we found the host in the downstairs dining area she proceeded to ask "who told you come down here cause I didn't " not even acknowledging that she was then rudely told us to go back upstairs and it was so nasty we almost left we then proceeded to wait an additional 40 minutes with her mumbling different nasty comments about us as she walked passed seating several walk in parties saying that we've been skipped and she'll let us know when a space frees we then found a tall Asian guy who seemed like the owner or manager and explained the problem and within seconds we were sat down and we're able to begin the feast . Unlimited food for $80 pp and was good food the food comes out fairly fast and server has no isssues with any request such as drinks etc THAT HOST NEEDS TO BE FIRED BEFORE SHE MEETS HER MATCH

Went for me nephew's birthday and I would suggest it for celebrations also. There are birthday discounts. Costs about 70 per person and more when lobster is added. Make sure to go on empty stomach. So much good food. All you can eat for about two hours.
A great outing with lots of seafood and good service! They have a few specials and their drinks are good too! I would say it's a bit pricey but what isn't in NYC! Lol
Amazing place!!! AYCE is worth it, fresh seafood. The service is phenomenal and they were able to accomodate good seats for us. Recommend 10/10 !!
its always a great time at the crab house, celebrating my moms birthday! Staff is attentive,  and friendly ! food is always delish!!!

Looks super quiet from the outside, but the inside was so lively with so many booths and had a good vibe. Servers were so kind and accommodating, but prices were raised higher than $70 (it's 80 now) likely due to new hype on TikTok. And that's for all you can eat without lobster, with lobster its $115.

The the customer service was extremely good. The service was extremely fast. The food came out quickly and was hot, fresh and tasty. The drinks were strong too. I'm would definitely recommend this restaurant for a family outing, date night or birthday.
We came in and got seated immediately, great food and calm music. The food came out very fast as well we came early around 3:30pm

I love it here. it's by far my favorite seafood restaurant. Not your average seafood restaurant . Saru is one of my favorite Waitress . Came to celebrate my mom's 65th birthday and they were sure to make it special

The food was amazing and the customer service was very good, they were accommodating to our party of 4 and a baby and with all of our needs. I will definitely come back again. And we loved the fact it was all it can eat. The drinks were bomb as well!

Such a great experience.  I'm a seafood lover and this did not disappoint.  $80 all you can eat seafood such a great deal in NYC.  The quality of the food was great, very fresh, seasoned well and always served piping hot.  A lot of the entrees came out sizzling on hot plates!  I would highly recommend.  The staff was great as well, super friendly and constantly clearing plates and bringing out more seafood promptly when it was requested.
All the food was good and made to order. We received amazingly fun customer service!!
No comment

The fresh whole lobsters and snow crabs were our family's favorite! Even the fried hand-breaded shrimp was quite tasty. The boiled corn on the cob was refreshing. Our server was also very attentive which made the overall dining experience a great one! I think the portions of bread should be smaller and also the "free" item that the customer doesn't order but that you want customers to try should be smaller. That way it isn't wasted if it doesn't suit the customer's taste.

Had a very fun experience at this AYCE crab house! It took a little while to be seated even with reservation but afterwards it was only smooth sailing. Boshi, our server was great and explained how to order. He was very attentive and sweet. The food came out very fast. Some of our favorites were the fresh oysters, the seared scallops, and dungeness crab. If you go on your birthday, it's free and you get a slice of cheesecake! Overall, would come again :)
Delicious meal. Loved every morsel. The scallops are a dream untouched by reality. Feels like I am dining in seafood heaven.
AYCE seafood spot in NYC. Great place to come with friends. Unlimited seafood for $70 and $100 if you get it with lobster. Food came out super quick and hot!  Must try!
No comment
Amazing selection of food! Very clean interior and very friendly staff! Just visiting the city and it was a must to go to! Definitely will be back!!!

Great spot for all you can eat seafood in midtown. Good selection of seafood. The mussels & little necks were a must! Snow crab was delicious & very well seasoned. Mixed Drinks weren't  the greatest (stick to beer) but food was worth it!
No comment
The service was great! The food kept coming, and it came out quick. Would definitely recommend it to anymore. Loved the all you can eat lobster. Very satisfying Birthday dinner.

If you want to feast out on Lobster & Crab, come here and knock yourself out! Every dish with seafood was excellent, but the starches, garlic bread, fair, the garlic noodles, just okay, and the fried rice, not good at all- tasted like they just poured soy sauce into the white steamed rice & called it fried rice. So, to get your money's worth, stick to getting the main seafood fare.
Wide variety of different seafood for only $80. 100% worth it!! Boshi was our server and was super responsive and quick in ordering!
No comment
The food Was great 10/10 would recommend.  I loved the salmon and also the the lobster Mac and cheese. I would definitely come here again!

I did not enjoy my experience at all. I was interested to see what all the hype was about but unfortunately it was not what I expected.  The group I was with was anxious to try it , and being seafood lovers thought why not try for the experience ? Well this was NOT the type of restaurant to actually enjoy tasty seafood especially at the set price they charge !  Everything was very salty . Once the order was placed, it did arrive all at once in family style  but piled up on small table -- being we were a party of 6. It was overwhelming and not enjoyable. There was no proper room to actually eat. Yes, you get crab legs  but you cannot  even enjoy them in this way.
