The owners / management apparently want to serve a full house but with no care / regard about customer satisfaction or comfort. More of a factory feeling , and rushing your order on table without organization. I like eating in slower pace maybe. So this was not for me . I am glad I got to try but I won't return. I also factored in maybe due to their unusual circumstances-- water pipe leaking , fire department arrival , a hand written paper bill and ( not computerized/ itemized one ) . A very bizarre experience for a NYC restaurant !
No comment
Amazinggggggggggggg experience! My mouth is watering just thinking about it. All of the food was extremely fresh and super delicious! I'll most likely go back like once a month lol

The best seafood AYCE I have ever enjoyed. Service, food quality was A+. Restaurant had a nice atmosphere with spotlessly clean bathrooms. A tad pricey but when the experience was worth every penny! Can't wait to go again...
Perfect food and atmosphere! Cozy and friendly staff! Yummy and came quickly! I celebrated my birthday with friends and family

For $115+tax+tip, I do not think it was worth it. The lobster was okay at best as they smoother the lobster with butter and cilantro type of plant. The service is bad as my waiter was shouting at me instead of saying it politely. Do not get the oysters - they smelled fishy and old. Stay away
Fast service and food is really good. Server is friendly and would definitely come back again
Immediately no. It's ghetto. Service sucks. Don't do it. There's a better buffet in queens that is half the price, triple the quality. Go there. It's called the Buffet.

Didn't see the restaurant when we passed by but the delicious smell of butter drew us in. We had no reservation but the hostess was very nice to find us a table. We got seated less than the hour stated for wait! The waiter introduced themselves well and we ordered our food. It was delicious! Premium food, what more can you ask for in New York filled with small portions for exasperated prices! Will be returning.
No comment
No comment
Clean and inviting atmosphere. We were a party of 2 and walked right in for seating. Our server was prompt with taking our order for the buffet.
The food was good, patron margarita was good but small and food came fast would come again worth your 115

Great customer service from the entrance. I had a reservation for 6 ppl and was attended to right away. No clarity on when the 2 hours begins. Is it when you sit at the table or when your server takes your order? Other than that the food is great and smelled great.

Highly recommend this place! For the price it is completely worth it. All the seafood was delicious and the drinks were good too. I give this service an A+. Our waiter was amazing and everything was served in a timely matter. I have no complaints about this restaurant. I will definitely be returning
No comment
This restaurant was recommended to us by one of my friends and it was a 10/10. The staff was very nice, and I thought the bread was amazing!! I will be back again. :)
Their waitress was great. Great decorations. I was greeted very friendly. I will recommend others to try out this Seafood Buffet restaurant. One of the best in NYC for sure.

This place is amazing!!!  if your ever in the mood for unlimited seafood or lobster this place is amazing! We used to go to the one in queens but this atmosphere is way better anyway!! Ask for Jessica she is the sweetest and will take care of you!

Pretty decent. They were extremely accommodating for the party size we had (30+) some of the food could be hotter temperature wise and a couple dishes weren't my favorite but it is a really good deal for $80.
No comment
I'm here for the free moscato! Lol the ambiance is great can't wait to try the food!!
This is the best establishment I have ever been to. The food was wonderful and fresh and the staff was excellent and attentive. I will recommend to all of my friends and family!

Awesome experience at this restaurant! I've been waiting to visit for a while, now that I finally made it, it definitely lived up to expectations. The crab legs are amazing, definitely ask for the sauces so you can dunk them in some butter or cocktail sauce. If you're a spice fan, the spicy shrimp is amazingly seasoned, with a bit of a numbing spice flavor. Would definitely come back!
Unfortunately several items on the check off list on the menu we never received. It was very busy dinner on a Saturday.  Did not receive clam chowder or blue crabs.
Went here for my anniversary. It was $105/person for all you can eat lobster, crab, scallops, mussles, oysters, and more. Really nice service. Would come again.
It's abit ghetto sitting on my sit floor was extremely wet and slippery but over is a nice vibe
No comment
Food and service were good! Definitely worth the price. Clam chowder wasn't good though.

At first, we weren't too excited about coming here due to the high cost and worries about having to fork out $300 on a meal that we could've possibly be disappointed with but what the heck, we were on vacation and fortunately everything came out super DELICIOUS! Oh and btw if you're a fan of BTS our waiter looks almost exactly like Yoongi

Everything was super duper delicious! The lobsters were my favorite. Our waiter Erica was great. Everything came so fast to the point that my table had to stack trays on top of each other. I highly recommend this place for everyone to experience at least once.
No comment

Had a great time with my fiancée and kids for Mother's Day. All you can eat lobster, crablegs, shrimp, etc for 2 hours. We got lucky that we was a walk in and didn't have to wait. Food was great. Service was good as well. We will definitely be going back with other family members. Pricey but definitely worth it.
Fresh seafood with variety. Great flavors and drinks are strong.  Lobster and crab legs, shrimps, mussels , clams and fried rice! Recommend 1000%
Good service. Highly recommend. Fresh seafood. All you can eat. Best in NYC. Will come everyday.

I this restaurant is a MUST! My favorite has got to be bourbon shrimp! But you can't skip the snow crab legs! Also the spicy shrimp is a must have and you have to top it off with their Margaritas drink! Can I also add that the Ken our server was absolutely amazing he knew them menu and was able to guide us and I loved all his suggestions! You didn't visit Midtown New York if you didn't make a stop here!

One word: volume. This place does not cheat you at all! There aren't many buffets in NYC, but Crab House lives up to its billing. Their service is amazing, the food is tasty and fresh, and the value is off the charts.

I recently visited this place on Saturday 6/11/2022. The staff was friendly and not over bearing, due to the amount of ppl we had in our group. They had the accommodations for us no matter the size of the party. Social distancing is obviously in full effect. The food came out Expeditiously! Always fresh!! The Seafood was kinda limited in my opinion. There was no snow crab legs nor lobster of any kind. They had some fried blue crabs and some salt and pepper fried shrimp. As an "all you can eat, Crab/Seafood spot" I was highly disappointed in the seafood selection.. however Overall.. the food was TASTY! I will be going again very soon and for $25 I don't mind the travel from the Bronx. Add this place to you must visit list.. just be aware. If you're looking for a Real All you can eat SEAFOOD/CRAB SPOT.. you MAY be disappointed.

Perfect place to take a date. Perfectly priced and excellent service. The food was amazing and the options are limitless, perfect for anybody. The staff were all friendly and super caring. Overall this place should be your go to spot for anyone visiting NYC
Definitely will be coming back the food was great even if it was something I didn't like I tried it. Great service all of them were amazing wish I remembered their names. Thank you for a great time
This place is the REAL DEAL. You are made to feel welcomed and constantly offered food. Yummm. I had 3 lobsters, 2,crabs, shrimp and mussels. AMAZING!!!  Definitely recommend
No comment

This place is definitely worth the $69.95 per person.  Took mom here for her bday and pretty much everything was good.  I didn't care for the rice as it was mushy and the noodles were overcooked but everything else was sooo good.  Will definitely be back
No comment

Great service! Our server was very attentive. The price may seem a bit steep for $105 per person but I think it was worth it because we definitely left the place feeling very full. Great place to get your seafood fix!

The best seafood spot in NYC I love it here it has a nice variety of selection to choose from. It's all you can eat how can you miss out on this place I'm glad my girlfriend show me this I'm coming here everyday.
Great deal for delicious seafood. Particularly fun in groups! My favorites are the crab legs, beef (that's right), and scallops.

This location is one of the best all you can eat Crab spots you can go to. The quality is amazing, the service is amazing, even the music is amazing. It's 80 dollars per person and I would suggest the best way to tackle the food is to order slowly. Order enough for the table, finish that round and then order some more. It's a great way to eat more and not get too stuffed in the beginning. You also have two hours to eat so you have plenty of time
No comment
Food is amazing and service is fast! I haven't even finished eating and I'm planning my next visit.
first time here baaaaabbbyyyy it's worth it food was on point wasn't rush to eat service was amazing our server lauryn was so nice and attentive couldnt have ask for a better date night purrr.....
Jessica is a fantastic attendant, she recommended the Lychee Passion drink as I waited for my dining party. She made feel welcome as we exchanged family restaurant information.
Came here with my mom and girlfriend and it was awesome. The shrimp was definitely my favorite.. so flavorful!!! Great portions and service as well. Music was great too

So this place is okay. The staff is nice and you get plenty of food. If you like Asian style seafood and old bay seasoning, this is your spot. If you like Cajun seasoning (Tonys) and you are from South Carolina, Mobile, Louisiana, Florida, or southeast Texas, this ain't your spot. The food was fresh and they have a good selection. I like my food spicy. My favorite were the garlic noodles and broccoli with brown sauce. The shrimp (all flavors) were good also. Oh and the ticket can get over $100 per person easy.
No comment
i loved coming here with my parents. they are avid seafood lovers and this place did not disappoint!
Fell in love with this place from the first visit. Food is always fresh and amazing and staff is always nice and friendly. Great for date night or even a family dinner.

We absolutely LOVED this place. You guys, it's a must try!  We went for our daughter's 10th birthday. Dash was our server and he was awesome. The food was excellent. Shrimp skewers, steak, salmon-just wow. And the snow crab legs were completely amazing. Get the scorpion bowl and share it with a friend. We keep raving about this place to all of our friends. It was, by far, one of the best places we ate at in NYC. We'd recommend to anyone--and we have!  The price was right for everything they offered. I'd love to go back!
Great location and the food is amazing on 55st and 2nd Ave. The seafood is a must have. ​
Excellent service by Courtney and the full house tells you this place is definitely worth a try!! Don't miss out!
Amazing food, amazing decor, amazing service - This place beyond beat my expectations

All you can eat seafooood!! I would recommend coming earlier in the day as the wait can be super long at night. My boyfriend and I arrived at around 6:30 and were told the wait would be around an hour. Around an hour later, we were seated and by that time (7:30) , for the people that just arrived- the wait time had increased to a few hours. Everything was socially distanced and felt safe as each party gets their own individual booth. You order everything off a paper menu. We got lobster tails for an additional price but I would just stick to the food on the menu next time. We tried mostly everything- shrimp garlic noodles (only came w/ a few shrimp/ good flavor), basically all of the different varieties of crab and shrimp (favorite were the crab legs), raw oysters, crab rangoon, calamari, sizzling steak (pretty good!), black bean clams( i think my favorite thing- so flavorful). Everything tasted fresh and the service was quick and attentive. They actually bring you your food very quickly. Would def come again!
No comment

Were very accommodating with reservations. We came earlier than we expected and they were able to sit us. Great service and food is good! Ken was also our waiter and was super helpful for the first timers
From the walk in, service was great. We were accommodated although we came in earlier than our reservation. Our waiter ken was great. Great experience !
Another all you can eat between 80/100 per head not bad not the best but a must try again bring the kids you cant get all that fish for 80 bucks
Food was delicious!! However the waitress wasn't very nice. She completely ignored my two friends and I the whole night. Until she said our two hours was up and we couldn't order anymore!!
Walked in, polite service as we waited for our table, and everyone had such great manners and helpful!
No comment
Food was amazing, and Jessica was great.... I'm visiting from California and I had a great time. Will definitely recommend to anyone looking to eat at a seafood buffet.
super bomb, good food $85 for everything not including lobster. $115 for everything with lobster. Very cool atmosphere came with friends had a good time  vibes are cool eat up come hungry solid music

Pleasantly surprised!! it's my 1st time here and I LOVE IT!!  everything  we ordered is hot, fresh and delicious! portions are generous, ambiance is smooth and inviting. I am already planning my next 2 trips! Money well spent!

AMAZING food! A bit pricey but totally worth every cent. So so much flavor in every bite. I came here with my friends for a birthday. The staff was fast , friendly and accommodating. I will definitely be dining here again in the near future!

Amazing service as always. If you want seafood all you can eat snow crab legs this is the place to be. Amazing speed during turn around with request. Great service shout out to the upstairs and kitchen staff try to feed this big boy. I am a snow crab person that the only thing I focus on when I come here. Clams amazing oyster amazing Iron steak OMG must get.
I came here with my friends for my bday , it was so nice , service was very good and food very fresh
No comment
Amazing food and drinks and the music is such a nice touch. The seafood is seasoned and I love the sea bass with the chili sauce. I would definitely come back because I'm a big seafood lover !!!!

I recommend coming here earlier in the week so there's no wait! We came on a Monday and got on the waitlist on their website at 5:30 and there were 9 parties ahead of us but were seated 30 min later. The service is also quick and  they make everything fresh!
Very good service, and you have a diverse menu to choose from. Waitstaff was very helpful.
Good! No wait when we came. Lobster was bomb. So were the crab legs and mussels. Fresh lobster and blue crab! Food came out fast. Service was helpful. Def recommend. My first time.

Seafood!!! Seems like I'm finding all the low key nyc. I so so love seafood and all you can eat!?!?! Are you kidding me. I felt like a vip being walked to my table down a private staircase. My server Cortney was the best, she was very patient explaining the menu.

I think this might be the only AYCE lobster place in NYC. Yes it's a bit pricey, but I felt it was totally worth it. They exceeded my expectations. Everything is very fresh and cooked to order and cooked well. My favorites were the lobster, scallops and steak. Everything else I tried was still very good except for the clam chowder, which I felt could have had more clams and a creamier broth. Hope they can make this better, otherwise please take it off the menu as they already have so many other good options. Other than the hostess at the door who could have been more welcoming, service was friendly and very attentive constantly checking in and did not make you feel guilty for ordering too much. Really hope they keep it up. I see that prices have steadily been increasing, but hey they need to make a living. I don't mind as long as they keep their stellar quality. Sadly places like this that are too good to be true and don't stay around for long. AYCE places are tough to be profitable especially when so many people abuse them. You don't appreciate what you have until it's gone.
Delicious!!!! Absolutely worth the price per person! The sea bass was very tasty!!! They served this tea, it was so good ! I tried almost everything on the menu!
This is the best all you can eat seafood restaurant I've been to. The lobsters are a must. We'll work the premium upgrade! May was the best server!

I've been to this place several times now and they are consistently good.  Everyone I've taken here has loved the place and they all want to go back.  The staff is super friendly and they remember us and know what we like.  This has quickly become one of our favorite restaurants.
The food came out in such a timely manner. Everything was presented beautifully, the food was really great . The ambience is beautiful . Greatly recommended.

First time here and I can absolutely say that the service was amazing! Our server was very knowledgeable and fast pace when it came to updating our menu and our order. At first we were going to go with the basic menu but we ended up going with the Buffet style. The drinks were hella strong which we love and we had such an amazing time I will come back again thank you crab house.
Very good restaurant. The staff was amazing and attentive at all times. The dungeness crab was amazing and vey flavorful. Highly recommend this place for large groups.
No comment

Really great food! My sister booked us a reservation for 2pm on a Friday. We got there right when they opened. There was no hostess, but we called and they told us to come downstairs. The staff was running around and seated us. We ordered by checking the things we wanted on a piece of paper, like a sushi restaurant. They brought it out really quickly. Everything that we wanted! Shrimp, blue crabs and crawfish in spicy sauce. Black and pepper dungenous crab claws, snow crab legs, chicken wings, fried calamari, garlic noodles and shrimp, raw clams and oysters, hot iron steak! And they give you as much as you want. No judgment zone, lol. Most recommended the shrimp in spicy sauce and shrimp in old bay. Snow crabs are dungenous. Blue crabs were a little small. But still good.
Everything was great such a nice and friendly spot for family and friends. Got to try the crab racoon

We stumbled across this place and gave it a chance.  All you can eat menu - check any and all items that you want brought to your table.  It is served family style and food comes out fast and furious! We chose the all you can eat crab option ($70 per person) but it was well worth it!  Left stuffed and loved the "experience".
No comment

The staff are amazing, our servers name was Ken. We never been here before and they explained the whole process and made it very easy for our 9 person party. The food could be seasoned a little better and having scissors to cut the snow crab legs would've made the experience even better but we came here for a birthday and they came over the energy was amazing! Was well worth the price.

The concept is great but I would recommend bringing your own seasoning. Even if you order the "old bay" or "spicy" version it has a muted taste. Also, teriyaki tastes like only soy sauce. One thing I will say is that the garlic noodles are very good and I would certainly recommend them.
It's a great place to celebrate birthdays with all you can eat seafood. The Scorpio drink is very festive too.
We came on 5/2/22 and had a very nice and pleasant waitress name Saru. Please request for her because she made our experience worthwhile. She checked on us and made sure we got the food we requested.
I've lived in NYC all my life (I'm 28) and this is hands down my absolute favorite restaurant.

May was absolutely awesome. Very observant when things got lot low. Very friendly. All the staff was great. Didn't have anyone that was rude. Everyone we encountered was polite definitely worth every penny. I would say skip the friend rice wasn't really good and oysters didn't really seem fresh but beside that the food was great
Great food and Erica's service was impeccable! You guys seriously need to promote her!!

column3: Dallas Downtown Historic District, Dallas, TX
column6: No comment
No comment

Seriously the best seafood I've ever had. I always get the Dungeness Crab with Salt and Pepper and I've tried it at many other places with classic seafood boil sauce but it has never been as good as when I order here. I dream about it when I leave. Garlic noodles, fried rice, and shrimp with cajun butter are also amazing. I've never had anything here I didn't like. The scorpion bowl and other drinks are also delicious.
Best shrimp and crab we've had in years! Really enjoyed the food! My mom loved the crab!
I love this place! The seafood is so fresh and drinks are fairly priced. Come here if you're in Coney Island!
Fun experience, great for special occasions. Wonderful service and lobster. come on an empty stomach!
This place is amazing so far. I'm just getting here and the service is amazing and the food smells absolutely great!! Can't wait to eat !!
Food is amazing if tour into seafood.  With the addition of AYCE lobster you definitely get your money's worth.  Must come!!!
No comment

Came across this place on TikTok and it was actually very good! The food is good and comes out pretty quickly. The staff that we had were super friendly and helpful. Definitely would recommend people go here! Only took off one star because we made a reservation and waited about 20mins past our time to be seated. Other than that, great!
Saw this place on TikTok and have been meaning to check it out! My friends and I love seafood so this is a no brainer.

Came here with a group of friends and we were very disappointed in the food. The seasoning is bad and the seafood is so bland and salty. Order blue crab and blue crab is all shell and no meat. The sauce with other crabs dishes  so bad. Never want to go back.

This has to be the best all you can eat seafood restaurant in the area.  The crabs were amazing.  The steak was a nice sizzling show and taste great.  I could eat the scallops and shrimp all day.  My only regret was I couldn't eat more.  Everything tastes so good and came out hot and quickly.
All is ok. Squid is very delicious. Staff has a good service. Recommend to try . For me i'm suggest owner to fine more new sauce
Absolutely love it here. All you can eat tasty flavorful seafood. As us young people say 10 out of 10 BUSSIN!
The food was very good and the service was great! We were seated within 10 minutes and was able to experience the all you can eat seafood. Best seafood restaurant in all of Manhattan.
Wow what a vibe. I love the bib you get to prep you for the food to come...so stylish I would wear to NYFW. The bread is also DELISH.
No comment
Everything was great and really enjoyed the fresh food! Service has been great and we got seated immediately
No comment

we are going for lobster ,but they don't have it. $80 per person is not worth it. , Some seafood is not fresh, crayfish tastes like zombie meat , don't know how many years they stored.  some fired things were good. But we main seafood can  not satisfied. Far behind than what I expect.
No comment
Love everything about this place. You must try at least once. The best thing about it UNLIMITED! I definitely recommend this place!
No comment

This place is so amazing and worth every drop of butter and every penny in my wallet. The seafood was soo fresh and amazing! Y'all I'm not lying... the lobster (every style), scallops, salt and pepper everything, spicy shrimp and steak! Everything is hot and to die for!

The food is to die for the service is amazing drinks are everything. I came in February for a friend's bday and we had a blast. Now I'm back by myself to eat some more  i love it here  I'll be back again my fave is the crabs of course

Food was so unseasoned I thought I had COVID for a Minute. The 2 stars are because the service was good overall and the fast pace of the food being brought out was amazing. I also loved the only seasoned thing I received during this lunch which was the toasted bread and my coke. This place should called "bring your own seasoning ALL YOU CAN EAT CRAB HOUSE" lol use your 65 at your own risk! Btw we left all this food bc no seasoning. Scallops are very good though
The quality and variety of seafood was awesome for the cost! Really enjoyed this place. I'm already craving again just giving this review!
Came to crab house to celebrate a friend birthday . The seafood here is amazingly good order 5 round off snow crab n whole lot of food . The environment and atmosphere is great service nice .
Seasoning could of been better but it was good. Worth the price. Staff was very nice and clean. Decent size table and restaurant

This was a great experience with friends and framily. My waiter was the best. The food was absolutely amazing. All the shrimp lobster and crab legs you can eat. The seared food was great. I love to see my food cook. All around great experience. You should gooooooo.
great service & awesome food deals! i really enjoyed the atmosphere. we were sat quickly & brought water immediately.
Just got here and the place looks very nice and clean and they're quick to respond to our requests! Can't wait to get into the food
No comment
No comment

I was so excited when we found this place All You Can Eat for $70 Lies you have two Hours to Eat and the Waitress comes around Every 20 minutes you sit there waiting for someone to come to the table the Food is Excellent but the Service Stinks
No comment
Hands down only place to go for seafood in the city! Won't be disappointed, you're freaking welcome!

All I can say is WOW. Great selection of items. We got everything from crawfish to crab legs to mussels. Even the steak was fabulous. They bring out the steak and the scallops on a steaming skillet, and it is piping hot! We must have ordered the raw oysters 4 times. Crab cakes were the only we ordered that were just okay. Staff is patient and attentive. Decor makes you feel like you're at the shore. Definitely a must for seafood lovers!

Great selection of seafood and other items. The varieties of preparations made it easy to want to try more and more. My advice would be to order 2-3 items at a time. We were over zealous and order a whole bunch all at once and then got full fast. You have two hours at your table so go slow and enjoy!

Courtney was our waitress and she was the sweetest gal ever! Gave us cute recommendations for the area and tbh we came back a second time for the food cuz we were hoping she would be our waitress haha she wasn't, but the food was still amazing! I wasn't too fond of the sauces for the crawfish and lobster. I recommend just going for the crab legs cuz they're expensive everywhere else. We had five plates of the crab legs. We went both times after 8p and less of a wait time too!
No comment

Amazing experience, fast customer service, short wait time for food and trust me it's a lot of food. Some of my favorites was the crab Rangoon, mussels, general tso. Strong and tasty drinks. You won't be disappointed. Ask for KD he was a bomb ass waiter, made the experience that much better.
No comment

First time here, you can't go wrong with $80 with all you can eat seafood buffet (exclude lobster) in nyc. If you are a big fan of seafood, you should definitely check out this spot! All the dishes are freshly cooked, not one of those pre made and the options you have is unbelievable. I m a big fan of raw oysters so just eating oysters alone, I feel like I already made my money worth it.
Definitely worth the money, 10/10. The music was great, menu was extensive and the service was even better.

3rd time coming here and haven't been to the city in two years. Food is still delicious and worth the price. Come hungry!! The restaurant is following Covid protocols and the wait is not bad as long as you reserve a spot. Yelp is very good at reservations.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Arrive for girls day out, place was nice and clean. Food was delicious and well seasoned. The service was nice and fast I recommend to all for al ages

The food was awesome, everything made perfect. So well worth the money spent not 1 complaint about this place except the parking but thats nyc. The shrimp were on point, the fried rice great, broccoli amazing. Highly recommend this place to get your grub on. Everything on the menu was outstanding
DO NOT OVER ORDER! My waitress was a gem. Chicken wings pretty tasteless. Stick with the seafood because the cost per person is definitely worth it.  We had a great time.
No comment
Oh boy, I went AGAIN ( me n my son). Lordy did stuff ourselves so good. We also loved there Shirley Temple's.

This place went from one of our favorite date places to our least favorite and a nightmare. We arrived at 9:59 pm the when you check it says crab house 12am and last seating is at 10pm. At  9:59 when we walked in the hostess said the oil was cleaned and there was no more seating. I went and asked to speak to a manager the hostess claim the manager went to move his car in the mean time i explained to the hostess that it is stated online that the last seating was 10pm she said "i understand if you really wanr to stay you can stay but you can only order one time" i sat down and checked everything i wanted off the last i over heard two servers arguing about not taking the table. Then they both walked up to me and said "the kitchen left" i explained that the hostess said i can stay the waiter then replied "im going to just walk away" she went and called the cops because they did not want to serve me.  I feel like this was a case of discrimination how do you call the cops on a paying customer. Ive been there numerous times i wasn't disrespectful i wasn't rude and they called the police.

The space itself is very nice. They are working on a nice wine room and they have this interesting separate section by the entrance(I'm assuming for special sections). The service was good and the staff was nice. You're given a paper and you check off the items you want. Unlimited food and no time limit. Beyond seafood they also had a steak option (SUPER tiny portions), broccoli option, spring rolls, etc. The seafood was fresh but the crab legs was BARELY seasoned. The shrimp, blue crab, broccoli( and muscles all were cooked in this brown sauce that tasted exactly the same and was very sweet). Oh! And you also have to self serve your sauces which I thought was weird. No liquor license so bring your own!

We took the subway in the rain to go eat here. We showed up at 9:50 and the door staff told us the kitchen is closed. He played dumb when I told him Yelp says they're open until 11pm. It appears that people have businesses but want to close early and not make money which is what a business is supposed to want to do. Go figure. This wouldn't be a cheap bill either especially once we add cocktails. Vegas doesn't run business this way. Disappointed.
I would rate this place 0 if I could. Wait is too long. Place is overcrowded. Go at your own expense if you wish to be poorly served for imitation crab!
No comment

I spotted the crab house all you can eat deal be advised you must pay extra king crab and lobster your portions are control on regular Seafood items only two pieces at a time you must keep reordering the same thing over and over to get the amount of seafood you want portions are very small you do not get your money's worth in my opinion
No comment

This place is great! Can't go wrong with the Scallops, sea bass & snow crab legs...so delicious. Boshi was very attentive and gave great service. Me and my friend really enjoyed the patron margaritas! We will definitely return.
I live for the aesthetics in the restaurant. And also super exited for the food!
WELL WORTH the price for the amount of food you get and I would highly recommend going with a large group. Don't make this a date night spot because it's way too much food for just 2 people.
No comment

Very pleased with my experience here. I love the plethora options of seafood and side orders. I went with hubby at 12:30 pm  on a Saturday, signed in, had my temperature checked and was seated right away. I can't wait to to return, literally everything I tried was delicious
No comment
No comment
No comment
Amazing setting! I am so excited to get the lobster All you can Eat. First time here and I am blown away!
No comment
Went for my birthday and OMG, the food is amazing..So much food..Great service and Courteney my server was the best..will be back..

Every time I come I am already greeted with such a friendly waitress. The dungeoness crab and the snow crab are always delicious. I would always come back to eat my fill of seafood until I am sick and tired of it. The shrimp and steak is still good to eat.
I love this place you can really feel the energy in here . Waitress was nice and kind

I was really looking forward to trying this restaurant. I joined the wait list around 6:15 (we only had 3 people so we couldn't make a reservation).  The waitlist was set for around 60 minutes, which was fine. Then I got a notification that things were moving quicker than expected and to check in by 7:09. We ended up checking in around 6:40. We were supposedly second in line for a table. We stood there for another 20 minutes. Then they called us back to be seated...except that was just to wait in another line for another half hour with not one person acknowledging us. By 7:35, we had had enough and left. I was highly disappointed we didn't even get to try it. If you go, make sure you have a lot of time on your hands.

One of the waiters in particular was super rude. We ordered food and wanted to take it home. She took our order then quoted us a price for the food. Then while we were waiting, tried to charge us an extra 50 dollars for the food we were waiting on. We asked to speak to a manager and she stopped all the food we ordered. She refused to come back to our table. She gave us dirty looks. The manager wasn't much help either. He sided with her even though we ordered before she brought the boxes. Never again
No comment
Amazing seafood! Definitely worth it for the price. The waiter was so kind and nice. Top notch service and experience. Would definitely recommend.
Crab house is really nice inside, follows Covid protocols, is very affordable and has a lot of choices of food items from crab legs to chicken wings. Highly recommend!!!
Fresh seafood and amazing service. We love the spicy sauce. The signature drink for 2 is also great! Definitely coming back. :)

Prices went up a lot, and not as much as offered as there use to be -- almost not really even worth it anymore for $70 per person with no lobster. It's not really all you can eat seafood without lobster but if you would like to option to pick lobster it's an extra $35 per person so $105 per person if you want an option for lobster. Food is ok, use to be better.
Wow! So excited when I found out NYC had an all you can eat seafood spot! A bit expensive but well worth it! Definitely recommend! Ty
I think this place is great but a bit expensive in my opinion. Seafood is always fresh and drinks are strong!
No comment

I LOVE SEAFOOD and this place had it all. THE RIBS WERE AMAZING. They were fast with it too. We went the Friday b4 the indoor dining shut down. So glad we did. We went for my fiancé friend birthday. I wont lie for $60 I went in hard. There were 5 of us we were there from 5:30pm till 8pm yes thats what I said we ate drank ate and ate some more. General Tso isn't like the hood Chinese. It was amazing. Shrimp so many different types and ways of a shrimp. I felt like I was working for BUBBA GUMP SHRIMP CO. The FLOUNDER WAS DELISH 1 and a half thumbs up some things were kinda not hot but all and all I will definitely go back if they reopen
Erica (waitress) is the absolute best! She's extremely professional and friendly !! Oh and the food is great !
No comment

I recommend this place 1000%. The seafood was fresh and delicious,  the non seafood items were good also. Servers were friendly the establishment very clean. $70 is more than reasonably you and your family will enjoy.

The service here was fantastic! The moment my friends and I walked in we were seated within minutes. Erica was our hostess and she was amazing! She always greeted us with a smile and was prompt with our orders. Food was great, service was better. Highly recommended!
The food was absolutely delicious, staff was so attentive and friendly. They followed covid safety rules. Def going back.

With the city at a semi normal state. Getting out and exploring the city again and found this amazing whole in the wall. All you can eat seafood. Food was amazing and so was the service. Will be back!

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: So many options for food if you love seafood! We got the lobster, 2 types of shrimp, oysters, and so much more and everything was amazing so far!! Can't wait to come back again!
I have to say I absolutely loved my experience here. Staff was wonderful. Very accommodating and acknowledged all birthdays. Will return next time in New York. They can have all my money lol.

It is a bit pricy and the food is okay. I do love that everything is made fresh but you aren't able to order lobster if everyone at the table isn't ordering lobster. Also if you order crab they will only bring one cluster per person at a time.
No comment

The BEST SEAFOOD IVE EVER AND WILL EVER HAVE! I will always tell anyone coming to nyc this is as important as the Empire State Building and Statue of Liberty if they love seafood! The service was 20/10 being the best! And the flavor and texture was beyond! Definitely come here! Make it a priority!
The best seafood ive had. The food came out hot and fast and it's unlimited like who doesn't want that.
No comment

Great service. Subpar seafood quality at best. It makes sense since it's all you can eat for a pretty decent price being that it's NYC. This will not cut if you're particular bout your seafood. Now I can see this being some what okay to those who don't care much for higher quality. It's not the freshest fish either and very greasy in flavor. Extremely overwhelming oily taste. The oysters were so disgusting. My friend and I almost threw up tasting it. From the ocean straight to your plate. No lemon nor sauces served along side. Just ice cold fishy oysters.
This place is always popping & for good reason. It's fire  I eat everything on the menu and I get my money's worth.
Great service and great good. Seafood tastes fresh and has great taste to it. Definitely recommend

My husband and I stumbled upon this place, I mean all you can eat ...... crab, snapper, shrimp... I could go on! Everything delivered promptly to your table NO nasty, reached over, talked over buffet. We will  definitely be back!
No comment
Very spacious, nice employees. No problem getting here. I came from Boston for a birthday party and it was easy check in.

This place is amazing ! Food and drinks are so good ! Food comes out quickly and it is seasoned to the perfection. I came here with my best friend for her birthday and decided to try this place for the first time ! Best decision we made. If you love seafood and love good music this is the spot. Great Vibes!
This place exceeded all expectations. Delicious food, fantastic service, and fun environment (loved the oldie throwbacks!). It's all about the snow crab legs.. we had about 8 orders of it!

I'm not sure if it's family owned, but it feels like it. Service was great. Food replenishments were very quick. Steaming hot crab served to your table. So much better than your traditional buffet/all you can eat. Don't bother with the chains in Manhattan, come here for your snow crab! Oh and the signature drink, the scorpion bowl, is definitely worth the $.
This is the best place to eat seafood in new york. Come to enjoy and prefer for your family and friends
Ive been coming here for years from the beginning of opening.  So glad they have always remained consistent, fresh and tasty.  Great bang for your buck if you have a large appetite!
This spot is great clean the staff was good they followed the guidelines this was contactless dining the food was excellent Will come again Great for $65
Literally the best day of my life  delicious food, very friendly and attentive wait staff. Food comes out so quickly and is hot and fresh. Thank you for your service, sea creatures!

Good atmosphere. However, it's $80 per person, $115 if you would like lobster. Check off everything you would like on the menu and watch the servers come out in record time. I must mention the plates are small and the quality is mediocre.  The tiny, sizzling salmon and steak bites were the best thing on the menu.The broccoli was fresh and the ribs were ok.  However none of the food items were worth the $25 take away fee for leftovers. This is the owners second location. The first location closed. However, do not be fooled the food is an ode to the Sizzler from the 1990s. It is truly buffet quality and not worth the price.

I need someone to please do a YOUTUBE video on how to cook Old Bay shrimp. I don't know what is they're secret in cooking the shrimp with Old Bay but it taste outstanding. They must be broiling it, but if anyone could figure it out, please post it on YOUTUBE and tag me on instagram Ozziehype.

Downstairs area, you can smell the good food as soon as you walk in. Seating was very fast, idk if that was because I came at 3 though lol. Waitress assisted us pretty fast which is something you don't see at restaurants anymore. Checked off what we wanted to eat and drink, drinks got here pretty quick. They came with the bread fast, this service is amazing right now let me just throw that out there. The food OMG it came out sooo fast and it was fresh and hot. You have to go to this place..!
No comment
Came here for a friends birthday. Great food. Great service. Great for groups. Dungeness is a must.

wonderful, wonderful, wonderful pictures on the website. i would love to try this place out the next time i am in new york. i love the idea of showing up with a group of friends on my birthday and they pay the bill and my meal is free. yum yum. the scallops look exceptionally yummy.

To start I ordered the Mai Tai drink while I wait for my food and it was absolutely amazing. Next, for the food I started with crab legs because I love me some crab legs, garlic butter shrimp, the seared salmon, iron steak, broccoli and the clams and this was just to start and let me tell you all, it was delicious. I definitely recommend going to crab house, for the price, it's worth it.
If you're looking for amazing food this place isn't it.  Nothing special... really overpriced.
Food was great, I went the first day of indoor dining resuming. I liked most of the food. Crab legs were good, lo mein, rice the Dungeness crab was good too. Even the french fries.
Not very good as you expected. The oyster is not fresh. The rib is too hard to eat and tastes strange. It does not worth 4.5 stars.

I came here for dinner with my boyfriend and I have to say I'm impressed, the seafood is very fresh and the other non seafood dishes were awesome as a well, the wings are super good and also their steak not to mention the service was awesome, our server name Boshi who served us was very sweet and bubbly, he always checks up on us make sure we have everything and he is always seems to be happy, it's so worth the price, I would definitely recommend this place to seafood lovers!
Delicious... you better have a hardy appetite.. or don't eat all day... you will need lots of room to enjoy all that seafood...,
Well priced. You get a lot of food. If you like seafood and your stomach's empty, this is the place to go. Lobster is pretty good. Not my favorite, but decent enough.

I don't understand the stellar reviews. Yes, the service was very nice, they were very accommodating.  Visiting NYC w friends, decided based on 4 1/2 star Yelp reviews, and many from Yelp Elites, we decided to try this place out.  The food was really awful. They smother all sorts of asian/cajun  sauces to mask the poor qualify of the seafood.  We could definitely taste how not fresh the seafood was, because we asked for them to just steam some of the menu items.  When steamed, it was inedible. The clams, raw oysters, crab cakes and crawfish were the worst. The cajun shrimp was okay, and while not the freshest, the snow crabs were edible, but the later batches were a light gray in color.  I have never walked out of a restaurant, but I wish I had that night.
It was amazing ! Omg my server name was May and she was amazing ! The food was seasoned well and it came out very fast ! It was worth every dollar .

This restaurant was absolutely amazing!!! All the dishes came out steaming hot and very tasty. The garlic butter lobster and scallops were to die for. This is by far the best all you can eat seafood place!! Worth every dime!!!

All you can eat high quality and fresh seafood. What a treat! The Dungeness crab, shrimps, crawfish, scallops, flounder, snow crab legs were all great! Also tried the chicken wings and the ribs. They were great as well.  This is my second time here, first time back since covid shutdown. The service was quick and the staff are friendly and courteous. I will definitely come back again soon.

Tik Tok brought me here! Definitely a great experience and a bang for your buck! Crab house gives you the opportunity to experience quality seafood for only a third of the price! Enjoy menu items from mussels to clams to shrimps to all you can eat crab legs. Crab house you have a loyal customer and we will be coming back!

Cajun butter shrimp, crab rangoons, noodles, oysters, breaded shrimp, and snow crab legs were sooo good!! You can pass on the mussels. You check what you want and they portion it out to how many people are in ur party. There's so pressure to finish everything it was a very good experience. Also there's a 2 hour time limit! Only request is that they serve sauces with the appitizers!

one of the best all you can eat seafood restaurants in NYC. i joined the waitlist and was seated within 30 minutes. the food is hot, fresh and comes out fast. the drinks are a bit over priced for the size but the food was everything. I ordered everything that I wanted as many times as I wanted.
Soooo worth the price. They bring the food quick and everything is tasty. Our server was sweet. I was hesitant at first but it was a great experience and i can't wait to go back!
I absolutely loved my experience at the Crab House NYC! The seafood was fresh and seasoned to perfection. The prices were decent and the drink were AMAZING! 10/10 I recommend! Check it out !

My dad and I are visiting from out of town and have heard that NYC has some of the best seafood to offer in the world. As we are walking around Manhattan, we start to get hungry so I pull up maps to find a seafood restaurant for us to eat at. This place pops up as the number one requested option, so we hop on the train to eat some food. As we walk in we are greeted with a kind smile and very helpful staff. They explained to us how the menu works and we ordered some crab, shrimp, lobster, mussels, and crab rangoons. The crab rangoons were fantastic, they practically melted on our tongues. The crab legs were alright, nothing to brag about and the spicy shrimp as quite good. However, what they call their famous lobster was actually a disgusting piece of food. It was said to be fresh, but tasted like it was just in the freezer and was warmed up in a microwave that's 50 years old. It was tough and so gross to eat, that we threw away all the lobster we had. If you do end up at this place, do not get the lobster!
No comment
Definitely a great spot. So many options on the menu. Different shrimps, different crabs, and just very amusing.
The garlic bread taste really good and the ambiance is sooo good! Great music and food. Also, ask for Ken amazing server!
Best buffet ever! Wonderful friendly staff, clean! Loved it here. Definitely going again!

Very tasty and savoury seafood! There's a time limit of 90 mins for the buffet and our experience here with the server was great, food arrived pretty quickly. My boyfriend and I contemplated awhile before we headed here. But we are both glad that we made the trip here! It's definitely worth the money

Crab House food is really good and the staff is always pleasant. My favorites are the steak and the old bay shrimps! If you join the waiting list online make sure you go inside to check in. My only complaint are the drinks. If they invested a little more into the drink menu or quality of the drinks on the existing menu I would give this place 5 stars
No comment
Prompt service, clean. Amazing atmosphere! And all you can eat! I do suggest joining the wait list. Menu is great

This is one of the best seafood spot ever. It is especially cheap, even if you dont eat much. For 65$ ,might be a steep price for some, you get an all access to delicious crab leg, oyster, and even a steak. Thinking about the quality of all their food, its well over 65$ when you eat only a few. Who knows maybe you just crave crab legs and for 65$ you can get as many as you want. Theres also a good amount of things to select from. If anyone decides to go, enjoy .

This review is a Lil late but I thought I will share my experience to hopefully help the next customer(s) out. Place is pretty decent for the $70 per person price. Everything you want to eat is selected on paper and they bring it out to your table. Most of the food was good except for the blue crabs, oyster, and mussels. Can't rate the drinks because I didn't have alcoholic beverage but it is separate and not included. You probably don't even need a reservation seem like they was taking walk ins and first come first serve just get there early if you want to be seated in the front booths, staff was friendly, bathroom was clean a lil dark for my liking but overall it was a great experience, and I can't wait to go back!!!

I took my husband here for his 40th birthday after watching Broadway show. I used the Yelp waitlist and arrived just in time around 3:30 and didn't have to wait. We were seated right away. The food was better than I expected. I didn't plan on filming that night for our YouTube channel (NatAliBaby) but I  thought it was too good of an experience not to document it. Our waiter Ari was awesome too - very attentive. Fast, clean, fresh, & delicious! Well worth the price. Will definitely go again.
No comment
No comment
I loved this place! Our serve, Ken, was amazing and attentive. Our food was soooo good. A little pricey but I mean it's all you can eat seafood. Definitely recommend
The food was great you can eat as much your stomach can hold, or just plan and roll out the building lol, worth ever cent , if you don't eat a lot that's not the place for you

The service was superb and on point at all times. The variety was phenomenal. My favs were the mussels, sea bass and anything with the spicy sauce. Was it the best seafood I've ever had? No. Was it very good? Absolutely.
I loved the food. Nice place to come if you want to eat a lot. Great service and the prices are affordable. I will be visiting again.
No comment
So worth the trip. The food was amazing definitely will be back. The salt and pepper shrimp was very good. The crab was tasty and the broccoli was crisp. The drinks were good as well
The lobsters are fresh and delicious! I will highly recommend this restaurant for every seafood lover.

Here I sit, in this wonderful booth not haven eaten all day. As I have just ordered, this place offers an ambiance that inadvertently commits you to delicious meal guaranteed foresight. And sure you could say how I could just blatantly commit without question...you'll just have to come and EAT for yourself!!!:)
No comment

We went with parents and in-laws today, everyone left happy, satisfied and FULL! We don't eat raw seafood but ordered all the different kinds of cooked seafoods. The consensus was the "Super Spicy Shrimp" which wasn't that spicy was the favorite among the adults, the Steamed Sea Bass was the favorite amongst the kids, scallops, little neck clams in black bean sauce were tight runner ups. We preferred the Snow crab to the Dungeness crabs and if it's your birthday, you get to eat for free! This is really good value for money, don't let the $55 price intimidate you, the food was fresh and so worth it!

I absolutely love this place! I highly recommend you make a reservation prior to going because they are always very busy. Regardless of how busy they are food is always hot, fresh & a very good taste. My favorite dishes in particular are the Dungeness crab legs, shrimp, clams in garlic sauce & garlic noodles and the fried flounder. Definitely glad I found this place
the restaurant is very clean, the host are very polite, it's a total vibe will be coming back
Seasoned very well almost don't need any butter. The portions are perfect and quick per each order.

My husband located this place through google. I could not believe there was an all you can eat seafood restaurant In NYC, well it is and the food is delicious . Aside from the seafood , the shrimp fried rice is authentic Chinese fried rice, and so are the fried chicken wings . The Dungeoness Crab legs and scallops were fresh , crab cakes made with real crab meat and not a lot of breading , the raw claims etc. all are amazing for the price.

This place was great! We were a party of 4 and we were all impressed, the service started fast, you select the food you want to eat, servers will bring you the fresh hot food each and every time, we had little necks oysters steak blue crab shrimps and snow crab legs and a few other food,we also ordered the "Scorpion drinks" it was delicious with plenty of spirits. Our waiter was "Dash"and he was very nice and he kept the food coming. Everything was perfect we truly enjoyed the dinner
Had a great experience...drinks were great..seafood was fresh, and plentiful...had clams on the half shell,  king cran crab legs,  scallops,  corn on the cob, ..will return

My friends wanted to try this place because we love seafood. It was just okay. Most of the dishes had the same flavor, so not much variety in taste. The service was good and the food arrived hot. We tried a variety of dishes. However, the best bang for your buck is stick with one or two dishes and eat all you want. Be mindful if there are leftovers you will be charged to take it with you.  They could do better with some of the dishes, most everything was loaded with soy sauce and too salty. If my friends and I return we decided we would order just the snow crab legs and a shrimp dish. Paying $70 per person is too much for just okay food.

This place was AMAZING! I must have eaten 20 scallops lol. The crab legs were so good. The crawfish sauce was a little too sweet for me but other than that, it was sooooo good! I will definitely be returning here.

Best all you can eat place especially if you're a seafood lover like me!! So many different options to choose from at a decent price point and every single thing we ordered was absolutely delicious. Great and friendly service as well. 10/10 recommend!

We have been around the world. The Crab House by far, blows all restaurants out the water. Best seafood and all you can eat. We was in seafood heaven. The service was so amazing and indescribable. You have to see for yourself. Vincent and Conney. We can't thank you enough for the fabulous service and great seafood. We from San Francisco Bay Area and will definitely come back to New York just to eat here at the Crab House. Fantastic job and hope your business continues to grow. People need to know about your restaurant. They are missing out.

All I can say is....EAT HERE, you won't be disappointed! Honestly, I was apprehensive about an all-you-can-eat seafood buffet in NYC of all places. I been to other seafood buffets that have an 1 1/2 time limit, not once at the Crabhouse were we rushed. Buffet may be the wrong descriptive word for this place, more-so, a seafood restaurant where you can order anything off the menu, as many times as you want. Our waitress was absolutely incredible (think her name was May). Everything ordered was delivered to table in less than 5-10 minutes. All fresh and hot - seasoned to perfection!  I read several reviews that the restaurant is expensive, to those I say you don't really eat seafood then. I most certainly ate my $69.95 share of crab legs, raw oysters, crab cake and jumbo shrimp!

Awesome, awesome spot. Food was perfect service was great. Make sure you ask for Ivan or Crystal they were our servers and were kept the food coming along with suggestions. Only wish they had liquor, or we knew you could BYOB before we got there, other than that I'll definitely be back very soon!

AYCE places usually trade quality for quantity, so I did not have high expectations when we came here. However, I was shocked at how good the seafood was here. Now, it was quite pricey, even accounting for the NYC environs, but the quality more than made up for it. Skewers of jumbo shrimp tasted very fresh and tasty, not at all overdone. Unlimited jumbo sea scallops, properly seared, which meant they must have been the more costly dry and not the treated type, were delicious. Even the clam chowder, which was probably canned, but nevertheless was piping hot and tasty. We could not complain about the snow crab or Dungeness crab either. Service was very efficient and friendly. The meal was a highlight of our stay, even with low expectations going in. We will definitely return the next time we are in town.
This place is amazing! The food is delicious and fresh. Nice environment, very clean establishment with a courteous and attentive staff!

This place is IT for all you can eat seafood! We loved the variety from shrimps to crab legs to oysters. We came without a reservation early on a Sunday morning so we were seated right away. But we suggest getting a reservation because this place gets super busy. You have to have all of your parties present in order to be seated. The host is a little bit on the edge and has a so-so attitude but the server May is EXCELLENT!!! Request her when you make the reservation and she'll take care of you! Some recommendations are raw oysters, iron steak, mussels in black pepper sauce and the dunganese crab legs

Really enjoyed the ability to go out and have all you can eat food. The location was clean the food was quick after being ordered it tasted good my one but the one advice I'll give to the next customer is don't order more food than you're ready to eat.

My friend and I were looking for an all you can eat seafood buffet in the city and this place came up on my facebook. We decided to check this place out today after work. The place was a little quiet when we sat down but the servers were friendly and very attentive. They explained how it all works: it's all you can eat, check off what food items you wanted and it'll come out fresh. We ordered the iron steak, scallops, bbq ribs, crab Rangoon, crispy shrimp with butter sauce and old bay, 2 order of crab legs, 2 orders of raw oysters, and the mussels! All super delicious! We also got free garlic bread! The bill came out to be about $60 each not including tip and our server, her name was May, had explained to us about the free birthday meal and gave us a business card for our next visit or birthday! We will definitely be back!! A great place for friends, family, or a date!
No comment

I would give zero stars if I could due to what I had encountered. It was my first time coming to this restaurant and I was excited. The ambience was good and our server was amazing but unfortunately the food has caused me to make this review. They are giving out bad dungenous crabs. As soon as I started eating it I smelled ammonia. At first I thought I was losing my mind but then the next batch smelled the same as well. Everyone knows that when crabs start to smell like ammonia that means that they are no good. They really want someone to get seafood poisoning. Smh. They really need to do better and even if they do, I will not be coming back.

Absolutely the very best seafood and steak the clams are super fresh waitstaff always coming by 6 of us with ooze birthday free terrific present  seafaring feeling every item was individually prepared  Vincent the manger is very helpful    Eat up evErythIngs  great affordable for the high grade quantities. Enjoy everything you can eat.

So glad this place opened in Manhatten! So, as soon as you walk in there is sanitizer. You write your name and address on the clip board and your temperature is taken. You go down quite a bit of stairs and YOU'RE THERE!! The decor is nice but the food is better! They give you paper menu to check off your items and bring it to you FRESH! Most dishes are small portions, some to share. Shrimp fried rice bowl could've fed 3 people easily. It was delicious. We also ordered snow crab legs, dungeness crab legs, old bay shrimp(big), fried wings, scallops, raw clams, crab cakes and fried sea bass. I had a healthy serving of rice and shrimp left and was charged $5 to take home. I think that price was based on my portion though...Oh, I forgot about the steak!!! It is served raw in a cast iron skillet that is HOT!! When it's brought to your table it has started cooking. I flipped it one time and it was done! 30 seconds. I don't what seasoning is used but that steak is DELICIOUS! There's a small alcohol menu and drinks are $15. Wine and beer,  $6. Bathroom was SPOTLESS. I appreciate the enclosed stalls. Most of all I didn't feel rushed as with most buffets..I will be back. $55 per person, well spent!

It was a great experience took my girlfriend knew we had a blast a good only thing I wish is that they did have a alcohol license but you're still a kid friendly place for the family to come go celebrate nice gatherings and everything service was excellent though can I complain they bring you food and bunches they serve you with a great smile you know good place

The place is nice and clean! As soon as you walk in you are greeted and immediately seated. The staff are super friendly and the food is amazing! Many varieties and each dish was delish! Highly recommend this place and I'm deff coming back soon!

I have to say, I'm very impressed with how the quality of their food has actually improved since Covid. We came here the first time before the pandemic, and only loved the crab legs. This time around we came for crab legs but decided to give a few things another chance. I loved the little neck clams in black bean sauce. We also enjoyed the spicy crawfish, though sadly the sauce did not soak into the meat, it was still tasty. Raw oysters have definitely improved since the last time. I'm also glad they finally got their liquor license. I do wish they had some dessert options. It's always nice to finish a salty meal with something a little sweet.
The best all you can eat seafood buffet everything tasted fresh and it had flavor. It was very clean, neat and the staff were friendly.

Kind of expensive but the quality is great and you get anything you could want in terms of seafood with the exception of sashimi. Service is good. Indoors kind of sucks because of this place always being busy but they had guards up between every booth. I still would've been more comfortable dining outside though. Still- highly recommended!

Food and service has always been top notch. There are many choices and all of them are great. I have been to Crab house many times and continue to choose Crab house as one of my favorites. Highly recommended!!

The food here doesn't have outstanding taste, but meets my expectation for buffet - I suppose you can't expect the food quality to be too high if they come with zero marginal cost. In fact among all the seafood buffet that I've been to, the food here is probably on the top tier - they serve everything fresh from the kitchen, which is better than some buffet places where food gets cold/lukewarm after staying outside for too long. I didn't get to eat much since I found most food here to be too salty or greasy for me, but if you are not as picky you probably will enjoy the unlimited supply!
Best food hands down . Straight to the point . Service is quick and inviting ! Staff is amazing ! Been 5 times and i have no complaints
The food is always good but there isn't really a wide selection of choices however it tastes delicious and very fast. The waiting to enter is a bit long with or without reservations

Great vibe! Not overly bright nor too dim, clean decor(restaurant and restroom) was nice and not cluttered  friendly fast service from our waiter Ivan! Food full of flavor and portion wise rather large! Great mirrors for taking fun pics with friends too haha

The highlight was the fried sea bass! I had them prepare it while, but you can request no head. Just know you'll miss out on the cheek meat that's so good. It and the scallops were very fresh as there was no smell or taste from the scallops. Don't be scared off because it's $60 per person--this is all you can eat and it's far beyond worth that price. The staff is also incredible. Jasper served me and was awesome! I'll be back when I'm hungry enough.
Good deal for the price. I would select the snow crabs and shrimp on a skewer only. I didn't care for any of the other items in the menu

came her valentines day 2021. this place is amazing. crab house has a  wide selection of foods to choose from( scallops,snapper, shrimp,oysters). Crab house Even items that are not seafood like ribs and chicken( the ribs are amazing). The atmosphere is very nice. it has this i'm inside ship vibe, with the nice wood texture and fishing net above your head with little items in it like fish and other sailor like items. Overall experience is great some days it's going to be a wait but overall service is spot on. They have people constantly walking around to make sure you can get you grub on or to clean tables. oh one more thing they serve drinks here to which is a major plus.

I came here on Friday night for my friends birthday dinner. It was a group of 10 of us. When we were seated, we were explained how ordering goes and the process. You get a piece of paper and you check off what you want and then they'll just bring it. We ordered - snow crab legs, Dungeness crabs, raw blue point oysters, pan seared salmon, Cajun garlic butter shrimp, mussel with black bean sauce, crab cakes, pan seared scallops, crab Rangoon, old bay shrimp, iron steak, chicken wings, broccoli in brown sauce, Cajun fries and spring rolls. Everything was great. The only thing we didn't really like were the chicken wings but otherwise there were no issues. For drinks we ordered the a few lychee passions, Hawaiian sky's, Hennessy sour and scorpion bowl. The Hawaiian sky's weren't strong and tasted like juice. Our waiter ( I believe his name was Ky or Py? I feel bad for not remembering because he was great)  was amazing. He was on top of everything. He made sure we were good all the time and if we needed anything he got it for us. A really great experience overall. I wish the price was a little lower but I understand why it's $65. I'd definitely love to come back and I recommend.

warning to all urban ppl this place is horrible!!! it should not be called "crab house". the food was not satisfying at all!! the advertisement convays all you can eat seafood buffet and thats not what its!!!. its a high class chinese buffet but if you ask me the regular chinese buffet taste a whole lot better at $15.99. this god awful place was $55.00 per person and the food was tasteless. places like "the boil", claw daddy's, even city island restaurants but this hod awful place to shame!!! ive waited 2 months to get to this place it was an ultimate disappointment!!! i came with a party of 6 every last one of us was unhappy and really let down. it was a waste of my $184.00 i paid for 3 ppl. we ordered blue crab it came with 2 crabs the size of nothing in my pic is one crab
Amazing service, they were super fast with the food and kept refilling us when requested. Also, great seafood! We love the crab legs and fish :)

It's easy to pass but look at the building number! Food is great, they didn't mention that some of the food has an Asian influence but it's all great either way. VERY reasonable price and amazing service, I look forward to going back soon! Also they pay their staff well so that's a plus.

I was beyond happy to try a all you can eat seafood buffet... It was my first time here. A woman came to my table with bread and no one introduced themselves. I had no idea how this worked. About 15-2 mins in of just sitting there I asked a lady if there was a waiter so we can finally order. She took our list and came back saying she was unaware she was our waiter. Good servers are hard to find in fast establishments. The food seemed pretty good but What made everything go downhill was, Me and my best friend saw a mouse/ rat pass our table. We were both in shock. I've eaten at many restaurants even in the Bronx and have never seen this! Looked over to a vacant area near us and we saw another ! At this point my best friend was going to throw up on the table. Absolutely disgusting!!! I will never come back to this place. For a relatively new space. This should not be a thing !

More than enough food to go around for a group of people. I would like to say about 6 the most at a table to finish all that food. It's $65 per person, there's only one menu for everyone to check off from on a paper menu. You will receive your sodas in a can because of COVID but my daughter received her Shirley temple in a cup. There was so much food, my mother, daughter and I couldn't keep up. We were only able to go one round and took the rest home. Since it was our first time, the lady allowed us to take our food home and charged us $2 a piece for a small long carry out container. They give you all kinds of shrimp you can think of and only 2 pieces of crab legs. The shrimp is not fully cleaned, you still have to remove the "poop". My mother felt the food was salty, I did not. For some of the shrimp, you have to peel the shell off. Take the family and have a good time, I think it's worth it for $65 per person for rounds of seafood.

I really enjoyed my meal here! Some of my favourites were the crab legs, Dungeness crab, prawns and scallops. They were fresh and tasty that I just had to order multiple portions of them. We also tried the chicken wings which turned out to be really good and so were the shrimp fried rice and garlic noodles. The only dish I didn't fancy was the clams as they were a little fishy. We ordered a little too much and only paid a very small fee to take away the extras which were great because I had it for lunch the next day. Overall, it is a really good dining experience plus the staffs were friendly and I believe the Chinese guy who's the boss is a lovely person. It's great value for money in my opinion for the amount of seafood you can eat.

I live in California and "crab house" was a spot to check out while I was in NY. The food was okay I wouldn't say it was something I would come back to NY for. Cool experience but food was nothing to tell a friend about.
I give it 4 stars just because the wait was crazy we waited over  2 hours on a Saturday night but the food was worth the wait being it was our first time here
Soo goood!! Nice service nice nice nice!! Good vibes and 80s music while chomping down thousands of oysters and crablegs

My husband and I went yesterday on Halloween. It was our wedding anniversary. The place is beautiful btw. They take temperatures. The waitress was great and sweet. The food was awesome. I wanted to eat more but my stomach wouldn't let all of it fit lol. Place is great though.

once I tried this spot no need to go to any other boil spot.. you get more than you pay for service is great, food is delicious and fresh to order. also nice decor.. only thing I'd recommend they have a option for how the Dungeness crab is cooked.. would rather it steamed not fried.. I will definitely be back again
Hands down the best all you can eat seafood around,  normally all you can eat places such but everything here was very fresh and tasted good
got food poisoning from this place, the rest of my group also had massive bathroom runs. this is almost the worst case of stomach bug i've ever experienced.
The best buffets！Fresh seafood and good service! I will recommend to my friends without any hesitations.

When I say I was stuffed , I was STUFFED like a turkey on thanksgiving day. We order almost everything , but the sea bass fried was heaven on EARTH. The shrimps was on point as well.  I gave it 4 stars because we order the fried chicken and fried calamari that shit was horrible , it taste like it was frozen for years and they thru it in the fryer. Also I wish they would add more seasoning on the snow crab legs it was good but it wasn't exciting like the ones in city island. The waiters was very nice. When you first walk in side it's a little weird and creepy cuz you have to find your way to the basement(that where the resturant is located) I think the should either have a host leading as the way or make it Friendlier. They don't sell wine yet so it wasn't a problem bring your own bottle of wine . I'm sure that would end once they start selling wine and beer. Please go and enjoy the all you can eat. I don't know if anyone seen the movie " The Nutty Professor " but we was looking like the Klumps family.

So good. Crab House All You Can Eat Seafood is a small, clean and cozy place. The portions are big and the staff is very friendly. The service was good and prompt; and the staff were very courteous and helpful. This place rocks.
No comment

Just ate here. The staff is super friendly.  The restaurant just opened yesterday,  which I should have looked at more carefully when reading reviews (5 stars could have been from family members/friends at the grand opening). They tell you to try everything and then order more of what you like. However,  a lot of the dishes the portions are really big. The best dishes in my and my friend's opinion are the ones that actually were small portions, but better quality. Those were the scallops and the teriyaki salmon. Those both had only 2 pieces, so one for each of us. The sea bass was good, but it's a whole fish (small/medium size),  a lot for a taster. The steak was also tasty (8 pieces on a sizzling platter). The Dungeness crab was dry and a little fishy. They don't have a really good dipping sauce for the crab. They have tarter sauce, soy sauce, ketchup,  and cocktail sauce that you can get from the bar at the front. Also fresh garlic & lemon, but there was no utensils for the lemons and garlic to dish it out (probably just an oversight because they just opened). The edamame was okay, but the server said they steam it with the crab to give it flavor, but it tasted like just plain steamed edamame. The dumplings are like the frozen ones from the supermarket- not recommended.  The fried shrimp and calamari were typical bar food and just okay. The small piece of corn on the cob with the snow crab is good as well as the snow crab, but I would like melted butter to dip the crab in. The garlic shrimp and other shell on shrimp are good, but they give you too many if you want to eat other dishes. It was nice that they gave you gloves to eat your crab, wet hand wipes, and bibs. The blue crab is a whole small crab and even though I'm from Hawaii that is something my more adventurous friends would eat, but not me or my friend. They recommend the $55 all you can eat, but in small print they also tack on a 17% service fee.  I had 2 perrier waters for $7.50 & my friend had a $2 ginger ale. We split the bill and ended up paying $74.81 a piece. In my opinion overpriced,  but if you have a huge appetite you may be able to get your money's worth. I felt bad wasting so much food, but I feel the way they tell you to try everything and then order more of what you like is misleading.  If you want to take the leftovers it is an additional $15. In my pics the dumplings are in the dish with the edamame. My friend also had the clam chowder and said she's had better. The clams and mussels were good. They start you off with a garlic panini pressed toast, which is tasty. I also want to apologize to our waiter if our bill did not include tip, but I think the owner cannot tack on a 17% service fee and expect the customer to tip 15-20% more on the meal we received. It was questionable whether it was worth $70+. It definitely was not worthy of $80+ per person!
We enjoyed celebrating my friends birthday here, the service is amazing and fast ! There is a wait time but honestly it was worth the wait the food is just amazing

Food came very quickly after we ordered, all the waiters where kind and efficient, drinks where tasty, all around great experience! Good amount of food and good tasting food for the price. I would definitely come back again!

Excellent service, great decor and atmosphere, fresh good seafood. Our waiter Ivan was incredible, service with a smile and more he was perfectly attentive as was the rest of the staff. Exactly what they advertised and more. Both Obay shrimp and snow crab legs were the standouts but we did not have a negative thought about any item on the menu. Our waiter was happy to give recommendations and give half orders so we could taste some items without filling up on anything.

Do not come here. Came here for Valentine's Day with my boyfriend and we were both very disappointed. As avid seafood lovers we found the quality to be poor, especially the oysters and the crab legs. The crab legs were extremely small, the crab cakes didn't taste like crab cakes at all, and the oysters were not only coated in ice but looked suspicious. Also, the wait being so long makes the experience even worse. Do not come here unless you don't mind eating bottom of the barrel seafood.

I know nothing about the place so I'm not gonna ruin their rating with this review I'm just posting this photo so you guys are more aware because I wasn't and I'm really sad because I really want to eat this food
Very very worth it. The seafood is high enough quality and better than I expected. Vincent was very helpful and kind. We will be back for sure.

I was really excited to try this place. We drove all the way to nyc from CT only to find out it isn't actually wheelchair accessible. I had some friends enter the restaurant to see if their was an alternate entrance, because the yelp description says it is wheelchair accessible.
