They gave the lame excuse that it's a new place and they're working on it. Was really a let down.

Pricey but worth it.  Fried sea bass is amazing! Crispy with tasty sauce. Crab is fresh. Some dish is very large like shrimp fried rice. Can order multiple times. Waiter is attentive. Overall, very good experience.
No comment

I really LOVE seafood!  This place has phenomenally fresh oysters and clams. I also recommend the Whole Fish Sea Bass, crab cakes, and iron steak - all very flavorful!  New pristine place with great, clean, modern décor - great for any occasion.  A+ for quality, price, prompt service, friendly staff, and ambiance.

Definitely not a place to go to if you want seafood boil. I have my own suspicions about ayce seafood, but over fried over seasoned, or even good non seafood dishes is not enough to justify the price for this place. As if I needed more fuel for this fire, our server... gave us allot to work with. She tried to bully us into believing we ordered something we didn't, it would have been ok if it was good, but neither of us are into crawfish and it just really wasn't good. We did not want to be those a**holes who just order for one bite and waste like it's no big deal. We  food. And I  spice, gotta say nothing was hot enough. Ambience is great and I really wanted to like it... but not worth the price. Strangely the place had plenty of patrons and everyone else seemed really happy, so just wasn't my cup of tea. Lack of liquor license didn't help.

Best value for the amount of quality lift food you get for $55  per person. The service was amazing. They checked up on us and mAde sure we had everything we needed and took away anything that we finished to clear up space for more food to come!
Best seafood all you can eat I have had for a long time while traveling through NYC. Highly recommended, everything was great and fresh!

This place is absolutely incredible. My wife and I were here the day before Christmas Eve. I found out about this place because I am a NYC Police officer and I was working one night across the street and noticed a seafood buffet. I said to myself I have to come here. The staff is amazing, very friendly and always attentive. We had Connie as our waitress. She was incredible. She always checked on us and made sure everything was on point. The food is absolutely amazing. Everything came out very quickly and if you wanted more the definitely brought it out for you. The manager Vincent is a true gentleman. This place is an incredible place to go to in NYC to have some great seafood and other food. Me and my wife will definitely be coming back.

Absolutely loved this place, the ambience was cool and the food was delicious except for the crab leg they were kind of dry, but besides that everything else was exceptional. BTW the drinks are extremely strong so if your not a drinker, order some water or soda lol.
No comment

This plane is the best seafood place I've ever been to! I love how it's all you can eat but isn't a buffet style! The Food is packed with soooo much flavor!!! And the customer service is awesome. I would travel back to NY just to go to this place!
Idk what they cook with but everything taste the same i can't explain it but the service was to nice to the point they put the plastic bib on for me lol

First I'll say as this restaurant is down in the basement, there are no access to the basement for those with disabilities and those who are elderly. my wife's 90 year old grandmother had to walk down and up the many stairs with Her cane. I'm surprised the restaurant  got away with not having ADA compliance. The Lobster house in Queens is a better set up as you enter from street  level. There's more to say but i will end it here.
No comment

We had a long wait (much longer than the 15-20 minutes they predicted) on a busy Friday Valentine's Day evening. The kitchen also struggled to keep up with demand. All that aside, we had a great meal and would absolutely come back. You can sign up for the waiting list here on Yelp; but we didn't know that ahead of time.
Awesome place the food was amazing and our server Valeria was awesome! All you can eat is no lie.

How it works is they give you sheets with the types of food they offer and you just check it off and they give you portions according to how many people you have. The food wasn't too bad tasting. I would definitely avoid getting the calamari though, they were so bland. The garlic shrimp noodles were tasty but they give you so much! So that'll fill you up fast. The wait staff was really nice. The only reason I gave two stars is cuz I got food poisoning from it  even if I didn't get food poisoning, I probably wouldn't come back anyway just because although the food was decent, I don't think it's worth the price.

I absolutely love seafood and this place was awesome! I spent Christmas here and the service was great and all the food was fresh! Only $55 for all you can eat, what a deal and the food is great quality. Not only that but, my server Valerie was absolutely great! She was kind, attentive and super fast. She was always one step ahead of what I wanted. Definitely ask for garlic butter! Will be visiting and hopefully Valerie will be my server again she was one of the best I've ever had.
The food here is delicious beyond explanation, not to mention the staff are friendly and witty. I'm worried I might end up addicted to this place and spending all my money lol
All you can eat but have to pay to take food home. Which is odd because it's seafood and it can't be served again. ‍. Birthday person gets a free meal. Meals are 45/person
Food is excellent for a buffet.  The food is always made fresh and you order with a checklist.  Place was crowded on a Thursday night.
This spot is legit and the food is great. The service is fast and the drinks are lit.

Seafoods here are really good. At first, the raw oysters were opened for a while therefore didn't taste that fresh. After we told the server Ivan, he asked the kitchen to open new ones. Very recommend the old bay shrimp, mussel with black bean sauce and raw oysters. The qualities are higher than buffet standards and it doesn't limit times. Definitely worth to try.
Found this place on Yelp. Omg amazing. $55 all u can eat. Did not disappoint. Food came out fresh n hot. Lots of variety. Dungeness crabs were sooo good! Fries sea was was amazing
This place is awesome. They just opened, so they don't have any alcohol yet, but I don't care. All you can eat seafood, and it's good. 3 types or crab legs are all boss. Reminds me of city island.

Came here for dinner for my Dads birthday (make sure you make a reservation) the food was great! But the service needs a lot of help. As you're seated you get one menu for the table and you have to mark what you want so they can bring it to the table. We did noticed something our waitress was doing to everyone on her side. Your first round was fast and she was attentive but then would literally disappear. There was a point where she was gone for 20 minutes and no one knew where she was, and once she came back she even told us to not ask other waiter for service because this was her table. which clearly became impossible since she disappeared so many times. If you order crab legs just know they bring you 2 at a time which is hard when you're a family of 4. So make sure to ask for more or maybe sit close to the kitchen so you can ask for things faster. Aside from service food was amazing and for $67 unlimited seafood I'd be back!
I usually go to the one in queens to but now since there in one in the city, I'll definitely come here more. They are still working management out with the sauces so I can't really say much.

Amazing place right in midtown! Love, love, love the oysters and the snow crab legs!  Noise level was just about right and reasonable price for an all you can eat seafood place in Manhattan. Also, I love their decor! Definitely coming again next time.

When I came here the service was good, it is definitely worth the price. I do have to say that the lobster was fresh and they do are excellent with covid precautions. The host was very friendly and they didn't mind me staying even though I ate really slowly.

Took my moms today for her birthday. We couldnt get the free birthday meal. Because we where a party of 3 adults and 1 child. But waitress May made it special for my moms and came out with a slice of cheese cake and sung happy birthday with us. May is the best. Wasnt crowd because we got there a little after 3pm. My mother and son god mother love the snow crab legs. We all had our favorites as far as food choices. But well worth the price for the amount of food we ate. My 5 yr old isn't big on food. But the cajun fries. He loves. I would recommend this place.

Came here for New Year's Day and what a way to start a year. Place is lit af. All you can eat seafood say no more fam. Super helpful servers, I had Ivan and he was the man.  Basically fogo de chao of sea food. 11/10 would recommend.
Unbelievable food and service. Would HIGHLY recommend ESPECIALLY if you are a seafood lover.

I stopped by here the other evening and I must say I was pleased. We were greeted very friendly - and staff was attentive. I do recommend to get your food in waves as it is an all you can eat so you can enjoy your experience better. Me and a friend ordered most of what we wanted to try in one order and couldn't add more because of how full we were and how big portions were. Overall, It was great, I will be coming back to enjoy my experience the right way instead of one shot- which was my fault. Only thing I can say lacked were corn & potatoes. I didn't see it as a option I could have missed it- but any seafood boil ALWAYS needs corn & potatoes! I highly recommend to check it out.

The initial waitlist time was delayed by 15, but I had a larger party and we it was during a peak time (Saturday early evening). Immediately after being seated the wait staff provided us with drink and food menus. We received  warm garlic bread, a pitcher of water, cups of ice and straws along with our drink order in a timely fashion. With larger parties there's one menu per table with unlimited item selection. This worked great for us. The quantity was enough and came out really quick. The temperature on the food was in line with expectations. With each additional order placed the service and expectations never changed. We were able to split the check and have our credit cards process at the table. There wasn't a rush or implied rush to get up after the bill was paid.

Visiting for dinner tonight. Party of 3. Wait time wasn't bad. We had Courtney as our server and she was GREAT! Very friendly and a very nice smile. She also was very attentive and because of her we will be back soon! Thanks Courtney for your hospitality!

55 dollars all you can eat! The best thing about this buffet is you don't have to get up to get your food. The server brings it all to you! Each selection comes out as a small plate. I'm a huge seafood eater and that fact that this place exists is a foodies dream. Clean, friendly and delicious!
Rude management. Unclean kitchen. The food smells disgusting and if something fall off ur plate they put it right back in. Rhis place is a hazzard
Food was fresh and delicious. Its best to make a reservation if going on a Saturday, the wait is long if not.
My new favorite seafood place in midtown. Very Cozy place and good service.  crab legs are perfectly cooked, the best I ever had. This place is a must try.

First of all, I'm not one for writing reviews but I was very unhappy with this place. I had the worst experience here. We had a group of 7 people  last night  in which they didn't bring out enough food for . They tell you to fill out this paper with all the food items you would like them to bring out. We were there for almost 3 hours and was still waiting for food from the first order . We put in a 2nd paper and it took so long for that food to come out and we was STILL missing a lot of the food that we had checked off. Mind you, they don't bring out enough food in the first place . After we kept complaining they then starting bringing out the food. I asked can we pack up the food at this point because we sat there so long and the kids were beginning to get restless. I was told that they charge $40 to pack up food but he would only charge me $20. I told them I'm not paying to pack up the food at all because we would've been able to eat it there if it would've came out in a timely fashion and if we would've received what we ordered in the first place. I was very excited to eat here due to me and my family loving seafood but we left highly disappointed. I will never recommend this place to anyone!!
No comment

The food was ok they said all you can eat for $55 but when you get there its $59 then they charge $4 just to take home left over that you already paid for seems like a rip off to me and the service was not good at all

The worst food I have ever ate in my life! I don't know how people on here are saying the food is so good! It all tasted nasty. I feel so sick now from eating here. I would never come here ever again or recommend anyone to eat here! HORRIBLE

This place is very good.  You will not leave hungry... the mussels, the sea bass, the Dungeness Crab are all superb.  Connie is a most excellent server!  Thanks we truly enjoyed ourselves... maybe get some horseradish for the oysters.

This place was well worth the time and money. I came in from Atlanta to celebrate my birthday with wife and family. The staff including the manager was friendly. Great ole skool music and nice atmosphere.The food was fresh and very tasty. If you are looking for great tasting steak, vegetables and seafood do this place. Highly recommended. A diamond in the big city.
Wow! This place was fantastic.  The wait staff were very friendly and the food was just amazing. The music was on point. All of the dishes we order were delicious. I will definitely be returning.

Food wasn't bad... at all and service was amazing!!! I did not like the different sauces served on the fish.. food came out quickly and you and yelp and hold your place online prior to arriving which I recommend. The salt and pepper crabs were amazing !!! I would recommend and go back!
Great food. Great ambiance. Fast service. Only thing is they don't serve alcohol! Will definitely be going again.
I have to say this food was amazing hands down. Will definitely go back. I went with my boyfriend for his birthday and we definitely enjoyed ourselves.

Service was okay, the waiter was nice but my friend and I didn't receive all the food we ordered the first time. We figured it was okay since we can order it again the second round. The food took quite a long time to come out. There was a lot of people so we understood. The waiter did forget our drinks tho , so we had to remind her for it. The food was overall good, some things like the duchess crab was salty. Their scallops were really good. It's 55$ a person but with tip and tax and 2 drinks, it was $75 each for us. (Which is still a good price considering you can order as much as you want!)

I noticed this new restaurant by my office and was excited to try it. The staff was friendly and accommodating. There is a huge selection of food! My friends and I were definitely full by the end of the night. We will be coming back again the next time we are craving seafood.
I came here for a friend's birthday party. Amazing.... one of my favorite dishes is sea bass. It's so delicious. Also, the Cajun is my favorite too. I will definitely come back!

The restaurant is actually set up nicely & is very clean. The food however is not so great. The crab cakes had a weird taste & the shrimps were clearly farm raised. The crawfish taste like they were soaked in tea, the scallops had no seasoning at all, while garlic and salt overwhelmed everything else. The garlic bread was good but not $55 plus tax & tip good.  Maybe in time things will get better.

I went down to New York to visit families last saturday and came across this place. Connie is hands down one of the best server I've had. I was a little overwhelmed by the menu and connie gave me a lot of good recommendations and all of them were delicious. There is super good selection. Connie also make sure to make small talk with us even though she gets quite busy, and no matter what she always checks up on us. We left the restaurant talking about how great she was! So here I am writing this review. Will go back for Connie and the food whenever I visit NY!

Service is over and beyond.   Food was awesome.  Tried dishes I would normally  not order but all  the different items on menu gave us the opportunity.  Would recommend for a different experience than we were use too.
My family took me for my birthday it was my first time there great costumer service and fast food was delicious and yummy, I highly recommend to everyone
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is a little far from the train but it's worth it! I ordered the tater tots but didn't take any pics because I gobbled it up. The honey butter sauce was good! The fried chicken (soy garlic) was super crunchy and fresh. I got the kimchi fried rice with mozzarella (which is an add-on). It was pretty yummy, I could not finish it all so I took it home. My friend got the burger which he said was delicious. The bathroom light is a disco ball which I found amusing. The manager comped one of our appetizers since the main course and appetizers came out at the same time. He did not have to do that but I really appreciated it. This place is also good for drinks as well. I recommend booking a reservation in advance because I went Thursday night and it was packed. Looking forward to visiting again.
No comment

So glad we stopped here for dinner! I had a video saved that listed this place as a great burger spot. The night was a perfect. Outdoor sitting, nyc night! Sexy and dark lol. The host sat us outside and Jose who happen to be the manager rolled up on us so quick it was great! He was relaxed, knowledgeable of the menu and just and all around vibe. He was so attentive!!! We even got complimentary shots of honey dew soju! Like vip in my own city! Lmao I LOVE HIM!  The menu has some interesting things and we were so glad they had a pre fix tasting option. If that's what you call it lol! We chose the classic 49$ a person! The lamb skewers were sooooo on point! Freaking amazing. Really was a highlight for me. Then the chop cheese rice noodle, I liked it, I'm just use to a more savory chop cheese because I'm from the block lmao but I really loved the idea, the texture and the fact That it reminded me of hamburger helper! Like super nostalgic and comforting! The wings, omg. CRISPY, kick of spice, and messy! We loved them! Finally that honey butter tots with green fukake flakes and the legendary burger put us to BED! My boo was hype over the tots! Every dish came out HOT! Excellent timing, excellent dishes. Thank you Jose! Can't wait to come with my girls for the chicken sandwich! Oh and the bathroom is legit and club lmao sorry I didn't take pics of the food. I was enjoying myself more than anything. I drank the pit smoke! Loved it
No comment
No comment
No comment
The outdoor seating area has an extremely retro vibe with neon lights and vintage posters!

The $38/person option (EP) is a GREAT deal, but know that it is for 2 people so you cannot do it alone. My highlights were the legendary burger, and the chopped cheese rice cakes. The vibes are great, they play awesome music!
No comment
No comment

Great place for meeting up with friends! The restaurant is pretty small so the tables are intimately close but everyone is very mindful about keeping the noise level down. Most menu items are on the smaller, tapa like sizes so my friends and I started off with the truffle rice cakes and honey butter tots. The truffle rice cakes reminded me of a pasta dish and was actually very filling and the tator tots were crispy with a subtle hint of honey butter favor. I got the chicken wings appetizer as my entree and was very full! They give you 4 huge pieces that are perfectly crispy, juicy, and flavorful alongside little pickled radish and dill leaves. Pretty expensive in my opinion but overall, a great upscale Korean restaurant!
No comment
If you want a true korean bar experience you're better off going to ktown. The food is overpriced and salty and the drinks are lackluster.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food here was so tasty. We got the fried chicken and legendary burger. The chicken had the perfect crispy texture to it and the radish perfectly complemented the flavors. The legendary burger was juicy and I loved the sauce on it. The restaurant had a fun vibe to it. Next time when I'm hungrier, I would definitely splurge for the tasting menu.

Amazing experience! The atmosphere is so fun, and the food was delicious and unique. We did the EP tasting menu, and our favorite dishes were the chopped cheese rice cakes, legendary burger, and the lamb skewers. The flavors were incredible in everything  we ate, and the service was fantastic, too. We had a great time, and I am so happy we tried this place!
No comment

Nowon was amazing.  The food was excellent and for the price for the pre fix ($48pp) you get a lot for your money.  We decided to add the ricotta dip as an additional appetizer, which was delicious, as well as the shrimp skewer as an additional item because we wanted the salad instead of the skewer as part of the pre fix. But, you really don't need to order anything additional than what comes with the set menu as it is a lot of food.  For the items that you could choose between, we opted for the kale salad (which was phenomenal), and the Legendary Burger (also fabulous).  We ordered the extraordinary tots and got half of them curry flavor and the other with honey butter - both delicious, but I preferred the honey butter.  I would definitely come back!
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Fantastic food! We got the burger, fried chicken, tater tots, and chopped cheese rice cakes. All incredible, we will definitely be back.
No comment

Great food, friendly service.  Went with friends who are regulars and correctly guided us to the burgers.  Dry aged burger was well-cooked, flavorful and moist.  The truffle burger had a generous shaving of truffles and was also tasty, but was a close second in my mind to the dry aged.  Whipped ricotta toast and chopped cheese rice cakes also highly recommended.
No comment

No comment

Incredible! The burgers are so good, the meat melts off the patty. The buttery tater tots are also incredible I don't know how they make them! I am not one to eat tater tots but these are a must have. Would come back many times to try other things on the menu. Also the waiter was lovely. 10/10.
Cool digs and Korean-American fusion! Whipped ricotta toast with chili oil, shrimp skewers, chopped cheese rice cakes and the dry aged burger were highlights. The staff was also so lovely.
You gotta get the legendary burger. It's cooked perfectly with all the right toppings and flavors. I did the first of the two pre fix menus and thought it was a great value for what you got.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great spot in the Lower east side. Every dish here was a hit and the cocktails were wonderful. Loved the tater tots and the burger here was to die for. Great flavor and had a spicey kick. The kimchi pancake was also a great. It's a bit crowded inside where each table is close together. But you'll get that as it's so popular. They can easily do more covers in a larger spot. Great service and very informative. Will be back.

We ordered the cheese rice cakes, chicken wings, legendary burger and honey butter tater tots. Everything was incredible! The vibes inside were also so fun. And yes the burger with kimchi was worth all of the hype!!! Highly recommend
No comment
No comment
The food is so good. It's more like small dishes, so order a lot so you can share. The cocktails are not bad either. The music is pretty good also, will definitely come back for more
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really solid restaurant with great music. Opted to do the remix classic so I could taste the popular items. I loved the chicken wings- I did spicy, chopped cheese rice cakes were delicious with great texture, broccolini was amazing and the burger was to die for. I wasn't crazy about the steak tartare or the curry spiced tater tots but they were still pretty good just not my favorite. Drinks are ok. Im still giving 5 stars because they get creative with what they have to work with and I can't knock down my rating because of that. With that being said this is a great place to just chill eat great food and listen to great music. I will definitely be back.
No comment
Note to everyone: COME HERE! No doubt about it. First time in NYC, first meal, and... aaaaamazinggggg! Everything is beyond delicious. So worth it
No comment
No comment
So yum! Get the cheesy rice cakes and the tots! You will def not regret it! They're also gluten free friendly!
No comment
No comment

I first tried Jae Lee's food in his pop-up at the Black Emperor bar and became an instant fan.  Nowon never disappoints.  Although I pretend to look at the menu, I always opt for the legendary burger and blackened broccolini.  They are so good, I would lick the plate if I were by myself.  The staff are so attentive and courteous and always make me feel at home.

We came for dinner and sat at the bar. We ordered the black truffle burger, curried tater tots, chopped cheese rice cakes (tteokbokki) and the drinking game set for two. The burger and tteokbokki were delicious and comforting. I'm late in writing this but they were memorable dishes, especially the tteokbokki. The drink set included a descent amount - two beers and a bottle of soju. This is a fun lively environment with good food and great service.

Update- this place has really streamlined quality and service since first opening! The food is so so so good! Taking traditional Korean flavors and blending American (read NY) favorites for the perfect casual filling meal! Chopped cheese rice cakes was my favorite it reminded me of eating hamburger helper but wayyyyy better with better ingredients. Just has a nice homey feel to it! The burger was giving McDonald Big Mac if McDonalds had actual chefs preparing each burger made to order especially for you! Juicy, well seasoned, stacked, meaty! So good! Not to mention the ambiance! Great music for a lil pre turn up vibe or fun to impress a date with (they'll think your super cool, trussst me). Also affordable! Thanks Nowon!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Delicious tater tots!!! The service was good, food was great! The tater tots were by far the best thing we ordered. The Korean fried chicken on their menu was good but a little hard to eat. Would definitely go back and I liked that they have outdoor seating now.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Delicious food and nice ambiance! We got the chopped cheese rice cakes, broccolini, and the burger. I'm surprised they're able to do Korean fusion so well. The rice cakes are apparently famous, and they were super satisfying. The right amount of cheese and carbs. I was little hesitant about ordering the burger bc like why order burger at a Korean restaurant? But I'm so happy I did! I'd definitely come back and order more off the menu
No comment
No comment

Amazing Modern Korean restaurant for food and soju cocktails. New spot in East Village area that has great atmosphere and the service is outstanding! Juan, all around made it a great time and explained couple items of the menu. Food was outstanding and the vision was executed. Definitely worth the trip and it does get busy for dinner, so make a reservation!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had dinner here tonight and it was one of the best meals I've had in recent years. My fiend and I got the $45 tasting menu which came with about five dishes plus a dessert. We subbed in the truffle burger for the burger that came with the menu. EVERY SINGLE DISH was incredible. Very inventive and full of flavor. We came without a reservation and I can't believe it wasn't packed. On the way home we walked by Katz's deli and I wanted to tell the line of people out front to go to Nowon and they would be much happier. I will be returning here many times and you should too.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Highly recommend if you're looking for a unique place in the east village!  The food was great and the bar tender was super friendly. I had the kimchi rice, which you must get with cheese on top (it's extra, but worth it). This was pretty heavy for my main course so I ended up splitting it with my boyfriend. The broccoli was INCREDIBLE and was definitely the highlight of the meal.
No comment

For $17 I expected the kfc would constitute at least a reasonable portion of a meal. Sadly, not so. Not much more in the box than a few crumbs. Tasty crumbs, but still very disappointed in the size of portions.
No comment

My god. Came here for dinner and wow. So glad I did. While the menu is small and chic it has something for everyone! Dishes are well thought out and made with great care. You can tell the recipes I use are authentic and come from the heart. The service is incredible prompt, friendly, and very welcoming. I can't say enough about the staff how common anything they were and how they made our special requests happen. Things that weren't actually on the menu we were able to order and they accommodated  everything that we needed or the wife wanted. The food itself was simply stunning beautifully presented and serve piping hot. It was a great night of Korean food. Prices are extremely competitive especially for the homemade dishes. I'd highly recommend coming here after a night out or even for a dinner date. The ambience is very romantic and the service cannot be beat. I can't wait to come back
No comment
No comment

Nowon, in the East Village is an eclectic restaurant featuring small plate Korean American cuisine. The menu offers some preset options, they call remixes, to pick from. We opted for the classic remix -- Vol #1 which included a gem salad, charred broccolini, Korean fried chicken, burger, crispy tater tots, and yuja donut. The 'Chopped Cheese' rice cake was simply excellent and we also loved the fried chicken and the Yuja donut. Be sure to also order one of their cocktails. They were dangerously delicious

Great vibe, amazing staff all around , very friendly! bartender Sam was so welcoming and made custom drinks for us and honestly was like being in someone's home- he hosted us !! Definitely coming back. We had the chicken and it was ssooooo yummy !!!!
Good burger, but could've come with some fries or something perhaps.
No comment
No comment

Loved Nowon! We had a great experience here. Not only was the food amazing, but they have a fun cocktail menu and beer pitchers/drinking games for a really fun spin on classic drinking games. Some of our favorites on the menu were the chopped cheese rice cakes, and the tofu sandwich (truly SO good!!!). Definitely recommend for a group of friends needing to catch up.
Their team was very professional and accommodating when helping us secure a group reservation. Great food and even better vibes! Would highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
The food was amazing. The music was bumping. We were in town for the holiday weekend and this place did not disappoint. Seek this place out!
No comment

Really good spot with really good food. Came here twice within a few weeks of each other. The first time my friend and I shared the fried chicken, burger, chopped cheese rice cakes, and honey butter tots. Everything was really good, only downside was that the burger was quite salty. The second time I went back my friend and I got the mixtape, just be aware that they give u much smaller portions of certain items such as the chopped cheese rice cakes which was upsetting since it's the best thing on the menu. If I knew they were smaller portions I would've rather ordered the dishes individually. We also got rushed out after 90 minutes since someone else had reservations but we weren't told there would be a time limit when we sat. The burger was salty yet again. I'd come back again just for the rice cakes but not in a rush and probably wouldn't go out of my way. FYI parking is impossible here so don't drive!
No comment

Get double patty smashed cheeseburger was amazing, I only regret having to share it. Also got the kimchi fried rice, they asked if we wanted to add cheese - definitely say yes! Both dishes so delicious, wish we could try their whole menu. Picked up a jar of their chili oil, too!
No comment
No comment

Having heard so many good things about Nowon in the East Village, I had to try it out. Nowon is a Korean American Gastro Pub Fusion, the place itself has such a groovy interior and perfect place to have dinner with a friend or to grab some burgers or wings before a night out. The food didn't disappoint either, we ordered the K.F.C (Korean Fried Chicken), Legendary Cheeseburger and Crispy Tater Tots. The K.F.C (Korean Fried Chicken) has a gochujang glaze with blue cheese buttermilk which gives it such a savory and unique taste. The Legendary Cheeseburger has smashed double patties, american cheese, kimchi mayo and b&b pickles, which was a delicious twist on the classic. Lastly my favorite were the Crispy Tater tots with honey butter, never would I have thought of this pairing but I would go back specifically for them.
No comment
Came here on a Tuesday night, and it was poppin. We didn't have much of a wait and got seated in 10 minutes. Every dish that we had was super good. Don't sleep on the burger or the tots.

Easily one of the best restaurants I've been to. Great music, super friendly staff, and killer food. Still thinking about the tater tots. Seriously that good. The burger was also *chefs kiss*. You need to come here!
Swanky Korean fusion restaurant with a full bar inside. The portions were way too small. Loved the Korean Fried Chicken though.

Honestly incredibly overrated. Seemed like a place where 20 year olds come to get drunk and loud. The food was awful. Ordered the fried chicken, the Legendary burger, the tater tots (inedible) and the broccoli.

Went back to Nowon for the 2nd time and it did not disappoint. Food, drinks, and service were all outstanding. Got several different things to try. The chopped cheese rice cakes were a big hit. Of course, the burger is amazing too. And the vibe and music are so lively and fun. Definitely a fun place to go out with friends. Check it out!
Just mind blowingly delicious food! Went here for a date night and had the most amazing time. Highly recommend!

Last night I went to Nowon with three of my girlfriends. I hadn't heard of it, but they were all dying to try it. We each got the tasting menu which was fairly priced. first came out two salads and the charred brocollini or should I say charred crack. the salads were OKAY but the brocollini was amazing. We also got the slippery noodles, the chop cheese gnocchi dish and the burger. I could go on and on about each of those dishes because they were all fantastic. The drinks were great and the people working there were so helpful when ordering and extremely friendly. Great service, great atmosphere and great food. Nothing more to ask for!
No comment

I stopped by Nowon on a Saturday night for a late night meal with the girlfriend, now ex-girlfriend(HA!). We were astounded by the food. Chef Jae Lee is an amazing chef and unbelievable host. I'd take a date here any day of the week.
No comment

Came here for a snack after shopping at Soho. We ordered the 3 piece shin ramyun wings and the dry aged burger and shared. The wings came with a side of ranch and were nice and crispy. It did not necessarily taste like shin ramyun but had a nice slightly sweet and spicy flavor to them. The burger was pretty good, but the bottom bun of the burger was completely soggy. I think it may have been because the burger was cut in half. The service was great and the waiter did a very good job of explaining the menu and their daily special.

This place has instantly become a favorite of mine. The Korean-American cuisine is something so creative and delicious. My daughter and I shared a few dishes (Guacamole, Chopped Cheese Rice Cake, Curry Tater Tots, Legendary Burger and the Porkbelly dish), and let me tell you itv was outstanding. The innovative mix of Korean and American food is beautifully done.
Great to know there's another place serving solid burgers. Tried both on their menu and was pleased. The tater tots were a good complement as well.
No comment
No comment

Food came out quick and delicious! Honestly best chicken sandwich I've had in a very long time :) The server was very sweet and attentive. Not only is the food good but the entire ambiance & aesthetic of the place mixed with the r&b / rap music that plays is a total throwback to the early 2000's and I adore it. I will definitely be coming back.

Went with a group of friends.  Food was great esp the broccolini.  Service was good. Nice location.
No comment
Amazing burger. One of the best. Kimchi Mayo is on point. It's like elevated bar food. Chopped cheese tteokboki cmoooon that's what you want when you're drinking.
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Best burger in NYC!!! The whole restaurant had a cool vibe. The menu had lots of different flavors and was not your average spot. The burger was 10/10 a must try!

I tried this place for the first time a few weeks ago and I absolutely loved it. The service was great, the employees were so laid back and friendly, and the food was absolutely spectacular. I loved how unique and flavorful it all was--I've never had anything like it! We got the kimchi burrata, chicken wings, burger, and honey tater tots and it was some of the best food I've had. The drinks were also super good AND they have happy hour on weekends!! If you're in NYC this place is a must visit!!

This was excellent. First visit, we got the rice cakes, three-piece wings, tater tots, tuna kimbap, and the burger. The rice cakes were outstanding (very cheesy) and a must re-order on a future visit. The burger was excellent as well, and right up my wife's alley in particular. The wings were (somewhat surprisingly) my favorite dish of the night, and I definitely want to try the fried chicken sandwich next time around. We loved the tots too, but they were very heavy. We'd probably skip the kimbap next time.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food here is amazing, the local summer ale they had on draft was very good. I was blown away by every dish, and the burger does indeed compete for one of the best in NYC. Fried chicken was INSANE! Get the spicey version, it's not too spicey. Even the salads were unforgettable! You won't forget this spot.
No comment
Did the tasting menu and every single item was amazing! So good, service was amazing, vibes are really fun. Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment

Very good! Service was quick (could use a little more attentiveness) but hey it t was a Friday night! All the food came out hot, burger was excellent and decadent. And if you drink can't go wrong with the NoWon Fashioned the barley soju sets it apart and gives it a depth.

This spot is another one that's really flavorful and yummy. I really like the vibe the food was delicious and the service was great . They have a really nice menu and drinks. They only have one dessert on the menu but that dessert had my tummy going for another bite. I recommend this place
No comment
No comment
No comment

The pop up at Black Emperor bar launched the culinary Korean fusion wave here at Nowon. The dry aged double cheeseburger, honey butter tots, chopped cheese rice cakes and fresh kim chi were the highlights of our evening. This cheeseburger is no joke. Very rich in flavor and you can tell the quality. The honey butter tots were delicious. Sweetness of the honey was great with the fried tots. The ambience here is great with the dim lights and cool NY hip hop theme. Thrillist and Eater NY got me hip to this and I'll definitely be back to try the shin yun ramen wings. Great service and execution by the staff.
Can't say enough amazing things about this place. Just get everything on the menu and you won't go wrong!
No comment
Food is delicious! Love their broccolini, rice cakes and burgers. Vibe is great w good music, staff are really nice and accommodating.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Drinks and sandwiches were amazing.  Appetizers, however, stunk.  Who serves cold shishitos?  Not mentioned on the menu and confirmed by server that they were supposed to be cold.  Terrible.  Who serves cold burrata?  Should be about room temperature, I've had burrata a zillion times and never cold like this.  Also terrible.  Go for the drinks and sandwiches, avoid the appetizers.  Prepare for a wait.  Oh, and we reserved an outdoor spot but they didn't have one on arrival, which was also very annoying in this age of COVID.  Reservation clearly says outside.  So don't bank on outside seating.

Amazing every single time we go. My husband John can't get enough of this place. My favorite dish is the rice cakes but let me be clear TRY EVERYTHING. Nothing will disappoint you. We came across this establishment for the burger which I feel is number two on the burger list of best burgers. Drinks are always up to par. Clean and super friendly establishment. Going into the bathroom is an experience all on its own. Lol. Would recommend over and over again. Consistency is most important for me. Hope you enjoy it as much as we do. Hidden gem.

The kimchi and burrata appetizer. The fried chicken sandwich. The burger. I went 3x in a span of a month and I now go pretty regularly. There's a great happy hour and they have a super cool Korean American vibe!

3.75 Had this place on the list for a short while due to the IG posts my lady has been sending me. We also pass it every time we are in the East Village. We just decided to go for it. Service is very friendly. I think the selection of classic Hip-Hop (Wu-Tang, DMX, Lox, etc) earns an automatic point! I was loving it. We started with the chopped cheese rice cakes and the wings. The rice cakes, while not reminiscent of chopped cheese (at least to me), were still delicious. The wings were crunchy and pretty tasty, but an order of 6 (really 6 halves) for $20 is very pricey. We also got the chicken sandwich and the burger. The burger was good but not great. My gf and I had split opinions on the chicken sandwich. She though it was ok and I thought it was really good. She wishes they used thigh instead of breast (an opinion I am not at all mad at). I will say the breast was still very juicy and I thought the sandwich had great flavor. The cocktail list is very limited and also a little on the pricey side. The vibe here is cool and it's a place I would love to come back to once indoor dining resumes (hopefully ASAP!). If you are in the East Village I would recommend you stop in for a bite (or two). ENJOY!!!
Definitely going to become one of those classic New York restaurants. Food is insane, ambiance is quintessential east village, and the staff is the sweetest. Go here while it's still under the radar.

column3: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Standing outside Nowon after being carded by the bald host and being told to wait 15 minutes for a table. While we were waiting a server came over and asked us for our drink order. Then after waiting for our drinks the same waiter comes over 5 minutes later and asks us to see our IDs. We think it's strange we are being carded twice but give them to the server anyways. The after looking at our 24 year old California real-ID's - he says "sorry we can't take those". Mind you this is a restaurant and we didn't even need drinks. The strangest out of the blue power trip from this host. Food was over hyped anyways.

Went here back when the weather was warm and outdoor dining was just starting to be a thing I felt comfortable doing.  They have a great set up and the meal and the service was tasty and everything felt very save.  They had hand sanitizer at the table and a clear communication about time limits for tables and expectations around ordering.  Our waiter was very kind and attentive and made good recommendations when we were wavering with a couple of our choices.  They were able to split the chicken sandwich for us before it was brought to the table and were able to give us a new plate when we had too much sauce on the once we had used to be able to put our sandwiches down :). Sometimes its those little things.  I hope to be able to dine there again to support them, I know they are doing great work :)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went here late Friday  night without a reservation and the staff was very accommodating with no wait. Got a pitcher of the Juicy Bomb IPA which was delicious. My boyfriend go the fried chicken sand which that he really enjoyed. I got the fried tofu tacos which were incredibly tasty. Great service and great modern/ trendy environment.
loved the vibe of this place and the drinks are super refreshing and smooth! would highly recommend the fried chicken and donut holes!!

Great food and service! I had the Legendary burger which was indeed superb (it uses kimchi mayo, b&b pickles). We also had the nacho chips which had a very unique dip, one of the most delicious I'd ever encountered. Also the staff are SUPER nice. Above and beyond. Can't wait to go back.
An NYC MUST EAT !!! Korean flavors with cheese. Literally how can you go wrong? Still dreaming about the chopped cheese rice cakes
Such good food and good vibes. Service was really good and the frozen watermelon drink was to die for- not too sugary, just right. Definitely would recommend.
Best hamburger and tater tots i've had. Elevated but casual korean/american food.

the food is great, this is one of my fav spots. maybe just an off moment, but the host was pretty rude. i opened the door and asked for a table outside and he acted like i was asking him to move a mountain. he was extremely dismissive and had a nasty tone when he told me i could take one of the high tops by the entrance. this entire interaction happened in maybe 5 seconds but it was so cutting. i know it wasn't in my head either because he seemed to have realized what a jerk he came across as and proceeded to be so cringe and try hard trying to accommodate me, but it was so obviously forced it felt so uncomfortable. i was really hungry or else i would've just said nevermind and left. it made my entire experience super awkward since he was also waiting on my table. i just kept my head down and tried to get out of there as quickly as i could. i love this place, but i'm questioning whether i'll return if i'm going to be made to feel like i'm a nuisance from the second i open the door, if i see that he's at the front i'll just avoid it and go somewhere else. we all have our moments, but for him to default to being so rude as soon as i opened the door and barely said four words was extremely uncalled for and weird.
No comment
The food is beyond amazing. Between the three of us, we ordered most of the items on the menu and everything was delicious. Everyone working there was nice and helpful.

Had pretty high expectations of this place since it garnered high reviews but must say was pretty much disappointed. We got the octopus and soy chicken wings as appetizers. The octopus was two small skewers and rubbery. I didn't even want to finish my small piece. The wings were small and nothing spectacular. Go to turntable for real wings. We got the dry aged burger and honey butter tater tot's. These took almost 40 mins to arrive after we finished the apps. And then the burger was cold. Probably sat out for 5-10 minutes before someone realized to push out the order. The burger was small and had no flavor and no other condiments other than the spicy mayo. For a $24 burger you expect it to be somewhat good and larger. It does not come with any fries or tots which you order separately. The tots tasted like frozen and the honey butte flavor was a bit overpowering. To summarize there are way better spots to spend your money and to get Korean gastopub experience and food.

Stopped by to grab lunch before heading to Tomkins Sq and we were NOT disappointed... takeout can be hit or miss but this was definitely a hit. Loved the burger, the korean big bird sandwich and the honey butter tater tots. So much flavor in everything and cooked perfectly. 100% recommend for takeout and I can only assume by their friendliness at pickup that dining in would be great as well.

Went with a few friends last weekend and I am in love with this place after my first visit. Each dish was really creative and came out in the order that it was prepared (shishito peppers, kimchi burrata, crunchy cucumbers, charred brocolini, chicken sandwich, and of course a burger with honey butter tater tots). Each plate stood on its own but together it made one of the best meals I've had in recent memory. The staff was wonderful and attentive. My only complaint is that they are not on my block. If they were, I'd be here every week.
No comment
10/10 this place is amazing great vibes unreal energy and food and worth this word limit 100%

Found this spot randomly. Originally we were suppose to eat at Barrio Chino but it was pouring hard and no one was leaving their table. So I go on Yelp and "Nowon" pops up. I check their reviews, photos and I call. The lady on the phone was so eager to help and even did me a favor by taking my name over the phone for a table for 5 (they don't usually do this so please don't ask, it was raining, you get the deal). We got there and everyone was so accommodating and helpful. Even in a shitty rainy day, they made sure we were all comfortable in our table. We ordered everything from the wings (a must) to the buttered tator tots (a must). Everything we had was so good, fresh and I would definitely come back here. It's probably going to be a go to for me and a place I take friends/family visiting NYC.
No comment
No comment

We picked up dinner here and we were BLOWN away. Possibly best meal of quarantine. We continually debate which item was our favorite - friend chicken sammy, chicken wings, burger, tater tots. There is never a hands down winner, bc they are all insanely good for different reasons. Wowza. Thank you!
No comment
No comment
No comment

my friend made a reservation here for dinner for us and her boyfriend. there's indoor & outdoor seating. the atmosphere is pretty dark and the bathroom is such a vibe. we ate basically everything on the menu here haaha. the cheese corn was alright - it tasted like a deconstructed elote. the rice cakes were definitely a nice spin off on the korean spicy version - tasted more like an american version of a chili rice cake. the mackeral was probably my favorite - was very tasteful. the fried chicken tasted like popcorn chicken - did not meet expectations. the galbi steak was okay, reminded me of a reuben sandwich. the dry aged burger was pretty good but not as flavor-ful as much as i would have liked. the yuja donut was a perfect light way to end the night but i don't recommend if you don't like sweets as it could be a little bit too sweet. otherwise, not bad as a korean fusion restaurant but not amazing..
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment

We were hooked since the him_ny pop up, so glad Nowon has its own space. We made a dinner reservation for 5pm on a Sunday, we recommend a reservation since people without reservations were not able to be seated. Got the honey butter tater tots, numbing cucumber salad, spam and octopus fried rice, shin ramyun fried wings, spicy prawn jjampong, and the famed double cheeseburger. All of the food was good. Service was good - offered us to add another wing to the order so that each of us had one, which was the right move, since the wings are so good. The bathroom is a party. One small wish is that the dining room wasn't so dim... But really great music playing, so it was still a lot of fun. Can't wait to find another excuse to go back!

We got this recommendation from a friend and it makes me question why we did not know about this place soon. We had more food than the pictures but we were so hungry and it was all so delicious we didn't even have time for more pictures. My husband had the burger and I had the chicken sandwich. Even my picky kids loved the wings. Highly highly recommended!
No comment

Another smashing success. I'd give it a 4.5 if I could. But rounding up for a new restaurant delivering this well. We walked in and were offered a table for an hour. But the hostess moved things around to get rid of the time crunch. Nowon is a very dark spot that feels like they have a DJ playing. But why hide this amazing food? Octopus was perfectly cooked with an interesting flavor. Squeeze the lime. It makes it even better. The cucumbers took a minute, but get the juice from the bottom to really take in the peppercorn. The wings were as advertised - outstanding. And the mung bean pancake was a thicker, juicier scallion pancake. We are definitely quite satisfied. I hope the menu changes so we can try even more things.
No comment

Food is so good! Had outdoor dining during COVID times - it was a hot day and wished I wasn't burning as I was eating but what can you do. The honey butter tater tots are the best fried potato type food I've EVER had!! The cream cheese dolloped on the top went really well with the taters and they were subtly sweet. And the Jae Mac is SOO GOOD, which means a lot because I don't even like burgers all that much. Super messy to eat but in terms of taste, 10/10. The shin ramyun wings didn't taste very shin ramyun-esque but were still good and worth a try! Will definitely come back because I think this is now my go-to burger spot! And those taters.... I think about them a lot.

If you love Big Macs and are looking to graduate, the Double Cheeseburger is the best burger, period. Korean Chopped Cheese is peak comfort food. As an Asian American myself this food tastes cool, personal, and genius. We plan to ring in the new year with bellies full of Nowon, only the goodness.

The nowon burger is amazing. Must try to honey tater tots-they pair well with the burger (and are super crunchy!). The wings are huge. Really cool restaurant design, great music, friendly staff. They also have great happy hour specials.

The atmosphere is fun and light. The food is different and delicious. The rice cakes was a table favorite. The staff is so friendly and fun. And the bathroom is it's all little party. Loved everything about this place. New NYC fav!
This was a horrendous meal, the burger is too expensive and tastes like someone chose random ingredients to place on top of each other

Nowon is a buzzy kind of place whose reputation allows it to upcharge just a little more and demand that you buy a meal's worth of food if you wish to hang out there for 1.5 hours. As a result, I got to sample a variety of food I probably wouldn't have otherwise. The food here is mostly korean bar food, so don't expect health. I had the pickles, the kimbap, honey butter tater tots, kimchi burrata and the charred broccolini salad. The kimchi burrata was an unexpectedly delicious combination. The honey butter tater tots were tasty but it's hard to mess up deep fried carbs. The kimbap is not worth getting at all. It's fine but not great. I probably would have more to rave about if I ordered less healthy things like burgers or wings, but other people have already done that for me.

Food was stellar. See my pics, yum. They had a nice outdoor dining area with some warmers which was great. Make reservations, there were people that were walk in and the wait was too long and they all left. Just came on yelp to say I really appreciated the great service by Ian. He had a great energy and was kind when I asked questions about the burgers at Nowon. Will be back.

For the record this is the first bad review I have ever written and I would give zero stars if I was able to. This restaurant has the worst customer service I have ever seen. I made a reservation for 5:30pm (NOT a popular time) the morning of (so clearly this was not a reservation that people were trying to make since it was available that morning) and when I was unable to attend my reservation because I was asleep sick in bed and worried I might have COVID, the restaurant charged me $40 ($20 pp). I attempted to cancel the reservation on Resy and it did not give me the option to and said I could not cancel within 24 hrs even though the reservation was made less than 24 hrs before the time of the reservation. I emailed the restaurant to explain the situation and they were very rude and said they were still charging me despite my covid concerns. Most gyms and restaurants are being extremely cautious and understanding of cancellations due to covid but this restaurant was so rude and strictly adhering to their policy despite these unusual times. I would not trust going to this restaurant as it does not seem they are concerned with the risk of covid and would have rather me attend indoor dining even with the risk of having COVID.

Favorite place for a cheat night. Pro tip: come with friends (more the merrier) so you can eat the whole menu. The burger is a must get, although I guess everything else is too. To top off your meal, try the Makku drink- cold, bubbly, smooth, and refreshing. If I lived closer to Nowon, my waist would be in trouble.

OMG. Everything was amazing. We had the kimchi fried rice, chopped cheese rice cakes (their take on the chopped cheeses sandwich), ribeye steak, and honey butter tots....simply genius. I can't give them a high enough rating. DELICIOUS
Great food, nice wine, super professional wait staff and friendly as well. Will be back again.

Food was good but beware you have to order at least two small dishes or one large dish for every drink ordered. Because of that, we ordered food and didn't finish. Three of us all ordered cocktails, but it wasn't strong at all so slightly disappointed.
Amazing food amazing ambiance. Great outdoor seating during the current times. Highly recommend the wings, j Mac, and chopped cheese rice cakes.

Let me tell you, Nowon was definitely great. Everything is delicious, fresh, the staff is very nice the place kept very clean. The food was great, Wok Roasted Dry-aged Ribeye Steak was yummy. 5/5 for service. I certainly see myself returning here in the future.
Really great spot! I would say the tator tots are just a little to sweet, but very interesting. Loved the wings which came on special with a carafe of Suju and Hite beer. Left very satisfied!
No comment

Fantastic burger - one of the best I've had in recent memory. We also split the octopus and spam fried rice and the charred broccoli and both were delicious. Servicw was great but they need to get their liquor license or at least a BYOB option. Also the strobe light situation in the bathroom was weird - esp given the lack of alcohol.

WARNING - ABSOLUTELY NO ALCOHOL. This place caught me by surprise as I do not see it mentioned in reviews, but be warned, as of February 2020 there are mock-tails and water only. I have mixed reviews of the food. The chopped cheese rice cakes were delicious, couldn't have been better. The burger was fantastic, I would put it on par with Emily/Emmy Squared. The tots were just normal tater tots drenched, and I mean drenched in butter, avoid at all costs. The cucumber salad starter was devoid of flavor and I wouldn't recommend. Service was fine, atmosphere fine, though there was a table with several children sitting next to us for a 9:30pm reservation on a Friday night. But for a dry joint this may be the norm, I am not sure. Bottom line, I would hit it again for a burger some day, but not until they pull it together and pony up for a liquor license.
No comment

Had a wonderful time at Nowon last night! The burger, tots, and chicken wings were phenomenal, and the service and the 90's jams truly added to the experience. We enjoyed speaking with Chef Jae Lee about his journey to opening the restaurant and he even surprised us with a complimentary mung bean pancake!  Looking forward to coming back when the liquor license comes in and hopefully a dessert menu!
This place serves up truly, truly delicious food that's also unexpected and new. I really can't recommend it enough. Get the chicken sandy and the tater tots and the cucumbers and... all of it!

Had an awesome meal here last night with a small group for outdoor dining. The outdoor setup was cozy and warm even in the freezing temperature! All of the food was amazing, especially the burger, rice cakes and tater tots. We also loved our waiter/somm Ian. He was so friendly and knowledgeable about the wine list, giving us lots of great recommendations for natural wine! Can't wait to come back!

Unbelievable, man. Just a great culinary experience, from the exquisite burger and honey butter tots to the snug comfort of the chopped cheese rice cakes. Chef Jae is the future, this place deserves extra love so here I am.

From the second you walk into Nowon, it is an excellent experience. The food was phenomenal. Each dish was more surprising and flavorful than the last...ORDER THE CHOPPED CHEESE RICECAKES. They were absolutely insane. It was a very unique combination of flavors and cuisines, in the best way possible--the same is true of the wings, the honey butter tater tots, and the octopus & spam fried rice(don't miss out on this either). The burger is one of the best in Alphabet City...and if you're lucky enough to be there on a night where they have the deviled dkeggs special, do yourself a favor and order them without question. All around, can't say enough about what an amazing addition this is to the neighborhood. Great food, great vibes. 10/10 would recommend
Their spam fried rice was ridiculously overpriced and not good.   However their chopped cheese dish was fire and made up for it.

Placed an order for pickup. Was overcharged. Never received my full order. Called the restraunt for them to fix the issue, they said they would issue a refund. Of course they did not. Will call my bank and issue a chargeback. Shame on this restraunt. The waiter/staff do not care about their customers.

Nowon was amazing!! I live nearby and had been dying to try - they did not disappoint. Got the burger, tots, rice cakes and this beautiful chicken sandwich and am still thinking about the whole meal. The staff was also awesome. Will definitely be a regular spot
No comment
Vibe food service all too notch watch out when they start serving beer and other drinks this place will rob your wallet try everything bring everyone
No comment
No comment
No comment
Ordered the burger and strawberry matcha cocktail. Absolutely amazing! Really enjoyed the food and waiter was awesome too.
My all time FAVORITE Korean spot with a menu done right! Every dish is perfect and I can't wait to go back!

they surprised us with a delicious corn tea at the beginning. we got the happy hour special (beer + soju + chicken wings), the fried chicken + caviar, the cheesy jalapeño rice cakes, the steak tartare, the shrimp + avocado dip and the tater tots. Could've skipped the tater tots but everything else was so so great! Truly unique experience

This gem is in the East Village. Amazing food, good service, great small selection of natural wine, good soju bottle options as well as soju cocktails drink selection, cozy ambiance and good price for amazing food. We ordered the guacamole shrimp dip, which was delicious, flavorful and unique. We ordered the chopped cheese rice cakes that were also outstanding, cheesy and so delightfully topped with minced meat and with scallions. We also ordered a side of kimchi which is home made, mild spicy and delicious (had to order an extra side). The fried chicken wings are a must, crunchy skin with a sweet and savory flavor and the juiciest chicken. Simply delicious. The only thing that didn't impress in the menu was the dry aged burger, maybe because it was too much mayo and maybe because the cheese tasted like Kraft cheese...apart from that, everything was beyond delightful and I recommend and I will be back again for sure!

Went here with a few friends for dinner and drinks and we had a great time. The food was amazing and service was top notch. We had the dry age burger, the Jae Mac, chicken sandwich, Shin Ramyun wings, shrimp and avocado dip, and deviled eggs. Everything was delicious but my personal favorites were the Jae Mac and the wings. Aside from the food they also have a really unique drink selection; we went with the golden barley soju and the red rice makgeolli. Both were delicious. Overall it was a great experience and I will definitely be returning soon.

Ok where to begin. I usually don't leave reviews but feel a need to for Nowon. This is by far my favorite restaurant in the city. The food was amazingly good, love their menu. The staff is top notch. They have a really cute outdoor section now and they're just really clean, professional and basically treat you like family. If you haven't been here YOU HAVE TO GO CHECK IT OUT!!!
No comment
Recommend by a friend and so glad we found this gem. We had four small dishes which was perfect for a happy hour meal. Definitely visit the bathroom for the music.
New korean spot in the east village- unique down to earth interior with food to match. Chicken wings and the juk were great, cannot wait to go in again to try other items on the menu!

The Burger with Kimchi Mayo gets first place, very closely followed by all the other dishes we ordered. The numbing cucumber salad was delicious, the charred broccoli finger licking good and the sizzlin' Kimchi rice was super tasty. In all a great experience with excellent service and ambiance on the lower east side. We will be back soon.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Just come for the drinks and bar. Cocktails so tasty - drunken dragons milk is so sweet and creamy with coconut milk and green tea vodka, etc. Great service and bar area. The food itself though was very average and overpriced. Burger was cooked perfectly and very tasty. But both the burger and noodles pretty average and way overpriced for what they were

I loved the vibe in this restaurant, the food is incredible, the drinks are delicious. The appetizers are probably my faves, the mushroom truffle croquettes and the ribs were to die for. Definitely get the pana cotta and the malasadas. We got the whole fish which was soooo good. The service has been great both times I've gone.

We had a lovely pre-theater dinner here. We sat at the bar while we waited for our friends, the drinks were good and the service was attentive. The whole place is very pretty. Service was just right, which is to say neither intrusive nor scarce. The food was very good and the seafood was fresh. For some reason I expected it would be more heavily seasoned but it wasn't, it was just right and flavorful for us. We enjoyed everything

Very interesting design and bar area. Would def recommend going even if its just for the design. The food is mostly fusion food so dont have the expectation of getting authentic food from Macao. The servers there were nice and attentive.

This was my 2nd time dining here - first time was for a friends birthday and it was great! 2nd time the food was SO salty and probably a lot of MSG in it.  The cocktails are good but on the pricey side - $20+ for one cocktail. For the little food we ordered, the bill was around $224 with tip. I was looking forward to dining here, but my opinion has changed since the last time.  Other spots will have better food, although the ambiance here is nice!
No comment
Beautiful setting and great for happy hours after work. The food is not close to Asian so it was a bit underwhelming. Steamed fish was delicious but I'd say overpriced.
No comment
My husband took me here for the first time and was pleasantly pleased. The drinks were on point and so was the food.
No comment

This place had the coolest interior I've seen in a while. The lights were low and the decor amazing. Everything on the menu was in the $$$ range and the food was well made. I enjoyed my meal though I do wish that for the price it came with more that 5 French fries and a scoop of spinach. Our waiter was great he checked on us often and bantered with us at the table  I think if you want a cute, intimate, date night spot this could be it.

This place is great. Located in the mids of china town it is opened late.  And they serve food late hours. Ambience is great. Nice hip pop music. Upstairs. Super sweet waitress Kristine.  Food was limited options but again. It was very late. But it came out perfect. Then we went downstairs. Great music. Not crowded dance floor. And everyone enjoying themselves.  Recommend and will return.

I will honestly say, one of the best nyc dining experiences i have had - from the fish to the apps to the chicken, almost everything was incredible. Service was 6/5 and i loved the decor. 110% will be coming back!!
No comment

Right off the bat, I gotta say the place looks great. Furniture, music, ambiance, servers, everything about this place looks nice. I came here twice just for drinks before, and this was my first time for dinner. And here is why I'm leaving a two stars review: we got food poisoned. We ordered steamed mussels, dumplings and a big red snapper for two. Everything tasted pretty good - besides perhaps a bit too seasoned - but definitely the flavors were good. Too bad the fish was not cooked well and probably even too old. We spent the night in the restroom you can imagine why. Be very careful, and perhaps just come for drinks and music, but I do not recommend the restaurant.

Great decor with trading company ambiance. Love the food especially the crispy fish! Server was very helpful in suggesting drinks and attentive to our needs. Enjoyed the evening with my friend .
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great food, vibes, and service! Everything we had was amazing and the place is super fun and eclectic. Ordered the shrimp dumplings, glass noodles, and steamed shrimp and loved everything! The cocktails are super creative and tasty too!

Amazing ambience. Sat downstairs in the lounge area at a booth and it was really good. Drinks were great. Got a few tequila drinks that hit the spot. The dumplings were really good. I got the African Chicken and the Crispy Whole Fish. The chicken was good chicken but quite underwhelming. Needed the side of hot oil I got. The fish was the best thing. Definitely saved the meal. The vegetable fried rice was just okay. Also needed the hot oil. the ambiance alone is worth a recommendation.
No comment
No comment

Wound up at Macao for post dinner drinks before a night out....John Paul was the best, highly suggest his Mezcal Margaritas! Everybody including management was so attentive throughout the entire visit I will definitely be back (even though I was not even planning on attending this restaurant in the beginning of my night) And that's coming from a bartender!

Let's talk Macao restaurant located in the heart of Chinatown! An amazing gem in the city. The dim lights, the ambiance, the decor, everything about this place is so special (even the cool bathrooms lol). I'm giving this place five stars because of the service!!! The waiters and waitresses were so attentive. They were present throughout the whole dinner experience (asking if we want more drinks? Or, if we were prepared for dinner to be served?). Service was nothing like I experienced before. We had the pleasure of having Liv as our waitress. She was amazing! The food and drinks were also great! (see photo). I highly recommend the tequila drinks on the menu. I didn't take many pictures as you can tell because I enjoyed the experience so much. Please stop by if you're in the area and in the mood for Eurasian cuisine!

The lobster noodles were great! Everything else was average. Service was slow. Maitre'd was slow. Bouncer (for dinner?) was rude and a turn off. Interior decoration an orientalist's wet dream. Crowd was also very strange, a mix of tourists, finance bros, etc.
No comment
This place is tasty and great for groups or a couple!  I had my bday here a few years ago. Drinks are great, octopus is everything I dreamed it would be.
No comment
No comment

I love this place. The food is not the best. I do like the oysters, burger, and fried rice. The drinks were yummy. The place has a really cool vibe. I've been here a few times and I enjoy it every single time.
Great food great drinks.  Kevin and Alex (bartenders) are the best!  Very friendly, knowledgeable, and will definitely come back again.
No comment

The appetizer menu was a compilation of all of the best small plates I know and love. The wine was amazing. Our server was incredible and all of the staff went above and beyond to provide us with an exceptional level of care.
No comment

The service was a little slow, nonetheless, still decent. Spinach dumpling was amazing! The Lobster noodles were great too. The winner of this dinner were the cocktails. They were all balanced and had its distinct flavor combinations that worked so well. The interior was also beautiful. Would recommend to others.

No comment

Good atmosphere, friendly service and forward menu selection. We tried all 3 types of pies, chard octopus, blistered shishtis, and porter house for two, everything is so much fun. I was really surprised that the steak was so delicious. Small ones but a good restaurant for fun. Everyone enjoyed the cocktail.
No comment

This was an overall solid meal and dining experience. We ordered a couple dishes for the table and I liked them all except for the char siu baby back ribs. I LOVE cha siu baos, and have at least a couple stored in my freezer at all times, so I was really excited about the ribs. I felt like they just got the sauce flavoring wrong. To me the ribs were sickly sweet and tasted heavily of hoisin sauce. I wouldn't get those again, but very much enjoyed everything else. The dumplings (shrimp) were tasty, the bok choy was awesome and i loved the flavor. The bacon and shrimp fried rice was my favorite dish of the night. It was kind of unique and just really delicious. The ambiance of the restaurant was nice too. We went around 6:30 and it wasn't very crowded, which was nice.

My friends and I wanted to explore a neighborhood we don't regularly hang out in so we landed on TriBeca and started at Macao. When I walked in the atmosphere upstairs was cozy and sexy. Seemed like it would be nice to sit at the bar. However when it came time to seat the three of us they brought us downstairs to a less lit, less clean area of the restaurant and stuffed us in a corner despite there being an abundance of seating. We only had drinks and apps but had we stayed for dinner it would have been unreasonable. The apps and drinks were good but we got out of there pretty quickly...

The ambiance was really nice. Great for a date night. The drinks were good and the food was good but the menu was a bit limited. Waitress was very nice. Might be a bit overpriced but overall a good spot

Stayed upstairs at bar area.  This restaurant is very picturesque and decorated to theme. Their martinis were good and the staff was welcoming. A little quiet for a Friday night but it was also Easter weekend. Would come back again for food!
No comment

Lobster noodles uhhhmazing. Hakka noodles so so good. Shrimp and scallion dumplings solid. Malasadas with dippping sauce pretty good (as long as you don't compare them to malasadas from Hawaii). Service was A1 .

The most HORRIBLE Experience I ever have my  first time and the bartender was very rude with my friends and I, he was trying to be sarcastic but it wasn't funny at all I don't know he's name but he ruined my friend birthday, he insulted me compared me with other people that I work as a person who work in the service industry you never have tu assume that the everyone is the same way my friends order beers, then he told us that was the last call so he literally run to give me the check so I ask if I can buy i shot for my friend birthday and he say NO cause I'm tired for people like you that come and no leave tip, I was in shock first cause is my First time HERE I just ask for shots, I didn't come here after work get mistreated/prejudge like shit!! The bartender was a white bald dude! Irish looking guy.
The bouncers are so rude and unprofessional.  Once you get past ghetto vibe at the door and disrespectful comments you are greeted by much friendlier patrons and bartenders.

It was one of those afternoons where my friend and I just felt like hopping around to different spots to enjoy the NYC HH/night vibe. In the area and she recommended this gem of a spot since she often came here when worked in the area. First thing I noticed was the dim lighting which I am a huge fan of in restaurants and bars. We sat in the front where there is more of a bar setting but in the back is their restaurant. To be honest.... we did not eat but enjoyed a few of their drinks. One was a spicy style drink which was so good, but I sadly forgot the name of it. Our server was extremely helpful in picking out cocktails and had a funny personality which made the experience that much more enjoyable. I'd love to come back to this place for the atmosphere, drinks, and late-night partying which I hear is a VIBE!!!
No comment

Came here recently for dinner on a Sunday evening and had a wonderful experience! A friend had raved about this place and it did not disappoint. The interior decor is so cool and the place has a nice vibe. Our waitress was a doll and checked on us all night, she was so sweet. The menu is really eclectic and combines many international cuisines. We had the Ants climbing the tree (noodles), chicken & pork dumplings, mushroom croquettes and fried rice. Everything was delicious!! Oh and you must save room for the donut holes with vanilla cream and dulce de leche dessert! Also the drinks were amazing the bar is so cool. Would definitely come back to Macao!
