No comment
Good food, good music. Great service. Never knew this place was here and so happy I tried it.
No comment

We were thankfully seated outback in the outside seating area. It was set up like a picnic which changes with the seasons which seemed really fun and the owner came out to greet us and spoke with us about the bar and it's history for quite some time. We enjoyed our time there.

My wife and I had a small gathering for brunch at the Cabin today and called it Channel the Flannel birthday brunch. We were able to secure a small area in the corner for 8 people which we reserved. For brunch we were recommended the Chicken and Waffles which most of us had. The staff was extremely attentive and the music was awesome.  The food was served nice and hot and was extremely tasty.  Joey the owner was most gracious and was a pleasure to talk to.  All our guests were extremely happy with the hospitality, service and food.  My wife and I will surely revisit and have brunch there again.
No comment

Went here after a get together with friends a few weeks ago, not what I expected! I had the "Not A Caesar Salad" and it looked nothing like the picture. not a lot of dressing and it took a while for all of our food to come out. The atmosphere was okay, and the food wasn't really worth the price. I would not recommend :(

Made a last minute reservation at this place for a quick dinner. Came here roughly around 5 PM and it was pretty empty with the exception of 1 table. We ordered 2 hot toddies which we felt like there was no alcohol in it at all. Even so it tasted great and we didn't mind. We got 3 dishes to share- a brussel sprouts dish, a salmon dish and another dish which I don't remember. Regardless everything tasted amazing and was so flavorful. The service was also attentive and everyone there seemed to be enjoying the food. When we left it started to get packed pretty quickly. Will definitely come here again for the food!

Surprised this place is delicious!! Wow. The decor is for a young crowd. Tried this via the Fever app. We each got three drinks and one brunch dish. We tried the bloody Mary's and I got a mimosa. The drinks were delicious! The Bloody Mary has some nice heat. The mimosa was good too. We ordered the egg white omelette and the biscuits and gravy. Everything came out hot! And quick. Service was great. Our waitress, Payton, was very attentive. Everything was delicious! The eggs were fluffy, the cheese was melted and the scallions were fresh. The arugula on both dishes were lightly dressed, fresh, and yummy! The biscuits were cooked perfectly! Soft and warm on the inside and a little crunch on the outside. The gravy is thick but has incredible flavor. Everything paired so well. Very happy with this place! And for NY the prices are amazing. We will be back. :) Definitely recommend giving this place a try!
No comment
Went for brunch and it was sooo good. The 3 drinks for $10 was great. I thought they wouldnt be strong but i was tipsy after the second one. Would definitely recommend!!

The food was very good. The Mac n cheese brûlée was legit to die for. My only downside to this restaurant is that the portions are SO small that you end up spending a fortune. It would be a good place for like 2/3 people since it is so small BUT for 5 very hungry people we had to order a lot of food. The truffle fries were amazing and the drinks were good too. I loved the atmosphere and the ambience.

Honestly not worth it. Saw it on tik tok and was really excited. The spiked hot cider was good but that's where the good ends. We were sat outside and they assured us there would be heat lamps but when we sat they were turned off to "air out the tent." Over the next hour we asked about 6 times if the heaters could be turned back on yet and were repeatedly told no even though it was 45 degrees out. We were originally told we had to order one food item and then after we did we were told actually it's 2. Which is fine it just should have been clear from the get go. The meatballs were subpar to say the best. The s'mores were cold and burnt. Not a great combo. Definitely not worth the trip!
Went here for my birthday dinner and while the selections were small, they all looked delicious and the meatballs were to die for.
No comment

I was very pleased with the drinks and with the food however I was disappointed in our reservation. We made a reservation and I assumed the back porch area which has a very pretty white tent with white lights would be for reservations and the front area with blue tents would be for walk ins. They made no effort with the front. It's very dark. No lights at all whereas the back is very well lit. I asked the hostess and she said a walk in and of 8 guests came in before us and took over much of the back tent. I would normally give this management strategy a 3 out of 5 stars but it's covid and the employees were lovely. Just think reservations vs walk ins should be handled differently.

This is the best place I could've been. The food was impeccable and the cocktails delicious! The costumer service was away beyond and my waitress was very nice and very attentive. I totally would recommend this place to everyone I know and I would be more than welcome to spread the word to make the Cabin NYC get all the success because it's simply PERFECT!!! Thanks guys for taking such good care of me.

I came to this place with a few friends and I was not impressed at all.. One thing to know about going to this bar was that they didn't have too many options of food in the dinner menu. Also the thing that bothered me was that I really came here for the drinks. But they were being cheap with the alcohol, and they put a giant ice cube  in the small cups! I was hoping they would give us more especially for a $15 drink.  I ordered 21 Questions and Alaskan Salmon fillet. The food was decent but I wasn't too crazy about it. And in the dessert menu is an absolute joke. The s'more is literally a small cube of chocolate with a creamy marshmallow on top, sprinkled with the grand crackers, they used a flame torch to heat it up.  Lastly my friends got the deconstructed apple pie with ice cream..... all we were eating was just tiny bits of everything.  Would not recommend this place.

Such a cute ambiance-cozy on and live music on Friday nights. I recommend making reservations as it gets packed easily. Friendly service and servers were attentive. The menu contains simple but delicious comfort food, just like the restaurant name. The crispy Brussels dipped in brown sugar were so good! The salmon with garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus was perfectly cooked. Deconstructed apple pie was a bit mediocre. Otherwise, I'd come back!
No comment

Small space but make a reservation and you'll be safe. The host and server were incredibly sweet and lovely. The minute I sat down our server came by to inform me that happy hour ends in an hour in case we wanted to get some happy hour prices. I got the mulled wine and the spicy margarita. Both were very strong lol. I've never had a spicy margarita the way it is done here. I ordered the fries and chicken. Both were delicious! The manager (or owner?) came by a few times to confirm all is well and etc which was a nice touch lol. Would def love to come here for brunch!

Came here for girls brunch. Place looks very cozy, the vibe is amazing, they had live DJ., host and staff was very friendly and accommodating. They have yummy drinks, lots of holiday drinks. The food was just ok, I feel they could if have bigger menu with more options to choose from, it was just brunch so I don't know about dinner food it might be better.

I will start by saying that atmosphere and décor is beautiful. My party was seated outdoor under a tent, it very covid safe while still maintaining the vibe. Our waitress was friendly, very descriptive and took the time to ensure that we were taken care of. Unfortunately, after we placed our order for dinner everything else went downhill. The burger was the best thing we had, the meatballs were average and the not Caesar salad was nothing to write home about, not to mention we were charged a dollar for a side of Aioli. Drinks were decent for NYC, however they were served in plastic cups ( I guess this is because of covid). When it came time to order dessert around 8pm, they ran out of their smores dessert. I don't understand how you run out of one, out of two desserts on your entire menu so early on during a Saturday Night service ( especially after your staff was raving about the homemade marshmallow). Additionally, we were charged a cake cutting fee, which is normal, but my issue came when the waiter dropped cake all over the table and practically butchered the cake. Once our bill was paid, we were practically kicked out. I understand that with covid restrictions, it is important to keep to the time limit, but as we walked out, we overheard the staff saying that " we were doing this on purpose, that we were being rude." I truly hate to write this because this is the time were we need to support this industry, but all this experience did was create a bitter taste. I don't think we will be returning again to dine in, maybe we will order a burger to go!
Such nice ambiance and decorations! Food was delicious. I HIGHLY recommend the truffle fries. We were seated promptly and service was great. Will definitely return!
Such a cute ambiance! It's pretty tiny in there but on nice days the backyard is open for dining. The have a little alcove for cute pictures and the lobster toast was amazing.

Needed a bar to catch up with a friend, and I found an amazing bar with an amazing bartender (Hannah), and an amazing vibe (music, people, decor). I will definitely be back! I also heard that there's a Sunday brunch that's retro inspired with great food...yeah, definitely coming back!
No comment
Good casual brunch spot in the East Village. The interior deco is super unique. I love the window seating area! Food came out fast and it was generously priced.

Last night was my 2nd time being there - this time for happy hour. Was seated promptly even tho my friend wasn't there yet - My first server was Christina- super super sweet and attentive- we then had another server didn't catch her name but same wonderful service. The Proper Wild Martini- sooo good!  Apps were delish. We left to go to dinner somewhere else and regretted it- we should've stayed there the rest of the evening. Definitely coming back.
No comment

Went here on a Saturday for brunch and it was pretty good. Wasn't very crowded. The atmosphere was really nice definitely gave you a cabin feel. The tables were a little small for me and it was a little too dark but not bad overall. The food was cool and the drinks were on point. I would love to come back maybe for dinner instead since the brunch menu was a little limited.
No comment

I recommend only coming here for drinks and good service & ambiance. The food was all mediocre. Fried chicken was small and dry, truffle fries were soggy after all the sauce gets served on top, lobster roll was ehh.. I do recommend the Brussel sprouts.
The food isn't my preference, especially for the price. It's cute indoors and decorations. The drinks were okay, nothing special and standard city prices on shots & drinks.

Great place for good food and drinks! Started with a table for 4 at 6pm and ended with a table of 8 in the backyard patio at closing...  Staff was super nice and accommodating all considering. Thank you for a great time!
No comment
This isn't a restaurant just putting it out there !But their little tapas are scrumptious, amazing beer and service, great spot on a quiet street!

column3: Downtown Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: fun atmosphere, good music, quick service, amazing food!
No comment
Everything we had was amazing! Food and cocktails were delightful. And the decor takes the experience to the next level.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Overall the food was alright. the brunch drinks deal is pretty great and made it worth it. But, if not in the neighborhood, it not worth a commute
Almost everything we had was so good!! Drinks were okay. Kinda strong. And the service was great. Would come back.

Had a pleasant time here! Food was amazing drinks are good! Came during brunch food was reasonably priced and they had a $10 3 drink offer on bloody Mary's screwdriver and mimosa and one other, granted it was well well liquor so they're getting the money worth probably won't do it again but had interesting cocktails as well!!' And if you go during HH in the week days and check in you can get 50% off one STANDARD cocktail drink :) so go enjoy!!!!!
Quaint and cozy, and they have the nicest staff. Great spot for a group, with lots of space. Came here with friends for tasty small bites and drinks.

I got here Friday, it was early evening. So, it wasn't packed yet. The bartender was friendly and can fix nice drinks.  When people started fill the place, it was time to leave for us. The young cloud could get loud
No comment

Not a fan of leaving bad reviews, but this place was such a disappointment. All the food was so mediocre. Meatballs lacked flavor, lobster roll had a measly amount of shredded lobster, truffle fries were soggy, watermelon cucumber salad was so soggy. And finally, the fried chicken!!! It was so burnt and flavorless, I can't believe they had the nerve to serve that to anyone. Drinks are also SO expensive. A vodka soda with their cheapest liquor will run you $16, which is the same price of their specialty cocktails. The staff is nice so 2 stars for that.
Super cozy bar. Kinda felt like I was entering the cinnamon challenge with the amount they put on top my cocktail, but overall was a good.

Once you come here, the atmosphere sets a very cozy tone with a very chill vibe. Friendly people, waiters, bartenders will all give out a relaxing feeling to make you at ease. Drink specials that are seasonal...great food for brunch or dinner...just an overall dope spot in the LES!
No comment
Loved the atmosphere! Brought my bf to NY for his bday trip and brunch here was phenomenal!

Absolutely terrible service. Each persons food was brought out at different times (20 minutes apart). This happened at multiple tables. We were told that their serving policy is that the food comes out whenever it is ready (meaning everyone just watches each other eat)
No comment
The food and atmosphere was great. Pricing is typical for NYC. The Brussels sprout and fried chicken was great. Don't order the s'mores though, that was a total letdown.
No comment
The atmosphere and drinks were pretty good. My one complaint is that the food portions were kind of small.
Great food, friendly service, drinks are unique and delicious.  Enjoyed the ambience and the atmosphere with music gave a retro theme with fun music but still allowed for conversation.

An incredible experience and beautiful ambiance. The owner introduced himself to our table and greeted us talking about his vision for his new restaurant. The chef surprised us with their infamous s'mores ganache desert which was out of this world.

I came here with my husband to meet a few friends. We had made reservations for 5:00 PM, however, we arrived at 4:30 PM. We were greeted right away and informed that the kitchen is closed until 5PM, but are more than welcomed to have a seat at the bar. The host was super nice she even asked people to scoot over so that we could sit comfortably, she even brought me a high chair. So sweet of her, she really went the extra mile. While seated at the bar, we met trey or drake (one of the owners of this restaurant) had a couple of drinks so didn't pick up the name correctly, I apologize about that. He was actually our bartender and I thought it was pretty cool that he was working hard like all the other employees, WAY TO SET AN EXAMPLE! He was telling us that he appreciates our visit, which was a nice touch. Once our friends arrived, we were seated at a table, where we were seated was a bit tight, the staff had no problem relocating us to a new table setup which was much more comfortable. The menu does not have a lot of options, however the flavors make up for it! We basically ordered everything off the menu. I wanted dessert first, so I had S'Mores first! It was amazing, they lit it on fire in front of you and brought a bunch of spoons so that we all could share. The waitress we had was so kind and always replenishing our water and checking on us. We had the Crispy Brussels Sprouts, French Fries (both Truffle and regular), the Fried Chicken with Coleslaw, the Salmon, as a second dessert the Apple Pie. On top of all that a bunch load of Mojitos and Spicy Margaritas. The vibe of this place was awesome, I loved the mix of music. There was a live DJ before Dinner started which was cool. I highly recommend this place!!!

Great brunch, great atmosphere, great price. I've been multiple times and never disappointed. The menu isn't huge but the options are all great. Very cool interior decorations and the service is good.

The place itself was super nice and the decor made the entire experience feel very homey. The menu was pretty small and the drink looked super good. The inside seating is a smaller area. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was because trying to make the reservation, the hostess was a little unclear and she did rush us a bit. Overall it was still pretty good.

Food was okay. Had four alcoholic drinks and didn't leave with the slightest buzz. Paid over $50 for alcohol I didnt get. Tried going for a martini and it tasted like juice. If you're going for the drinks, try again.
No comment

Loved this place! Came with a large group and enjoyed their cocktails. While the menu isn't very expansive, everything was good, and we got a bunch to share. The sprouts are awesome! The spicy margarita was also a hit. Very cool vibe, floral decorations, dim lights, and pretty loud (or maybe that was just my party).

I'm so happy I found this establishment on yelp, the ambiance is absolutely beautiful! I decided to go here today for brunch and the outdoor backyard seating is beautiful and comfortable. I highly would recommend this place for a calm cute date night, the food was great. Definitely will be returning especially for the 3 for $10 Brunch drink special. The staff was friendly and very polite/nice. I can't wait to return and try their dinner menu options.

Great ambience and it's hard to find a good nyc spot that puts their specialty cocktails on happy hour until 8pm. My husband and I absolutely loved the old fashions and Prosecco and gin cocktails. Good customer service and we enjoyed the acoustic playlist too. As for food, we recommend the Brussel sprouts, truffle fries, and 2minute fried chicken! Note that you are paying $17 for two small thighs...I was celebrating a special occasion so I didn't mind treating myself! Highly recommend this place.
No comment
Love this place for brunch.  Highly recommend!!!  Love the food, mimosas, menu and the DJ.

Such a great venue. The service and hospitality it's far beyond imaginable. They abide by social distance guidelines. Always aware and attentive to the guest. We had a great experience being the first time there. The drinks and food was outstanding and just overall satisfied with the management and the staff. Will be go to spot.

the place is really nice but the food is super mediocre. i'm not a fan. if you want a place to like hang out and a fun place for drinks, this is your place. if you're looking for really good food, look elsewhere.

Came here for drinks on a random Saturday night and had a blast. The drinks are tasty and strong. The live music was ahhmazing. The owner Joey was a wonderful host and accommodated us. As a result, We booked a last minute bday brunch at the cabin the weekend after and had such a great time. The chicken and waffles, guac toast, biscuits were all so yummy! The staff was incredibly accommodating to our 15+ guest list. Highly recommend for date night, brunch, or just drinks. Thanks for a great time!!

Friendly and warm service. Instafriendly decor. Small portions. Went for a birthday brunch for a friend. Food was decent quality but skinny girl quantity i.e. definitely not enough. Cute spot, maybe worth a visit, feels like it may not be open for the long haul though so visit now or forever speak your peace.

The best restaurant and bar in alphabet city if your in the LES area looking for a elegant place to have a date night or even after work with a few co workers have a drink must come here! The staff are great I highly recommend !! Best of luck to you guys in the future ! Plus we have live music in the back.

Fun spot! It's small so I wouldn't go with too many people but for a small bday party it's an intimate space. Fun to go to with camp friends and good for Instagram! The bartenders are friendly and the cocktails are great. This is a good place to start out.
No comment

Food was good. But the service was bad to the point that you won't care. Called up at 10:15pm on a Saturday night asking when they were open until, and was told the bar is open until 1am and the kitchen is open until 12am. We arrived around 10:45pm and got food and drinks. Everything was good.  Suddenly at 11:20pm when we are about half done with our meal, the manager rushes over like he's clearing the stage at a night club and says we have to finish up and get the bill. His explanation was that there was a "private event" currently going on in the back, and some other gibberish about how we had to leave before them. When I explained to him what I was told on the phone, he said that is true but not on nights when they have private events, and that "he did us a favor" by even serving us at the time we walked in. After we paid the bill he came over (clearly seeing how annoyed we were at his dismissiveness) and said that it was the hostess's fault because she was "new here". Very rich of the manager to just blame his staff and show absolutely zero care or consideration for the customer. But wait, it gets even worse. I told him that this was no way to treat customers, and that at least he could have done something for us to make us feel valued, like taking something off the bill or giving us a free round, etc. His response was "well you got served didn't you! You ate the food". Probably one of the worst service  experiences I have ever had at a restaurant. I know it is COVID and mediocre service is now becoming the new "normal". But there is never any excuse for essentially telling your customers to their faces that their concerns are irrelevant and that they are not valued. No amount of good food could compensate for what I experienced here.
Terrible service. We were seated outside in the rain without a heater at separate tables. The hostess gave us attitude when we tried to sit together and we had to ask for music to be played.

The Cabin is such a dope spot. I went after work with a group of friends and was impressed all the way around. Our server was knowledgable and passionate about menu. He was able to give us insight on cocktails, small plates, and more. We ended up ordering a bunch of apps for the table. They were pretty small, but delicious nonetheless. The woodsy, cabin-like vibes definitely set the mood for a good time. Cocktails were tasty and overall it was an extremely affordable spot. I would definitely go back. It's a great place for large groups! We had about 10 people in our party.
Drinks are delicious. I ordered a whiskey sour which was made properly with an egg white!  ambiance is great!  A little crowded but worth the wait for a seat at the bar!

Found this spot using the Yelp app and decided to try it out for Brunch.  The place did not disappoint.  The atmosphere, music, and food was amazing!  Highly recommend if you want a fun and tasty brunch!

I came here for a Saturday brunch. As soon as I walked in I was loving the vibe - the way it was decorated and even down to the music. Although not bottomless, the 3 drinks for $10 is a great deal. The service was okay, however the food was almost inedible. I got the french toast with a side of bacon. Firstly, I was disappointed in the "seasonal fruits" they added to the plate, then the crust on the French toast was almost impossible to cut through and lacked flavor. The bacon was very rubbery, i ended up leaving half the plate and definitely had to go somewhere else to eat because I was not satisfied.

Recently came here on a whim of instagram photos. The spot itself is a lot smaller than it looks online. Despite that, the waitstaff and the bartender were very cool. In fact! I would say a mixologist not bartender. The drinks were spot on delicious. The food mehhh!. I think they really need to expand the menu, it's very limited with selections. I did enjoy my dish which was the Brussels sprouts and the crab cakes. If the menu expands I'll be sure to check this place out again. Until then, I'm ok.
No comment

Nice ambiance during the holidays to grab a cocktail! Came on a Friday night to catch up with some friends and it was pleasantly un-crowded. Got a few apple cider Moscow mules- delicious! Innovation at its finest

A great place for date night.  We reserved our table for a Saturday night and we were seated right away. The space is super welcoming and dope. The decor is really cool, combing the wood elements and cozy accents with modern art. There's even a very instagram worthy swing by the bathroom to take really cool pictures snd videos with. The bear and cat paintings based on Biggie and Tupac's iconic hip-hop images are great touches especially since they have an amazing old school hiphop/r&b playlist playing at a decent volume in the background. The drinks were amazing, my girlfriend loved the sweet flower which is infused with chamomile syrup and I stuck to 21 questions. The food was also amazing. It's tapas style and the menu encourages sharing, which my girlfriend and I usually like to do in order to be able to try everything. However, next time we agreed we will be getting our own fried chicken because we wanted more! We also loved the Brussels  sprouts and the truffles fries. The meatballs in sauce was very tasty and the added bread was great to drench it in the sauce. We also order the bacon dates and bacon steak. Overall the food and drinks were delicious and we will definitely be returning. Check out my instagram @bryantv.travels to see pictures and videos of our experience at The Cabin NYC.

Came for brunch with friends. Everyone working here is extremely nice and very attentive. The space is cool and the music playing gives the place a great vibe. With all that said Id read about the dinner menu being small portions meant for sharing but brunch was individual dishes. Friend and I both ordered "BIGGIE'S BISCUITS + GRAVY". It was delicious BUT it is one small biscuit for $16. This seems an insane price for such a simple little dish. I probably won't return and not sure Id recommend it unfortunately despite everyone working there being so great! Lower the prices or make the portions bigger. I know its NYC but come on...
Good solid New York brunch option. Tasty dishes and great selection of brunch drinks.
Excellent food and great service. Love the vibe here. Fried chicken and Mac cheese were my favs!

This place is amazing! It's so cute and cozy inside and has an overall wonderful vibe. From the food, to the wine and cocktails, to the exceptional amount of detail that went into designing the place- everything we had from start to finish was delicious and memorable. Definitely check it out! :)
Such a fun brunch place! Great drink deal, food was pretty good though nothing remarkable. What really made it great was the fun playlist and throwback theme.
All I can say is avoid this place. Super cramped. Overpriced. Overly loud music. Mediocre food and an unhelpful wait staff.

In a perfect world, there would be a Cabin NYC on every corner. That way, no matter where you lived, you could roll out of bed, put on the nearest pair of pants, and roll down to grab there amazing food and drinks. Management was so nice to us even when we rolled in 2 minutes before the kitchen was closing . They treated us like family and we got a LA vibe in NY spot. Brussels sprouts were amazing
Amazing. Wood was the best or our trip. There was care in each dish and the passion was evident. Simply amazing in all aspects.
Drinks were okay. Food not so great. The staff is very attentive! They're what brings this up a star.
Loved the music for their throw back brunch!! Had a great time, the food was delicious

A very festive cocktail bar/restaurant in Alphabet City that is ideal for the Fall and leading up to the holidays. They are very true to their theme- there is a tree in the middle of the bar, lots of cute bear decor, and fake mossy grass on the walls. We came on a Sunday afternoon for drinks, and it was pretty crowded and there was a DJ playing some great throwback hits. The biggest downsides were that the by glass wine list was quite short- no Sauvignon Blanc, and each cocktail was $15/$16, which is actually expensive for Alphabet city. We tried the S'mores and apple pie for dessert. Both were great- the S'mores had a chocolate ganache and home made marshmallow cream, and the pie had a nice flaky crust and sweet filling. Will definitely return for drinks!

Recently went there to celebrate my boyfriends birthday and I must say we were both pleasantly surprised. COVID guidelines are adhere to and the seating area was nice and warm. The service was superb and the food was delicious. The hillbilly chili was one of the best chili I've had in a really long time. Overall, the food was great. Will definitely be visiting again.

I would have given this 1 star but Rick showed up and saved the day. In the beginning it was a total sh*t show. Made a reservation for 7:45 and showed up around 7:40. I believe it was the owner who checked us in and asked us to take a seat at the bar while we waited. We were never moved to a table. Another couple arrived at the same time with a reservation and they were never seated after waiting for 30 minutes and decided to leave-telling the owner they were disappointed with their experience. We got drinks- and upon seeing how busy it was and how the service was clearly lacking- we paid out and decided to leave. The bartenders were clearly very busy and rushed, the owner/manager kept yelling at them, and we were in the splash zone when we were sitting at the bar. As we were about to leave- the shift changed, the crowed cleared a bit, Rick became our new bartender, and our experience immediately changed. He gave us waters and new drinks and we were finally able to get food. We ordered the sliders, truffle fries, fried chicken, peach pie, and s'mores. The desserts were top notch!!! Thank you Rick for your excellent customer service and making our experience 10 times better!!!!

It takes a lot for me to write a review but honestly this place deserves this one. Very cute and cozy spot in the East Village with an amazing decor and great drinks and awesome food.  I had the infinity and beyond burger and it was so fresh and tasty. My girlfriends and I each had a different drinks... the service was also  very impressive. I'm all about good service and our waitress was attentive along with the bartenders and manager. Will definitely be back when I'm home in my city

Excellent cocktails! Every cocktail I tasted was excellent. The clover club is perfectly balanced and makes even non gin drinkers love this gin cocktail! Also tasted the old fashioned the lazy daiquiri and the cabin spicy margarita

The atmosphere is great and the food is delicious. It might be the best old fashioned I've ever had. Food is pseudo-tapas based so make sure to order enough to go around (probably 2-3 per person), but it is well worth it to try the whole menu!
No comment

cocktails were great ! i recommend the burrata ! giving it 3 stars for the lovely hostess and great food. our server on the other hand gave us a less than exceptional experience! this place is extremely instagram worthy! so ofcourse we were taking photos! our waitress rudely embarrassed us and told us to sit down and order and to stop taking photos! unprofessional and made us feel extremely unwelcome!

To be honest, I wish I could give this place a 0! The positives of The Cabin are that the ambiance and drinks are amazing. I will give them that.. BUT the customer service is TERRIBLE! I came here to celebrate a friends birthday and from beginning to end We were rushed. There was no communication prior to us arriving about table time or the overall structure of their brunch. There is also no information on their website either. Once we arrived, the aggressiveness of Joe and his team was truly unmatched! Our food and drinks, though tasty were shoved down our throats and they made us painfully aware that they needed us gone ASAP! We definitely will NOT be coming back to this establishment.

The restaurant itself is absolutely beautiful the food is amazing . On top of it all the service was great ask for Lorena best server . She was just lovely /great recommendations. We will definitely be coming back to visit and eat soon Xo THANK YOU !
No comment
No comment

I went to The Cabin last night with my boyfriend. I actually bought a voucher from gilt city for dinner and drinks. The restaurant is very cute and homey. It is small and it has this pretty tree lit with lights in the middle of the restaurant. We made a reservation and we were running late due to traffic and the weather. They were really accommodating and didn't give us a hard time about being late. The menu is meant to be shared. The dishes are organized by vegetables, fish and meat then dessert. Everything we ordered was a sharable plate rather than an entree. We started with the truffle fries. They were great for fries however I didn't taste much truffle. We had the shrimp scampi. It came with three jumbo shrimp. The shrimp were very fresh. We had crab cakes that were really delicious. We also had the jammed up sliders which were a little larger than a typical slider size but delicious. They had a great bacon jam sauce that had a little kick to it. We shared the fried chicken which had great flavor and seasoning. They brought out the chicken with a two minute sand timer and suggested we eat the chicken when the timer runs out to keep the chicken moist. For dessert, we had the bread pudding which was also great. Overall, The Cabin had great food, drinks and service. I will definitely return!

Awesomely unique spot in Manhattan. Cozy atmosphere like you're in a cabin in the Poconos plus a hip-hop vibe! The old fashioned and apple toddy were great and the torched s'mores dessert was to die for. Great place for drinks and sampling the dishes. We'll be back!
Love this place! Food is delicious, drinks are great and the staff are awesome!! Beautiful decor. This place is spot on highly recommend.

Loved it. They just opened a few months ago and the overs were in house greeting people. Even have my gal and I a free shop and sat at our table to get to know us. The food was good and not over priced either. Try the biscuit in gravy. LOVED IT.

Tiny plastic cups at $16 a drink, plastic plates and utensils wrapped in plastic. Felt like I was at a kindergarten pizza party. Outside seating was wet and dirty in a makeshift tent in the backyard. It might just be covid rules & regulations that make this place miserable so I'll give it another shot when things open up again. In the meantime, absolutely do not waste your time here. The truffle mayo was good.

This place is incredible. Was walking by, and the owners are the sweetest people and so humble. Came by on a busy night and having remembered our faces, greeted us and gave us a seat at their VIP table. Drinks, superb. We were also welcomed by their Home made S'mores dessert (which over coats chocolate mousse). IMPECCABLE.

The experience was very underwhelming.   We waited for about 25 minutes with one menu to order drinks at brunch when it was about half full.  The food when it finally arrived took about ten minutes before Our party of four were fully served , which meant a lot of uncomfortable eating while we waited. The food was just ok.  The music was very loud and it seemed that the dj was the only one enjoying it.

This place was phenomenal!! The service from the bartender Mickey and owner Joey was first class. They explained everything dish/drink I inquired about very thoroughly. The food was awesome (I ordered the chicken and waffles with a side of potatoes)! I ordered the Hot Toddy beverage. It was EVERYTHING! The music was so on point! That 90's hip hop and R&B was lit. I stayed an extra 45 minutes just to listen to the music! A must visit!

What a unique place to go to in NYC. They have excellent drinks and great food. Service is always the best. Decor makes you feel like you left NYC for a hot minute! The owner, Joey, is always accommodating and friendly. He keeps the place in tip top shape!

My boyfriend and I LOVED this cozy spot and will definitely be coming back! The drinks were spot on and our fried chicken was so good it melted in our mouths. I would recommend this spot to all my friends I can't wait to come back!!
Ambience is cool and hip. Food though was so so. Took a while for the tea and half and half to arrive.

The cabin has an amazing atmosphere. Great music. There was a dj there when my fiancé and I went for his bday brunch. The owner was supper friendly and very accommodating. Our waitress was pleasant. Food was great and the drinks were also good. Will definitely be back again.

Incredible drinks, food, staff, and vibe. I've lived in NYC my entire life and only wish I found this sooner. Another thing that really makes them stand out is when the entire city was dead (last night) this place had a great crowd and an amazing vibe with music, food, the best drinks in town, and everyone in there singing in unison to a live acoustic version of TLC's "Scrubs". There is something very special about this spot and the staff behind it all. You can tell that they all work together with lots of love.

We went here for brunch this past Saturday wanting to try something new in the east village. Not too crowded but good ambiance, and we were able to get seated right away. The decor is super cute and they had the place decorated nicely for fall. I had the BLT (which was OK - the fries were the best part), and it's a great deal for brunch with 3 rounds of drinks (Bloody Mary, beer, mimosa, or screwdriver) included with your meal (for $10).  Enjoyed the experience and I would go back!

There's no better place in EV for brunch or drinks anytime than the Cabin. This place is so adorable and So insta-worthy. First dates - go here. Impress a girl - go here. Jam to 80s90s on a Sunday afternoon - go here. Happy hours go until 8 4 nights a week. The owner Joey is a kid from the neighborhood who came back to open a place in his old stomping grounds. He's generous and kind and will make sure you have a great meal. For $10 on Sundays u get three drinks (mimosas - screwdrivers Or bloodys) w ur brunch for $10. Crazy! Just stop reading this and go!

Excellent happy hour with great throwback tunes for brunch on sundays, the owner Joey is such a doll and you can really see his vision through the cabin feel. It's a very swanky place with an excellent ambiance and legit one of my favorite bars in the city. You gotta try the drink I've attached. . Oh yea, most of their food is made from scratch

First thing you notice is the great atmosphere. LOVE the way the decor is set up with the fake trees and ivy on the walls. Drinks are great as well! Make sure you get Rick, he's the man! Ask him to make you a penicillin, it's his secret drink and not on the menu. Tastes great and has a tiny kick to it. Have come a few times and love it!

The Ambiance is great! This venue will impress your guests. The title is appropriate for the decor. It's very woodsy and cabin-like when I visited it. It felt warm and cozy. It's quiet enough to have a conversation. Drinks and food are reasonably priced. Not too crowded on a weeknight which makes for great intimate conversation. Great place to meet up for the first time, catch up after a while or something in-between that is financially reasonable.
No comment

Went to the cabin tonight for dinner and drinks with a few friends. When you walk in you can see that the owners took a lot of time to make sure every detail was perfect. There's a big tree in the middle of the restaurant that really makes you feel like you are in a cabin in the woods somewhere. The music was acoustic laid back songs that really set the cabin House mood. We all ordered drinks off the cocktail menu. Our favorites were the spicy margarita and the old fashion. When it came to food we couldn't have been more impressed. The portions were generous and they even served the food with an hourglass (and told us to wait until it ran out so that the food would be perfect to eat) LOVED the attention to detail. I can say that the whole menu was filled with awesome comfort food (I got the fried chicken with spicy honey dipping sauce - incredible) The chicken was crisp and you could tell it was fresh. My friends had the house meatball and the glazed bacon. We ate so much that we had no room for dessert, but the manager (dont remember his name but couldn't have been nicer) came over and asked if it was our first time. When we said yes he asked that we sit tight and came back with a homemade chocolate and marshmallow smore. Ohhhhhhhhh man it was ridiculous. It's a must try, trust me. Really happy we stumbled on this place walking around our neighborhood and we plan on going back this weekend for brunch. The manager said that they do live acoustic music on the weekends, which I'm sure is gonna be a really nice touch. Well done cabin crew, can't wait to come back and try the rest of your menu.  Cheers!

Tl;dr - cocktails are decent and service is good, and while the atmosphere somewhat speaks to a cabin aesthetic, the blasting pop music doesn't necessarily make it as convincing as the name of the restaurant. If you're here with a group, don't bother with the food. We were a group of three and were so SHOCKED with how tiny the portions were, that we just called it quits after the Brussels and truffle fries. Both were tasty, but 100% not worth the price. We asked if the rest of the menu were small portions also, and the waiter replied, "Our plates are meant for sharing for 1 or 2" - which barely made any sense.

This place is awesome! They have a brunch deal where you get THREE cocktails for only $10. That's huge! Food was incredible, great music, awesome staff. The manager came over and chatted with us for a bit about how they change the menu and decor based on the seasons. Can't wait to come back!

Do NOT come here for the food! I visit here over the weekend because it seemed like this place has been reviewed highly. The food portions are TINY and the service staff seemed confused, our orders took so long to come out and all orders came out at different times! I am not sure what is going on here but with so many other places in the area I will not be going back.

My girlfriends and I got brunch here and it was delicious! I got the pancakes which were made from scratch. So so good! Everything on the menu is! The inside is designed really well! It has such a cozy feel to it. We loved it! Our waitress was great and the owner Joey is very friendly and personable. Really amazing spot for brunch! Definitely recommend!!

Incredibly disappointing. For an $80 prefix dinner with only two choices and a mandatory credit hold, I was expecting a good meal at least. Brussel sprouts oily and burned. So sad. We were rushed along as if the 5 open tables around us were going to be filled in the next 30 seconds. Not very romantic for a Valentine's dinner. The waitress brought desserts while my husband was still eating his main course. Inexcusable imo. Within an hour we were done. And done.

Terrible food, everything tastes pre-made/frozen. The truffle fries have NO truffle, the meatballs taste frozen, there's no marrow in the bone marrow, the ravioli is NOT fresh made pasta, it's thick tasteless ravioli, and the s'mores consists of a piece of COLD chocolate! These reviews are clearly false and misleading

I really wanted to like this place but was very disappointed. The decor is awesome and the throwback brunch had great music and a good menu selection. However everything else left something to be desired. First off, there was 1 server for the entire place so she was flustered and not very friendly. She seemed annoyed when we asked for anything. We tried to be helpful and order our drinks and food at 1 time to make life easier for her. My husband doesn't eat gluten or carbs so he asked for no bun with the burger and she hesitantly said okay and he asked if it was possible to substitute the fries for something else and her exact words were "you're already asking for a lot and the kitchen is small so no", he said okay and left it at that. Later when the drinks came, the Diet Coke was flat and we very nicely let her know and asked for a coffee instead she just took everything from the table without saying a word then plopped the coffee down. The burger did indeed come out with a bun but we didn't even bother to say anything and Everyones burgers were well under done (everyone asked for medium or medium well and they all came out medium rare) only 1 person asked for the burger to be cooked more, everyone else just dealt with it. I ordered the eggs and potatoes and they were cold when they arrived but I figured at that point the server would have chopped my head off so I just ate them. Really sad because I really wanted to like this place but unfortunately probably won't go back.

Apres NYC has arrived....awesome time at The Cabin! Great cocktail menu (try the Rustic Mule), brussels sprouts were perfection, and s'mores are a must. Excellent service, super friendly staff, and acoustic music playlist was on point. The perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of nyc to #cabinlife
I had a great time here. Rick the bartender was excellent his hospitality is top notch. The drinks were amazing and the food was even better. I recommend trying the glazed bacon. Yummy!
Love this cute little spot. Came here for drinks and some appetizers and loved the atmosphere and staff. The owner is super friendly too. Great hospitality!

Great place to go with friends or on a date. The way the team pays attention to detail and the decor is awesome.  Start to finish everything is excellent. The Brussel sprouts, bacon, or bone marrow to start. The most amazing and best tasting fried chicken, and who doesn't love s'mores for dessert.  The cocktails are well thought out and absolutely taste amazing.  This is a must try in NYC.
No comment

I would say the cabin is more of a great bar with elevated bar bites/ tapas style plates. The cocktail menu is extensive and uses premium liquors. The food is flavorful, albeit pricey for the portion size. Items like the shrimp scampi and bison meatballs were great standouts and paired amazingly with well crafted cocktails like their speciality mojito. The food was a bit slow to come out but the atmosphere lends well to lively conversations and it's nice to spend time taking in the lovely decor. The service was excellent and Joey, the owner was very inviting, it really made us feel like welcomed guests.
No comment
No comment

So cute! The decor is amazing, definitely a spot to go during the fall/winter. Great please to get drinks before going out with girlfriends. Pass on eating, service at the tables is really tough. Great bartenders though, so nice!
No comment

This place is awesome. Came for drinks with my girlfriend before dinner and had an unreal time. The old fashioned is one of the best I've had ever and was very cheap. Definitely come here. The owner is the man as well. I'll be coming next time for food.
Best goddamn drinks and food! I recommend the ceviche, crispy Brussels, the chicken, and the s'mores dessert!
Place is great! I've been there several times and I'm always pleased. Love the food and servic.

Came here twice. 1st time I had the biscuit and gravy, which was kind of flavorful. Chicken and Waffles was bland and super dry. The 3 for $10 drink special is good. 2nd time we went and got the veggie burger. It was PINK inside and uncooked. Gave it back to the bartender. It looked like CAT food. Bartender didnt take the food off the bill. We still paid for it and decided to not support this biz ever since... dj is always on his phone, too... random vibe...they still got a long ways of figuring it out lol

I checked out the cabin after work the other day to get some food and drinks with a friend. Their food is great and the drinks are good although those are a bit expensive. I'm sure it was the brown sugar but these were the best Brussels I've had in a while. Don't pass on those. The place itself is definitely unique in the area, having a cabin in the middle of the East Village isn't a common find, but it's a cool change from the typical layout in the area. Cozy spot with great food, check it out.
Came in looking for a place to have drinks and small plates on an early saturday evening and the cabin was perfect! There was a live musician and great ambiance.

I typically never leave Yelp reviews, but this place deserves it.  The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, the cocktails are perfectly crafted, and the FOOD... if you don't get the fried chicken you're doing yourself a disservice.  The owner, Julian, checked on us just to check on us and tell us about the place...so rarely does this happen, especially in NYC.  You've gained two loyal, very satisfied customers-- we'll be back!

Came here tonight for happy hour, they have a great drink and food selection. The ambiance is carefully curated-- adorned with wooden walls from Aspen, trees from Minnesota and themed tables. My friend and I ordered off the $8 cocktail menu and tried the brussel sprouts appetizer. All were fantastic. The owner is incredibly friendly and let us sample two additional cocktails and the s'mores dessert. All in all, it was a night to remember! Do yourself a favor and give The Cabin a try.

DO NOT COME HERE FOR THE FOOD!  Ambiance was nice, cozy like a cabin. We sat at the bar and the bartender was also nice. We ordered the cheese and meat plate - 2 cheese and 1 meat. The portions were ridiculous - we got 4 thinly sliced pieces of meat (maybe the size of a half dollar) and 2 tiny wedges of cheese. It was a $22 plate so we expected a lot more! The manager stopped by to ask us how things were and I shared my feelings but he totally defended the portions. Advice to management - don't be so cheap!

First and foremost, walking in I was floored on how much detail was put into everything. Very cool vibes, amazing staff and the food - DELICIOUS! You have to try the thick cut bacon, to die for! The waitresses and bartenders were very courteous and took care of my party and I like no other place has! Dre and his crew were AMAZING! Very chill music and super clean. I highly recommend to any and all!  Thank you! Will def be there again soon!
Greeted at the door which was a nice touch. Food came out very quickly. So much flavor! Definitely choose plates to share.
I wanted to try this place for a while, it was excellent!!  Glaze Bacon wassss INSANEEEE pls try it!!

Probably one of our worst dining experiences in NYC.  We wanted to like this place.  It looked nice from the outside and the menu seemed promising.  However, with the exception of the chicken (was was juicy) and the lovely server, all in all, very disappointing.  The Brussels sprouts were covered in sugar, the ceviche was chewy, truffle fries drenched in mayo (making them soggy) and the chili, wow, hardly any meat in it (see the photo).  Pretty terrible all around. My advice, eat somewhere else.

Loved this place! Such a cozy yet fun vibe. I went on Friday and was delighted that there was a keyboard player and singer for entertainment. They were great, as were the cocktails and ambience! Looking forward to coming by again soon :) great date spot! I didn't try the food but will give it a go at some point!

Today I was finally able to get a table but we had to sit at the bar as there were tables that were reserved (which was totally fine). We ordered our food and it has now been 40 minutes since we received our food. The restaurant is not packed and other tables have gotten their food that ordered after us. Horrible service. Waiters keep telling us food will be out soon. 40 minutes for french toast and eggs. Walked out without our food. Never coming back. Don't recommend ever going there!!
Just needed a quick out from the cold and spotted this on yelp while in a taxi. Jumped out. Avocado toast and French toast were the two orders. Great. Great playlist. Small. Relaxing.
No comment

We happened to stumble into this place on a whim & couldn't be happier with our experience. The atmosphere is cozy, with a warm and friendly vibe...and at the same time is romantic enough for a memorable date. The owner and his staff were very welcoming and helpful & thoroughly explained their recommendations on the menu. It's the perfect place for yummy cocktails and sharing plates! I have to say that the Brussels sprouts were bomb

Clubby brunch spot in the LES. The Eggs and Potatoes were uninspiring, but the other menu items were delicious. Between the Veggie Burger, French Toast and the Fried Chicken, you will get your fair share of gluttony. Throw in the reasonably priced drinks specials and this place becomes rowdy.
Delish cocktails and small plates! Every drink and taste of food was a complete party for my senses. Intimate setting - comfy mountain feel.

This is the first and probably only yelp review I'll ever write- normally I'd never take the time to do this but this dude at The Cabin found a way to charge me $23 dollars for a mezcal margarita. It was 4pm, we were the only people in there, we chatted about the fact that I'm also a bartender, and when the check came, he charged $18 for the mezcal, $3 for ICE (no joke) and tax. 3 margaritas came to $68 before tip. I'm just really freaked out that this guy thought that was regular. There was a margarita on the menu for $16 and we actually asked for less ingredients than was in that one. Still feel so slimed by this dude's weird strategy.

Had an amazing time! From the custom table in the corner.. to the bacon that was so good i had to order twice... the Ceviche was great! Brussels sprouts and fried chicken are must haves ! Finished it off with two old fashions! Well done will be back !

We made a reservation for a birthday party of 15. We get there and the owner says that we have to be at least 21 to order food. In making the reservations, nobody said this rule. We got kicked out. I will not support such an establishment. By the way, the menu was trash.
Loved the ambience of this place. Food was good, definitely would recommend their truffle fries they were delicious. Would come back again.

I have to say I was pretty disappointed at the brunch I had.   The music was so loud that I couldn't hear the person across the table from me and the place wasn't even crowded.  Had the biscuits with sausage gravy.  They were tasteless and dry and covered in ground cooked crumbled sausage with almost no "gravy" so it did nothing to make the biscuits better.   First time in my life I didn't finish a plate of biscuits and sausage gravy. The BLT was slightly better but pretty mediocre.   Server was pleasant.  The decor kitschy but nothing that made up for the poor food.  It didn't help that they don't even serve an unsweetened ice tea to help wash the food down with.

I've never eaten somewhere in the city I wouldn't go back to, but this brunch cinched it. A large party was seated next to my friend and I, but they were polite and we were more than happy to squish in for them. The waitress had been nice enough to combine two tiny tables so all our plates could fit without sliding off, but within 10 minutes of our entrees arriving, the manager (I assume) interrupted us to tell us we had to move because he needed the table. He was very pushy with no apology for the inconvenience of moving our meal onto a table that couldn't accommodate it. He started taking plates to make everything fit and things got uncomfortable quickly. Once we were resettled, I asked if our drinks could be taken off the bill. The manager (?) was immediately irate and insisted that they didn't do that. He tried to push complimentary shots, which I declined. He returned again to push the shots, which I declined again. He repeatedly put his hand on my shoulder, insisting that I take a drink, finally offering champagne. I wanted to try and salvage what had initially been a nice brunch, so I agreed. In the end, the difference between the champagne and the drinks I asked him to comp was $9. He ended the experience by dropping off the check and informing us that there was a reservation waiting for our table, but "no rush." I still tipped well because our waitress really wasn't responsible for the manager's poor planning or poor manners. Save yourself the aggravation and find another spot for brunch!

I was really excited to try this place, seemed right up my ally with the hygge vibe. The ambiance is really cool and the staff is super nice but wow the food was not good. I had French toast which was two small pieces of toast that were burnt, one was a thick and super soggy piece and the other was thin and hard. Also had to ask for maple syrup and got a condiment cup that was less than a quarter full of syrup.. for $14 it was laughable that this passed as a meal. My friend had the biscuits and gravy which were yummy but portions were too small for that as well. With so many quality brunch options in the area there's no excuse for bad food and high prices. Seems like a place for drinks only

It is difficult to decide on what my favorite aspect of this place is; between the creative menu, fantastic food, incredible signature cocktails, or the overall ambiance combined with the staff. The cabin does not disappoint in any facet and will definitely be back to check out brunch and the rest of the menu.

Great atmosphere and fun throwback brunch! Extremely friendly and accommodating staff. Because the restaurant is so new, It seems like they have some logistical issues to work out, but that didn't interfere with us having a fantastic experience.

Atmosphere was awesome ! Our group got the cabin classic drinks for happy hour which were phenomenal. Owner was really awesome came to our table several times to explain how the plates were made. Brussels sprouts are a must have.

We came for brunch on a Saturday. Very nice staff but drinks took a while to get and the music was way too loud for a Saturday afternoon. Two people in our party ordered burgers and got their food first, the other two orders came out 5 minutes later and was cold (you would think the late food would be hot!). Aside from the burgers, we ordered: chicken & waffle and the scrambler with a side of bacon. The waffle was ice cold, the sweet butter looked unappetising and the chicken was too hot to eat. A side of bacon was also cold. We were all super hungry and ate it anyway. The waitress was nice but I wouldn't go back. Too many other places in the East Village to bother.
No comment

Great new bar in the East Village, food and drinks were great without breaking the bank definitely recommend coming and checking it out. The staff is great and welcoming, you won't regret coming back to The Cabin

The Cabin is awesome, I would highly recommend. Something EV has been missing for a long time; a cool place you can hang out with friends that has a great HH and cocktails. Staff were energetic, friendly and really genuine!
Brand new bar in LES. Was one of the first customers this week. Had an old fasioned and it was great. Super clean & modern place. Staff is super nice.

When you come here, keep in mind it's just a bar. I don't consider this place a restaurant. It's very tiny and very loud. The drinks were not worth the money. Please don't order the Mac n cheese it's so bad!
Wow! Great food in the right portions. Super fun atmosphere and tasty drinks. I highly recommend this place!
No comment

Terrible service.  I'm sitting at the bar by myself after a hard week at work.   The bartender whose name is I think Melissa just spent an enormous effort and time talking to the couple to the left of me and the couple to the right of me.  She made my drink and totally forgot to put in my food order and just gave me the "oh my god I'm so sorry I promise it will come out fast".  This place is not that busy!  My partner and I live 2 blocks away and thought I would try it but probably won't come back.  Good luck guys!  There are lots of other places around here who enjoy our business as we eat out every night!
No comment
Very cool tapas bar. Really unique naturalistic ambiance. Helped me appear to be a 'cool' uncle when I took my niece out there.

Amazing location, great costumer services. Rick the bartender did a superb job making our anniversary even more amazing. The chef and owner were very attentive. The truffle fries, cheese board, and s'more was divine. Highly recommend.

The food was amazing, as was the staff and the experience itself! The brunch on the weekends is a throw back theme, with food such as the saved by the breakfast, full house pancakes and my favorite meal - Biggie's Biscuits + Gravy! Definitely recommend going for brunch, or happy hour!

This place is is great! I had the BEST pumpkin bisque (forgot to take a pic) I've had. Loved the seasonal drinks and the owner, Joey was super friendly! Bartenders were fabulous and made great Bevs!! Will be back for dinner!

Visiting NYC from Virginia Beach VA, came across "The Cabin NYC". This place is amazing. Great STAFF, food, drinks and they had  live local music!! This place was the perfect place to take my lady out for the night. Great overall atmosphere. The staff did a great job. Next time I visit, I will make it my priority to visit again!!!

The food is outstanding and the environment is superb. When it comes to ambiance this place excels. I was told they chance the interior design for each season. I would highly recommend this establishment. The brussel sprouts are fire. The service is next level. The owner Dre, goes above and beyond and Gloria is excels in service. I highly recommend!

I had such a great time! The atmosphere, the ambiance, the décor and omg THE FOOD!! THE FOOD WAS SOOO GOOD! That fried chicken and those truffle fires, BOMB!!! Will definitely go back! Not to mention the staff was so welcoming and I couldn't have asked for a better experience.

The whole place feels like it was designed for people to take Instagram pictures at it. It's completely out of place in the neighborhood, and feels like the worst kind of bar that is unfortunately on the rise in every city in the country (super kitschy, trying to make a niche, instead of just focusing on being a good place to hang out). Really bad-- and loud-- music (think: if there was a Spotify station called "acoustic Caucasian covers of pop songs"). The staff was friendly, and the happy hour price was good, but damn is the concept wack.
Chill music and amazing friend chicken. Joey was the best and made amazing food recommendations! Will def come back for brunch
delicious food, but small portions. interesting, yummy drinks! cool interior making you feel far outside of the busy nyc.
Great food ! I wasn't expecting it to be small inside but it doesn't matter at all once I tasted the delicious food. The truffle fries are to die for!
Great vibe, great decor, great food! The staff was friendly and we had a lovely chat with the owner.

Found The Cabin on an online search and i'm so glad i came in here. beautiful atmosphere, great food, incredibly nice staff, great happy hour deals, only downside was the portion sizes were a littttle small. I would suggest ordering four dishes off the menu for 2 people to leave full. their own Cabin beer was great.
The truffle fries are delicious! Highly recommend. Sangria is really good! Sliders are the only ok food on the menu. Everything else is blah!

First and foremost the waiter rick was amazing . At first I was apprehensive do to the limited selecting on the menu but I was wrong everything was well thought out and everything I order was amazing ... had to post while at the table , a surprising gem in the city

If I could give this place six stars I would! The cabin has three primary beauties, the ambience,the  delicious cuisine, and of course the stellar staff. First,let's start with the design. The restaurant achieves the look of a cozy, warm cabin, which gives you a break from the rough and grimy city outside it's doors. It is anything but basic, and I would definitely recommend going here if you need a change of scenery from your regular bar and dining atmosphere. Second, and probably most important, the cuisine. These portions are great to share, but while you can just eat them on your own- I think it makes for a much more fun experience if you gather a couple friends, order everything on the menu, and share the food. My personal recommendations are the Brussel sprouts (oh my god, I dream of it), The chili, and last but not least- the truffle fries. I've never had better truffle fries my entire life, they were so plump and soft on the inside and had a golden crunch on the outside- topped with the perfect amount of toppings. Don't skip out on the dessert either. Share a s'mores with friends- it's an interesting take and a unique experience. The staff are very kind and accommodating too. I will be returning to the cabin very soon =)

The music is way to loud for a brunch atmosphere. We ordered entrees that all included eggs and it took more than 35 minutes to get our food which is a ridiculous amount of time to wait for eggs. The only plus side of this place is the drinks. The entrees for brunch are extremely small and just average. Would not recommend to come here. I for sure will not be coming back!

We came across the cabin and fell in love with it! The owner is a great host and isn't afraid to step in and help whenever or wherever needed. Our bartender Hanna was so friendly and makes the best drinks you'll ever have. We ordered the charcuterie board that was so delicious. This is a definite place to stop I promise you'll have as great of an experience as we did.

Very strange experience at brunch. The coffee was terrible and weak. I'm OK with small portions for brunch, but the quality has to be excellent. This was not the case. The bacon was rubbery, the oatmeal came with only a couple of apple slices on top. The only thing that was acceptable was the avocado toast and it's kind of hard to mess that up. Also, three drinks for $10 is a good deal. Maybe it's great at other times, but I wouldn't recommend this place for brunch.

Food and service were good, but portions made no sense. Everything is designed for sharing but some appetizers were bigger than entrees. Enough brussels sprouts for 4 people, only 5 bacon wrapped dates, and 3 meatballs (for our party of 2). Not to mention the tables are way too small for a restaurant that encourages sharing where you can have 4-6 plates on the table at once for 2 people.  They also were out of butternut squash for the ravioli. The substitute ravioli was tasty but not what we came for. The worst part was that there are FOUR TVs in the very small restaurant. Why?! A restaurant called "the cabin" and there are four televisions, all showing different sports. Beyond distracting and completely off theme. Bathroom was also messy and very dark.

what an absolute gem. we came here for the impeccable happy hour special and were met with incredibly kind and perceptive wait staff, fabulous drinks, and cute n kitschy ambience. i highly recommend for dates, happy hours, and drinks before dinner.

This place is very good. Cocktails have thought to them and taste great. We did the 80/90's brunch and had a great time. The service was very good and friendly. The food is good (side of bacon was excellent) but I don't recommend sausage gravy...

This place was super cute but there was only one waiter. also there was a dj at brunch which i thought was fun but then he just would constantly switch up the music with no warning or flow of any kind, and ended up turning up the volume so much that my friend and i could not even hear each other speak.
The Cabin has great curb appeal and interior design, however the kitchen production is slow and just okay quality for brunch.

Loved this bar/restaurant! Though the menu is a bit on the pricey side, the cocktails are unique and I plan to return solely for the delicious drinks! The ambiance is EVERYTHING - casual but also chic and fun. Great for small groups (I would max at 5 people). Perfect place to come to after work or on the weekend to catch up with a friend.

This is probably the cutest spot I have had the pleasure of stumbling across. Had brunch on Sunday, the throw-back music was phenomenal the food was quick and delicious....very fresh and tasty. The service was very attentive without being pushy Will definitely be back to try dinner as the brunch exceeded my expectations.
Love this place, back for the second time in the past two weeks for the steel cut oats!! Very cool interior and three drinks with any entree !!

Brunch with wife, son, grandson, visiting mother of son in law. Excellent food--- burgers, french toast, breakfast club omelette.  Owner came by to say hi. One burger was 15 minutes behind the rest of the food.  Complained to waitress.  Chef came out to apologize profusely.  Even offered to make some food for 8 month old grandson.  Apology accepted.  One time can happen anywhere.  Sent neighbors there next day and they were very happy.

Love the whimsical/cabin theme here. Came here with my group of friends to celebrate a birthday and the management/wait staff were very friendly. The food and drinks were enjoyable but could maybe be bigger portion size. I love the decor and areas where you can "Instagram". Overall, solid spot.

This used to be a fantastic neighborhood bar (Dorian Gray) with lots of character and charm. It has now become yet another douchy bar with no atmosphere, soon to become the gathering place for all the bros and frat guys... a real shame!

Cute new place. A bit small but they seem to use the space well. The staff were nice and checked in a few times. Seems like they're ironing out some kinks as they've just opened but this place has some good potential as a cozy date spot.
It was kind of like Instagram took a poop in there. Smoke and mirrors with below average brunch, but the staff was really nice there.
It's hard to find a spot with great food AND drinks, but the Cabin definitely has both! Truffle fries and sprouts are a must have. And you can't go wrong with the Old Fashioned, delish.

A cute and cozy location, far different from anything in the neighborhood. They've got great food and an array of tasty cocktails. It's definitely the new go to brunch spot with lots of good vibes all around. They've got an incredible chef... and PSA, I highly recommend those pancakes!

Probably one of the worst dining experiences I have ever had. The staff was extremely rude and unprofessional. We had made a reservation for 15 and though we only wanted food we were asked to leave for not ordering any alcohol. Though the cabin is a bar, it is also a restaurant and should be able to accommodate both. Worst service and worst workers don't come here if you're looking for a nice venue. Absolutely trashy and a waste of your time
This is a great place to dine in NYC-loved the Spicy Cajun Margarita and the brussel sprouts are amazing!!! Love the atmosphere and the staff is stellar!

I took my wife there last night to celebrate our 18th year weeding anniversary, meet with one of the co- owner a (short guy) and told me I was not going to be disappointed with the food and drinks. He was right the food was good and so was the drinks, my wife and I had an awesome time. Their staff was very attentive and the ambiance is very cool.

The aura, the vibe, the food, the drinks  the staff the music, the ambiance  its just everything!!! I went afterwork by myself to for a vibe and they didn't disappoint.  If you're  into that rustic, chill, jazz like vibe.. with great drinks and food THIS IS THE SPOT  FOR YOU!

We came to the Cabin for brunch after finding that the other restaurant we had intended to go to was far too crowded. The decor is interesting and we got a  kick out of the 90s theme menu dishes. I had Pac's potatoes and eggs and my boyfriend had the biscuits and gravy. The food was good but nothing special, and the portion sizes were too small for the price. The side of bacon was $5 and was only 1  strip! Three mimosas/ bloody Mary's/ house lagers for $10 is a good deal if you want to drink a lot, but I would have rather had a brunch discount on one of the intriguing specialty cocktails.

This place is over priced for their small  portion of food. They have full pancakes on their menu and we got one pancake that was flat with nothing to it looked like it was missing baking soda. Nothing fluffy about it at all. My friend and I will never be returning to this place. The only reason they got  one star was for the music.

The Cabin is a trendy spot in NYC with great food and cocktails. Their version of a Moscow Mule is to die for and a must try. The cabin is now a must every time I come into the city.-- don't skip out on dessert

This is my new favorite bar! It is absolutely stunning inside, the food is beyond delicious, the bartenders get super creative with their drinks (which are also always on point), the location is perfect especially for people living in the boroughs, and most importantly the staff is friendly and welcoming. I am definitely celebrating my upcoming birthday here! Highly recommend!!!!!!

This place is amazing. Not your typical bar. It was obvious that great service and having a great atmosphere was the priority. Decor was very cool and unique. Fried chicken, brussels sprouts, and truffle fries were to die for. Had a Rustic Mule and Cabin Lager and really enjoyed both. Definitely recommend it, I will be back.

ceviche and brussels sprouts are mad yum but live music tonight (4/6/2019) was very disturbing; not sure if you regularly allow ed sheeran d**k-rider to play live to advertise but his voice was very annoying and loud...if you are paying him maybe you guys should consider another performer :---)
No comment
Great spot to hang with friends or family. Good pizza and awesome drinks. Go here !!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is my fourth or fifth times at Roberta's, and the quality of the pizza is as consistent as ever. We got a couple of pies The White Guys and The Bee Sting both delicious. If you enjoy a thin crust pizza make sure to come here. I recommend making reservations my party has to wait for about an hour before being seated - we went to a bar close by to kill time.
No comment
No comment

A must have for wood fired pizza addicts. Cool place to hang with friends and chill with cold local beers and amazing menu item, all made from scratch. Don't miss out on the Stracciatella appetite, with a side of honey.   Service is great too! Can't wait to be back soon.

Roberta's Bee Stinger Pizza is a unique and delicious pizza, a pizza named after its two main ingredients: spicy sopressata and hot honey. The combination of these two flavors creates the perfect balance of sweet and spicy
No comment

No comment
No comment
Very solid place for personal sized pizza! Love the decor/ambiance, they even have a podcasting room in the back, very cool!
No comment
No comment
No comment
If you can get in to Roberta's, it's well worth it! The pizza is top notch and tasty! Drinks were a little overpowering and I couldn't finish mine. Overall a great spot to try!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great pizza! I ate carbs and it was worth every bite. The drinks were phenomenal and I wouldn't think this picnic like restaurant would have these amazing drinks and yummiest pizza.... Staff were nice and attentive. Bathroom was clean
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Enjoyed my first visit to this site.  The vibe reminds me of the East Village.  The service was a very slow, however, the food was good. My favorite cocktail, the Bloody Mary, was on point. Ordered the popular bee sting pizza and was not disappointed. After the meal,  I visited the busy Tiki Bar for a few more cocktails.  The brunch menu looked enticing enough for my next visit.
10/10 would absolutely recommend. Good service, fun vibe and decor, and FANTASTIC pizza. So delicious and addictive. 100% recommend this place. Make a reservation.
No comment

No comment

The pizza is ultra-thin ultra-thin ultra-thin Bee Sting is embellished with honey and the overall flavor is very rich That's all, folks marinated meat with Basil, fragrant but not greasy. The dough is super thin and full of flavor
No comment
No comment
Excellent food. Best pizza ever. Duck ragu was a religious experience. Really cute bartender. Love the Christmas lights and the spooky dolls. I could eat (and drink) here every single day.

Best pizza in NYC hands down! The bee sting is the best pizza I've had in years. Pretty much all their pizzas are tasty and you won't be disappointed. I do admit it's pricey as heck. But totally worth it!

Such an incredible gem for authentic New York style thin crust pizza! I've missed pizza the most since going dairy-free, and I respect that Roberta's has a cheese-free pizza menu option, proving they believe in their sauce and crust. It comes with spices and I opted to add basil. The sauce is perfect and so is the crust! There are a bunch of well thought out cheese and topping variations as well. I went with a whole pie since they're the size of a regular medium/small, and I had a few slices of leftovers. The space is huge, eclectic, and the patio looks like an amazing summer drinks vibe. There was a bit of a wait on a Saturday night for two, but nothing more than 20 minutes. Well worth it!

Haven't been here in years probably like 5 why I don't know because it's so dam good! Had the Bee Sting and it's as good as I remember it was. Salad was delicious too. Washed it down with a craft beer and the meal was perfection. Server was spot on, knew when to stick her nose in and when to leave me to my devouring my meal. If your into pizza, beer and a place with a cool vibe let me know I might take you out there.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The Roberta's experience has improved a lot over the years. If you don't want to wait for table service you can just get drinks in the back, pick up pizza from the takeout window, and eat it at a picnic table (weather permitting... although there are some heated/covered options as well). It used to be a massive hassle and a long wait all the time but it's much better now. The pizza is solid, of course (but you already knew that).
Pizza's good, but you could get it anywhere else, honestly. The experience is made by the outdoor experience, the great wait staff and general ambience! Come for the food, stay for the party

No comment
