No comment
Roberta's is a one-of-a-kind gem that you are fortunate to find and enjoy their food.  The pizza with the whole egg on top is really good. I would recommend going.
Nice pizza. I went to dine alone - sat at the high bench area stool bar thing. Cozy atmosphere. Friendly, fast service. I didn't feel awkward - even pre drink
No comment
No comment
Great pizza. Had the widow maker and the best seller Margarita. Very crispy and delicious crust with good cheese.

Loved this pizza restaurant and have been back both times I visited NYC this year. The pizza is delicious with  very fresh ingredients.  The margarita was pretty tasty too. Located right off Williamsburg Pier so it's a nice place to pop into before or after the boat ride. Service was good and the restaurant setup is in a nice spot.
The Korn pizza???? Best pizza my friend and I have ever had. Their other pizzas were pretty average but man we can't stop thinking about that Korn.

Not even exaggerating when I write this: the BEST pizza I've ever had in my life. The bee sting pizza...*chefs kiss*. Every day that I don't eat this pizza again is a day wasted in my opinion. I have nothing else to say about this place.
No comment

How do I write a review for the best pizza in brooklyn? Start with the anchovies bread and butter. I don't even like anchovies and I gobbled this up like it was bread from the last supper.  next we ordered the bee sting, white guy, and supreme. Skip the supreme bc its ingredients aren't that different than your supermarket frozen pizza, but the bee sting with its subtle honey flavor and a hint of spice was fantastic. I've never had a pizza like that. And if you like white pizza then def get that too - add some chili flakes and you'll be in heaven
No comment

I haven't been here for years, but it's good to see it has not lost any of its charm nor has the food changed. We got some salads to start, which were both really good. Loved the cucumber particularly. The sever gave us some olives for waiting, which was very much appreciated. Overall a good experience as always!
No comment

Favorite pizza spot in the city. I love the original one with honey. They were so good! Perfect crust and flavor and cheese, just everything. I can't wait to go back and eat here. I hav found my absolutely favorite pizza spot.
Still thinking about the Bee Sting and the White Guy. Have always ordered pick up/delivery so haven't had the full experience yet, but always so so good!

I heard seen great things online about Roberta's and finally ordered a pizza. I must say $25 for this size pizza is a bit hefty. That being said, the bee sting pizza was fantastic. The hot honey on pizza was completely new to me and was so good. Realistically this pizza would fill up 2 MAYBE 3 adults. Pricey for pizza but worth trying for sure.
Great pie, laid back environment. Always packed.
My food was undercooked and very salty. Service was super bad took about 15 minutes to serve me even though there were quite literally no one in there.

Honestly it's hard to review Roberta's. The pizza is good, the vibe is good. The wait is always long. And the pizza is overpriced. If it wasn't for the price I would probably bump them up a star. I can't knock them cause I get the business logic but damn walking out with a $25 pie you can finish yourself is always kind of crazy

Really excellent pizzeria specializing in Neapolitan style pizzas. Delicious charred crust and very high quality ingredients.  A must visit. I stumbled upon this place over ten years ago and it has gotten even better with age. Love it!

What a fun find! Came here because I had a gift card for $40 to use and was super pleasantly surprised by my experience. The food was super good, I'm still thinking about those marinated cucumbers (yes, cucumbers, who knew?), and the pizzas were phenomenal! The servers were also really helpful and when the pizza was taking a bit long, the server brought us out some more bread which was crispy and yummy, too. :) Overall, great service environment, great food, and good drinks (that Savage Garden mezcal cocktail rocks!) Roberta's is a win, for sure!
Best bee sting pizza ever! A little difficult to contact but worth the effort.
Knocking one star off for the prices, everything else is totally fine.  Now Yelp is telling me to add more characters so here you go

Delicious pizza in the heart of Bushwick. I recommend the Bee Sting! Spicy and sweet. There's tables outside to eat in the summer so I usually come here to hang then
Amazing pizza. Tastes like your are eating in Italy . Staff is a bit grumpy and off putting but food is good.
No comment

Friendly staff and great pizza. I got the bee sting and really enjoyed it for it's novelty. The crust is seriously good. It's thin but fluffy--kind of like that brick-oven floury naan style of crust. I can't wait to try their more savory options as the bee sting is more geared towards a unique experience (which is 10/10) than if you're starving for a slice. Highly recommended!
No comment

Most inconspicuous building on the block. Slightly reserved yet delightfully sweet and attentive staff. AMAZING New-American style pizza done with a Brooklyn flair.
Super fun place.  Great bar and food was delicious.  Loved the ambiance.  Had the oyster mushrooms which were delicious and the radatiore pasta was yummy too.  Pizza was good.
No comment

Soooo goood. Was a 35 minute wait for the honey pizza with the little gem salad but there was plenty of seating indoors And outdoors to grab a drink and wait. Great people watching. Food might seem a bit bougie and overpriced for some New Yorker standards but it's Robertas! You come for the experience, music, and patio space.
Simply my favorite pizza place in nyc.  Love the style & flavors on every pie I've had !

The pizza here was absolutely delicious. I love any pizza that has honey drizzled on it and I love they offer many different flavor styles. A bit too expensive for me though in a city full of amazing affordable pizza, however it was certainly tasty.
Loved the bee sting- a little pricey for pizza and tastes better fresh. Recommend eating at the restaurant. Ate out so I don't know about the service and ambiance!

Awesome place! Great vibe, friendly staff, and the food / drinks are delicious. My friends grabbed pizzas and I got the cacio e pepe pasta. The pasta was cooked to a perfect al dente and the flavor was *muah (chefs kiss)*. The pasta portion seemed a bit small, but I was comfortably full when I finished. The pizza sizes are good for 1-2 people (I'd probably say 1 pizza for a hungry adult or 2 pizzas for 3 adults #math). Definitely recommend.

It's fine? It certainly isn't bad, but for how wildly popular it is, I would have expected more. There's plenty of wood fired pizza spots that'll give you a similar dough and the toppings aren't so out of the box creative that you have to go there. Feels like a lot of the popularity is around the aesthetics.

Terrible service and disgusting male staff especially an asshole who completely complained about a tip that he truly didn't deserve. The young woman was a sweetheart and understood completely about our situation. I wish we gave her the tip personally. Please make her the manager to teach that gentrified asshole and others a lesson. Coming from someone who owns multiple locations of high end restaurants, you picked the wrong bone with someone tonight. I'll make sure that anyone I know who lives in the area wouldn't ever go again and boycotts your restaurant. If I can give it a 0 stars, I would. Never would go back ever again.

Um excuse me?! The pizza here is soooo good that even when my boyfriend and I were eating outside in the freezing cold, it was still so delicious. We were outside because it was during early COVID and business just started opening up again. I'm yet to go back now that it's fully open so I'm excited to try it again. Definitely one of the few good pizza places in my opinion!

Wonderful pizza's! Fantastically friendly staff, and tts a great atmosphere. I think I can say it's the best pizza in Williamsburg
Love this place! The best pizzas, pastas, and service, we come from the city so it's worth the trek. Always a good place to go for incredible food and ambience :)

Service (getting pizza) was fairly slow. However, everything tried here from the drinks (as a BM connoisseur it was not the best but always love a house made mix!) to the cucumber salad to the pizza was delicious. The dough was cooked to absolute perfection, the ratios of toppings (they subbed duck prosciutto on our Bee Sting) were perfections proportioned. The hype around this place is real. Even their atmosphere is fun and inviting. Def recommend if you're looking for an uplifting fun vibe with great food and drinks.
Can't go wrong with Roberta's! Amazing pizza, good, drinks and bk hipster vibes! Try the bee sting it's a best seller and my personal fav! Call for waiting list if it's the weekend.
Got the bee sting delivered. The pizza was certainly good but not extremely memorable I'd say. The crust had a lovely smokey flavor from being charred if you're into that.

Love Roberta's consistently delicious fresh food, margarita and red pizza are my favorites also love the gem salad.
Awesome location but rude service. The food is good. I don't know what else to say, why can't I just post that?

We used Roberta's to run a team event virtually, first shipping folks the pizzas, and then running the event.  The pizzas themselves were great, the event was super entertaining, and aside from some of the pizzas being late to their folks, the overall event was wonderful.  Would highly recommend!

Came here twice now and it's been an awesome experience both times. The pizzas are all amazing you can't go wrong. There are a few apps that I tried and both were awesome a little weird but worth a try. Bee sting classic.

I'd heard of the long lines and wait times but we showed up on a Sunday evening around 6pm and it was only half full dining room, music was a bit loud but we were immediately seated. We decided on the marissa tomeito and it was fantastic! Perfectly cooked pizza with a bit of char on the crust, soft yet chewy, the sauce was tangy but not over spiced or herbed, just clean tomato flavor. One of the best pizzas I've ever had. And we've had all of the best pizzas in New Haven Connecticut

My new pizza spot, everything about this place is so original. Before 5pm only pies which is good,  cause the topping and that thin crust is everything.  I have tried the dinner menu yet but I will be back

The Widowmaker pizza has ingredients that really pair well together to have an amazing tasting pizza! but i think a 5 year old could have cut the pizza better than the person who cut my pizza. The kids loved this pizza the best!
Bee Stinger pizza is AMAZING. Definitely eat here.
Absolutely DELISH and creative pizzas and great vibes in the restaurant. They really have it all!

I lost my mind when I had the bee sting pizza.  I don't eat pork, and the restaurant was more than happy to swap out for mushrooms.  Loved the hot honey on the pizza.  Burns so good! Service was wonderful, the music was a little uncomfortable at times, one song sounded like a car horn leaning on the horn the whole time, aside from that and the slanted table we had a wonderful time

Love that the entrance is so unassuming. Really good pizza (the bee sting is my fave) and the outdoor patio is such a cute and beautiful place. Recommend for get togethers or a date! Can't wait to take all my friends here. Casual, straight forward, with an edgy ambiance!

Super cool place and the pies are better than you could imagine. Go or miss out on the best pizza..

Absolutely love this place!! It's such a staple. Always crowded (for a good reason) the pizza is so so so good. Get the bee sting! Cheese plate was underwhelming but it was my fault for ordering that at a pizzeria. There's also a really cool little tiki bar attached that you can wait in Wednesday through Sunday. Great during the summertime
Love the hot honey pies from here! Great spot to take my friends from out of town when they visit Bushwick because it's a classic!

Love Roberta's. Very kind and responsible staff. Pizza is very expensive and so are drinks but they are very generous with the alcohol servings

Their prices are now outrageous. I hadn't been in a few years.. I mean I get it times are tough but nothing was as tough as my burnt, charred crust on my $22 pie. Absolutely ridiculous to even expect to give this to a customer and think they'd be satisfied.

Excellent food, but a little overpriced and honestly, a lot of yuppies just being obnoxious these days in there.  That is what has changed over the last ten years...  but happy to report the quality of the product hasn't budged. However, I will brave anything for that Stracciatella and the Lil Stinker. Service is great. Just feel bad for those young waiters constantly having to interface with the miserable clientele. Be ready to spend 150 to have a perfect time, and  Tip big! They Deserve it!

Ehh it's more hype than anything else lol. Pizzas good and beer & wine selection is decent. Neighborhood feel is a plus, also they're pet friendly.
Brooklyn staple, the service is great and an eclectic group of people frequents. the margarita pie is my favorite
The place is so cute and the pizza is always fresh! The outdoor patio is nice and sunny the crowd is nice too!

Whenever I am having guests and they ask me to take them to a good pizza place, I bring them to Roberta's. The pizza here is so dam good. And not just the way they make it, it is the place and the service all together making Roberta's to a 5 stars pizza place.
one of my favorite places. i like to bring my dog when its warm. such a cool vibe . always busy and service is quick.  love roberta's!

Incredible spot for food and ambience. The pizza is some of the best i've had in NYC and their little gem salad is not to be missed. Very cute spot in an unassuming spot nestled between Williamsburg and Bushwick. Go on a nice day and sit out in their tiki bar area to eat, you won't be disappointed.
This place is great, the food, the food is freekin awesome, the crew working the floor kick ass.  If you are in Brooklyn make a stop.

Love the patio space here but no matter where you sit the food is going to be great. The salad is so well dressed & the meatballs have the perfect touch of spice. All the pizzas I've tried so far are amazing too, but they are on the smaller side so if you aren't getting any apps/additional dishes a party of 2 would definitely need 2 pizzas to share.

Easy, delicious, and a neighborhood game changer.Robertas are seriously good pizza. The Bee Sting is delicious.
Delicious pizza with interesting flavors. Quick service too. A neighborhood fave. Bee Sting Pizza is so good.
Fuck that's delicious. Just classic. Phenomenal ambience and food flavor. Bee Sting highly recommended
Roberta's is my local fave! Order the stracciatella to start and get the bee sting pizza! So delicious, fresh and filling

Met a friend here and thought I'd try it again since my last time, 8 years ago, was a disaster with a rude waiter who made it very difficult for us to get our change back (which would have resulted in a 65% tip that he conveniently pocketed). But the pizza was good at that time, well it is consistent with the rude staff but unfortunately not with the good pizza as it was burnt this time and pretty inedible. I don't like pizza in general but if I have to eat one it has to be from Roberta's! Perfect dough/toppings ratio, great flavor.

We drive all the way from Jersey city at least 2x per month for their amazing pizza. You need to make a reservation in advance if you want to sit inside. Their pizza is out of this world.

Good pizza. The place is noisy because it's so popular. Pizza isn't the best but it's definitely better than a lot of pizzerias in the area. Don't order delivery. The cost of the food isn't worth it, eat at the restaurant with friends so you can feel like at least you paid for atmosphere.
Olive oil cake was super strange. But otherwise good. Variety of options on the pizza side.

The ongoing debate for me is what is the best late night snack: pizza vs. chicken? Well, pizza won today, so decided to try Roberta's Bee Sting pizza! The portion size was perfect for late night snack! The crust is more on the thin side. There is a great spice to the Pepperoni and the cheese was very savory! I wish the delivery came quicker as my pizza was little cold:( but still, the pizza is great. I will try to go there in person next time to try their pizza right off the oven!
Pizza, spaghetti, meatballs , service was great and I love the ambience. Outdoor seating is available.

This is some of the best pizza I have ever had in NY. I always get the Bee Sting Pizza, it is the perfect combination of sweet and savory the pizza is both light but filling, I recommend one pizza per person. I first had this pizza at the Brooklyn location and I'm so happy that Caviar now delivers to Manhattan. Definitely a must try for Pizza in NYC.

Roberta's was my first stop when visiting NY and it won't be again. The pizza was good but we started the meal with this $16 pile of soggy lettuce. The markup on this salad is unbelievable. It was hard to wrap my head around this and just enjoy the pizza. Very over priced.

It seems like the quality of the pizza had gone down since the last time I was here, few years ago. The first round of pizzas were very burnt and we didn't realize that until we started eating. The second time around was a bit better, but pizza was still very thin and not as great as I remembered it to be.

You can't go wrong with Roberta's! We snagged a Saturday brunch reservation on the patio last weekend and were seated at a picnic table in their cute space. Between the 5 of us, we shared a plate of bread, a salad, three pizzas, two pastas, two desserts and a large bottle of wine (of course!). The signature bee sting is a must, especially if it's your first time at Roberta's. The White and Greens pizza is one of my favorites. Full of flavor and not heavy like some of the other pizzas. The cacio e pepe was perfectly creamy and the rigatoni had a slight kick to the red sauce. If you have room for dessert, get the sticky toffee pudding!

Finally visited Roberta's for the first time today after hearing so much about it, and I wasn't at all disappointed. From the outside of the restaurant, you wouldn't even realize that behind the old graffiti filled entrance, there is a restaurant. I ordered the Famous Original Pizza with Jalapeños and Olives and it was sooo good. Delicious!

I love Roberta's so much. Perfect crust perfect amount of toppings. It's my favorite pizza.

Great pizza. Cooks in about 3 minutes in their very hot ovens. Delicious. Try the original location if you're in Bushwick, but pizza is good at all the locations.
Best pizza in Bushwick . It's hard to add more context than that . The staff is friendly and during the summer the next door patio seating brings a cool crowd.

Pizza was amazing service was cool nice place to hang out. Friendly people that work and hangout

column3: North San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: Stopped by on a Friday afternoon and ordered our pizzas on the restaurant side before grabbing outdoor seating. I was most excited to try the Bee Sting. I'm a sucker for honey on pizza. The pizza was good but I felt it was missing a little something extra. Roberta's was recommended by multiple friends so I'm happy I stopped by to see what the hype was about.

The place has a good amount of outside seating. Came on a Monday night at 6:00pm and we were able to get a table with no problem. We ordered some drinks. A beer and a Banana hammock. The banana hammock had Bourbon in it. It was a really good drink. Not sweet very tasty. We are the two pies. The  Bee Sting pizza was amazing. The Margarita was OK. Our waitress was awesome. It was an all around great experience
Best pizza ever!! Amazing cocktails as well. I got the mezcal cocktail- it was delicious :) right by the water too, a gorgeous little gem.

Can't believe I've never reviewed this spot! Everything is always amazing!!!! I heard the chef and cooks mostly have been there 10+ years.... makes sense ...the consistency is, well... consistent! It's like that one reliable friend you don't talk to on a regular basis but whenever you do it's like no time has passed.

Roberta's is a classic pizza spot in Bushwick and I will never get tired of going. I try a different pizza every time I go and I've never been disappointed. Aside from pizza, there got some pretty great appetizers as well. I recommend the marinated cucumber salad for something unique and fresh.

Food is great, they had ample space for outdoor dining while maintaining social distancing. Had previously made a reservation and was seated right away ( friday afternoon) Bee sting pizza with hot honey is a must!
Cure your hangover with a  Bloody Mary and the hot honey pizza. Usually busy but easy to get a table for 2. Service fluctuates - sometimes it's amazing, sometimes i just feel judged...

Roberta's is the place to be for relaxing, friendly Brooklyn vibes and decor and absolutely great pizza. Well, one pizza in particular- the bee sting. We've tried several different menu items and when it comes to the pie, the other flavors don't stand a chance next to the bee sting. Get your own, you won't want to share. All the apps are good and they make surprisingly delicious seasonal salads and soup. They do pick up and delivery and I even ordered my friend a surprise pizza delivery sent to Cleveland through goodbelly. She said it shipped well! So if you're quarantined too far to get it hot, there's still a way to enjoy this Brooklyn gem across state lines!

I love pizza and I have my favorites. Roberta's is in such a cool area in Bushwick which creates a vibe. This place is what put me into honey on pizza! Who would have known. So cool. Grab a pie and sit outside to enjoy the vibe. Then walk around Bushwick and look at the cool graffiti. Perfect Saturday afternoon.

I've never felt this way before :( I was greeted at the door by a troll that reminded me of shailene woodley... I've never felt more ugly. The quality of the ingredients was fantastic. Everything was made with imported saffron, I was so upset. The tiki bar was desolate, not a soul in sight. It was so crowded breathing was an impossibility!! I'm so overwhelmed right now. I was on a date. My mom said it was a lovely experience. They played opera at such a low volume it sounded like people dying in a department store fire, the melodic tones set the mood for my meal. This experience brought up a lot of questions for me. I'm thinking I might be lesbian....

The original trendsetter and it's easy to know why. Bee sting pizza is still unbeaten. Go to.

So happy that they were open for pick up orders during Covid 19 pandemic! I was soooo in the mood for my lil-stinker pizza !

Ordered the bee sting, classic and the speck. Personally, I prefered the speck pie but all 3 were pretty good. I would think eating it fresh out of the oven would be even better. Grubhub, while convenient, doesn't do it justice. Will be back, in person.

Service is great, food was decent, but for some reason they don't let you know when your order is ready, so my pizza got cold when I picked it up :(

No comment

I ordered delivery from Roberta's, and unfortunately, I was highly disappointed. My greatest point of contention was the size of the pie, which is only 12 inches. To charge approximately $20 for a 12 inch pie is quite excessive, I think. Second of all, their crust. I've had a number of pies in the Bedstuy, Bushwick, Queens, and lower Manhattan areas, and so I am confident in my abilities to distinguish between a well-cooked crust and a burnt crust. This crust was definitely burnt in many parts of the pie. Yet somehow, the pie had an extreme amount of flop. Confused on that one. The delivery was on time, so I cannot take any points away from them on that one. The ingredients were also pretty good, albeit not as plentiful as they should have been. I am giving them a 2-star review due to the size of the pie in relation to the cost, the poorly-cooked crust, and under-serving the toppings.
Ughhhh love and miss robertas, best pizza ever from Bushwick...

Had to try the pizza here even though so far out of Manhattan because I have been hearing about it being the best for so long. We went for lunch on a Wednesday and made a reservation although unnecessary, there were several empty tables. The outside of the restaurant is pretty raw, it doesn't seem like a restaurant I would go into if I was just walking by, but that's part of the vibe being in Bushwick. Their outdoor seating was very cute, with a garden with picnic tables and bar with a very specific 70s hippies vibe. The pizza was very good, it had a perfect Neapolitan crust and the offerings for the toppings were both original and authentic and fresh for the classics. We tried a margherita and a cheesus christ adding speck. They were both delicious although very expensive, especially for being in Bushwick near not much else. That would be my criticism, especially since adding the speck was $5 and you can see from the picture attached how much was put on it. The service was pretty good as the servers were all extremely friendly even though one pizza came out about 5 minutes after the other. Overall, I think it was a good experience to try it out but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back considering you can find similar pizzas in Manhattan for the same price.
Jason Kraft rules. The pizza is fuego. Service is nice. The boar lasagna is a must. House made amaro is out of this mfin world on GAWD.

Love their backyard "patio" with picnic tables in the summer. Interior is also nice - kinda grunge but make it hipster (we are in Bushwick after all). Amazing pizza, creative toppings, good drinks. Great place to bring a friend visiting from our of town to make you look cool.
The pizza here is soooooooo damn good. Amazing pizza. I loved the cheesus Christ. It's a white pizza. Mouthwatering. Loved this place. Downside is the long wait because it's that good!

Roberta's is so delicious every time we go! The service has always been on point, love the drinks & obviously the pizza is freakin delicious .. if you want cozy, intimate, dark wood vibes and a delectable night .. head to Roberta's!!

Amazing pizza and great beer selection! If you want to give it a go, make a reservation before, they get full quick. The pizzas were so good, go out of your comfort zone and order two or three and try them, they combine such great flavors - definitely recommend checking this place out!
The new location in Williamsburg is awesome.  Going back again soon.  Loved it.  I ate inside this summer.  I don't like outside eating it creeps me out.  Has the margarita pizza and sticky buns.
We arrived during their pizza only hour and decided to get some drinks, split a pizza, and wait until the dinner menu came out. I'm so glad we did... Everything we got was delicious!

The pizza at Roberta's was absolutely awesome. It was as good as advertised- maybe even better (don't sleep on that baby romaine salad either). Minus one star for the rude staff though. We're not college student/hipsters from W'burg (that's a thing right?) or tourists from Minnesota. We wouldn't return because we won't stand for getting talked down to by restaurant staff... Have some respect people.

Always a hit. One of the best brick oven pizzas. Service is good. Although, i wish the tables were a little bigger. Most of our food couldn't fit on the table and their chairs are a little uncomfortable
No comment

Could eat here everyday, all day. LOVE ROBERTAS!! Virtually everything is made in house - super fresh. The service is outstanding, the quality of all the food is ridiculously above average. We had the Stracciatella, Bucatini Cacio e Pepe, Ribs, Meatballs, Strip Steak (as good as any steakhouse), Bee Sting and Rosso pizzas, little gem salad, marinated cucumbers - everything stands up and there was no weakness. Amazing this place continually puts forth such a great product in a cool environment with very attentive service.
Ordered GC and had to remove all the cheese from it just to make it edible. Extremely salty ! So disappointed. Roberta's used be our to go.

Roberta's is possibly my favorite spot in all of New York City when it comes to a damn good neapolitan pie. I'm a sucker for honey pizza, so I may be a bit bias, but the bee sting pizza is SO DANG GOOD! I always take people from out of town to Roberta's and hands down they always love the honey pizza. Roberta's is the perfect recipe for a nice pie, nice local beer, and good vibes. Can't recommend this establishment enough! Keep it up!!

I wasn't expecting much in all honesty. But when our pizzas came out -- OMG! I was floored! You could taste every ounce of the love that they put into each pizza pie. Literally tasted like I was in Heaven! Go there and experience Roberta's!!

Extremely rude staff. Pizza was completed and we didn't receive it for at least 20 minutes while standing in their waiting area continually being shooed out of the way very rudely by multiple staff members. Finally went to the cashier who snatched our ticket and grabbed our cold pizza from a delivery bag. Called our order in asking for a cheese pizza (we'd never been before so weren't familiar with the menu choices). Seems we received the Old Faithful that was super spicy and not edible for those sensitive to spicy foods. Get the Bee Sting. Don't question it, it's gonna be delicious. The patio area gets really busy but a great time with cool people from the area.

Grade "A" pizza shop semi-hidden on a side street in the Bushwick neighborhoods of Brooklyn. Roberta's has an excellent and spacious backyard area with a lively and semi-divey vibe. Great place to hang and stiff your mouth with friends. The pizza is well crafted with an assortment of creative and fresh ingredients.

After reading reviews, I decided to try the Bee sting which is off menu. It's meant to have a sweet but spicy kick to it. The pizza was a thin crust that looks like a margherita. But it didn't have that sweet spiciness that I was looking forward to. It was tasty, but it didn't seem like an out of the ordinary special type of taste. It honestly tasted like just a good margherita pizza (with the addition of meat). At least it was still good!

I enjoyed myself at this establishment , I ate mostly appetizers and the drinks were great. Wish I hadn't eaten already before getting there. The atmosphere was great and I enjoyed my waiter she was so nice

If you ever find yourself in Bushwick, Brooklyn. Check out "Roberta's". It's a super cute outdoors pizza spot. I discovered this spot with a friend earlier this summer, where we enjoyed the ambience, food and service. I encourage you to make reservations since there's always a long wait time. Out of the 3 times we've been, 2 times we're excellent service, this last time was not great. Our order was never actually placed and waited over an hour for food to arrive. However, I would rate it closer to a 4, let's say 3.98 due to this last experience.

Elegant. Elegant pizza. If you are ordering anything but the Bee Sting (which doesn't appear on the menu) you are not living your best life... hashtag or otherwise. The atmosphere here is electric and trendy. The service is great and attentive. While it is a bit noisy, quiet restaurants are empty and usually have bad food. I choose a busy place like this. Be prepared for a bit of a wait if going during peak times.

This place is always super busy so call ahead to see what the vibe is! But it's the best pizza you can get in brooklyn that's not in the typical greasy NY slice style. It's more of a delicate flatbread style. The bee sting is a genius pie that everybody should try. Every pie here is amazing to tell the truth. Me and my friends always come here and order every single pie. The staff is also very nice! A bit overpriced but what are you gonna do, it is what it is! They also sell pizza making kits which are fun but it's wayyy better when they make it in their oven!

Take out and dining in the car!! Lol but either way the pizza was good. We got the Bee sting and Speckenwolf. Both were good but just be aware that Speckenwolf has a lotttt of onions and if you DO NOT eat onions (like myself) then opt out from this choice unless you just want to try it and pick the onions out (that's what I did ‍). I think Bee sting does taste better.. it's a combination of honey and a little spicy. A must try!

Sat at the bar area and enjoyed the bee sting pizza and had a delicious orange wine with it as well! Had no trouble eating the entire pizza alone. Cute and intimate space!

One of the best pizzeria in Brooklyn. The crust is thin if that's what you like. They make the pizza in the front and it's baked in the oven. The pie is a perfect size (not too big or small) to share with someone or eat on your own. The atmosphere and interior is cozy. I went during the day on a weekday so there wasn't a long wait.

In the unsettled battle between Paulie Gees and Roberta's I gotta say I vote for Roberta's. Walked over to Roberta's the other night to get the beesting and went down the block for a bottle of red wine to pair with it. Been going here for about 11 years. I remember when there was nothing around here.

this could be the best pizza in bklyn but is not. i asked for a margherita and i got a carbon pizza. 7 points out of 10. -1 because is the most expensive in bklyn, -1 because was badly over burn and tasted like charcoal. -1 because they gave to me inside a box and said nothing. i could say u guys ruined my lunch but i wont say it.

It's so popular for a reason. Roberta's offers tasty wood fired pies in a hip setting. They do offer a nice amount of outdoor space, that in the summer is a fun spot for events (the frozen margaritas are key).  They also have a take out shop next door, where you can get a pizza to go and stake out some of the outdoor seating (reserved for this purpose) to avoid any ridiculous wait times for table service.  Inside, I enjoy sitting in the Atrium. I recommend the Bee Sting Pizza (chili and honey featured) and the Speckenwolf (white pie with speck). I will say that it is always packed, and often touristy as well. As someone who has lived in the neighborhood for years, I find myself only going when an out of town friend wants to check it out. Or utilizing their delivery option!
No comment

I don't understand the hype around Roberta's. I tried dining there two times and both were disappointing experiences. My first experience with Roberta's started when I was doing a Pizza Crawl through Brooklyn. We hit six spots that day and Roberta's was last on our list. We wanted to end it with a bang. But I must admit Roberta's was the worst experience of the day. To start off, we put our names down for a table inside so we could have their so called full service restaurant experience. After an hour of waiting, they text us saying they were no longer seating tables inside as they had reached full capacity, they then recommended that we get a pie at their take out window, which was absolutely packed. After another 40 minutes of impatiently waiting, we go to check in on our order since we hadn't been called yet and our pizza is on the counter, gathering dust. When we open the pizza box, much to our dismay, the pizza was undercooked and soggy. The ingredients used to make the so called best pizza in Brooklyn were alright and the crust was be biggest disappointment. The pizza was cold, soggy and lacked flavor. I figured they were having a bad day. After all, how could the best pizza in Brooklyn, reviewed by popular established guides like Michelin, be the worst pizza of the day? I gave them the benefit of the doubt. Two months later, when tasked to organize a pizza event for my company, I thought of no other place than Roberta's. The OG Roberta's in Bushwick. I figured that would be the best place to eat really good pizza, indulge in some refreshing cocktails, and have an overall great vibe. Boy was I wrong! Made the reservation two weeks ahead of time since we were a big group. Confirmed the reservation the day before and I kid you not, 3 hours before the reservation they text me saying that "Unfortunately Roberta's full service restaurant will be closed tonight. Our pizza Take Out and Tiki bar will remain open as well as indoor self service seating. Deepest apologies for the inconvenience." That's it. I tried calling the restaurant and no one even picked up. I'm not mad, just extremely disappointed. It's a completely unreliable restaurant that hasn't shown much love or hospitality to its customers. They kinda just think they are above everyone else. I expected a better experience with Roberta's. It's a shame because I haven't even been able to really eat there and I already have a negative desire to ever try going there again.
No comment
Food was great (spicy honey pizza was brilliant), atmosphere even better. Get the ASAP Julio.
Extremely good food but very expensive considering it's pizza; but great chill spot to link with friends

Tiny, tasty, EXPENSIVE pizza. These pizzas are pretty, I'll admit that much, but they are expensive for their size. I am a born and raised new yorker and can tell you this is a manhattan priced pizzeria set up in Bushwick. They are personal pan-sized, if you are curious.

Just happen to stumble across Roberta's on Uber Eats and was surprised. The pizza is very good! Would recommend!

Honestly, I feel like Roberta is trying to tell me something about my weight based off this sized pie.  The "little gems" salad was stupidly over priced and ended up being 8 pieces of lettuce and a cup of dressing. Overpriced hype. Not epic

One of our favorite pizza places in all the boroughs. May even be the best. The pizza is always perfectly done and the portions are perfect. The speciality pizzas are amazing and the Bee Sting is a crowd favorite and we also highly recommend. May be a little pricey for the portion but the service is fast and the pizza is always hot and just crispy enough so it's not floppy and never burnt
So so so good and still so fun in COVID. Also dog friendly so I love bringing my pup here to socialize
Hands down best brick oven pizza in BK. Great ambiance and tons of seating indoor and out. Great for large parties or intimate date spot.

Easily the best Neapolitan pizza in New York. We got the Famous Original and The Bee Sting. The hard cheese on the FO is perfectly tangy and the honey on the BS is perfectly sweet. Can't wait to go back.

A nice pizza place in Brooklyn that's very hipster. They have a lot of graffiti out front and two fire pits out on the street that makes the block very smoky. There is a "garden" where I find people sitting on benches drinking beer and a storefront where you can order to take out or delivery. They also have a restroom there in addition to selling various baked goods and their own merchandises. I tried the beastmaster and was delicious! The pizza is thin and the dough is soft. The beastmaster comes with pieces of sausages, onions, and jalapenos with a hint of sourness. It is very difficult to find parking there, but good thing I found one because I ate in the car thinking there was no sit-in area except for a bench right in front of the store.

After having an average, ridiculously priced meal in Midtown I asked our concierge to send us to an excellent restaurant that was offbeat, and not very expensive. He sent us to Roberta's. When we arrived we thought that Uber had gone to the wrong address. We pulled up to what looked like the old CBGB's, but in the industrial section of Williamsburg. I guess that appearances can be deceiving. We enjoyed a fabulous meal in a most unusual location. We sat outdoors on a cool evening, and rubbed shoulders with some of the coolest people ever. Women were all Katy Perry clones with dyed black hair, vintage dresses, and amazing tat's. The males were all David Byrne clones clad in bespoke flannel shirts, skinny jeans, and well coiffed beards. Our meal was excellent, and it consisted of Salad's, Pizza's, and Sicilian wine. If you have not been to Roberta's run there asap.

Totally lives up to the hype! Super friendly service, tasty cocktails, and the pizza is incredible. I got the Bee Sting on my server's recommendation and it was delicious-- the perfect meld of spicy and savory! My server was super attentive and lovely - I came here by myself and he did such a great job of making me feel welcome and taken care of. The best part - they are super dog friendly and my puppy was a big fan of the pizza as well!

It's a well known pizza restaurant in Bushwick, Brooklyn surrounded by warehouses. Saw a famous person here before. There's a restaurant area, takeout area, and beer garden area, and a DJ area. It was busy so without a reservation we ordered our pizzas in the takeout area and took it to the patio DJ area. Loved all three of the pizzas that i tried: famous original, margherita, and bee sting. Bee sting stood out because it was slightly sweet and slightly spicy. Would come back.

I hate how worth the hype this place is. It's literally the best pizza I've ever had in my life, no exaggeration. The prices are above average for the area but for fancier pizza it's completely reasonable. The pies are in between a personal size and a standard small so you want to get several to share.  Wait times can get crazy but it's always worth it. If you're unable to snag a reservation the place offers a ton of informal outdoor seating. They also make great drinks.

The pizza is GOOD. SO GOOD. The crust is thin and crispy and I love that it has some nice bubbles and char. The middle isn't soggy like some other Neapolitan pies. Best way to judge pizza is by their simplest pies. Their margarita was excellent, no need for all the toppings, cheese, and frou frou. Anything will taste good if you dump a ton of cheese on and melt it. Like the margarita, the beesting is actually quite simple and delicious. You'll get hit with the honey and finish with a lingering chili spice. Eat in or order delivery, either way you're guaranteed a wait. That's the only downside because I don't know if I would wait 1.5-2 hours to eat it.

Lives up to the hype! Pizza is delicious. Crust is crispy, variety of toppings, sauce is flavorful. Perfect sauce to cheese ratio. It can get pretty crowded on the weekends. There's also an option to pick up if you want to grab take out and avoid the long wait (ours was an hour on a Saturday afternoon around 12-1pm). I'm curious to see if the other Roberta's that opened up compares to the original.

Yum, Yum and Yum.  Place gets PACKED, so keep this in mind.  The bar side is first come first serve, so since it was my husband and I we grabbed a couple of beers and waited for a spot to open up.  The beer menu is excellent, with some interested choices that I have not seen elsewhere.  We started with the Stracciatella with grilled batard.  It comes with olive oil- and OMG shut the front door.  I could eat this every day for the rest of my life.  It was delicious.  We then shared a special the server suggested when we asked what she liked the best.  We added prosciutto, which was legit.  It is a little expensive, but we had a wonderful meal and enjoyed the ambiance.
